95-AM.jpeg?width=450&name=How%20to%20Manage%20YouTube%20Comments-Feb-03-2022-05-25-25-95-AM.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn1@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-26-52-014_95814300094cd893.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Manage%20YouTube%20Comments-4.jpeg?width=450&name=How%20to%20Manage%20YouTube%20Comments-4.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn34@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-49-470_022aee9a82ef88e3.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Manage%20YouTube%20Comments-Feb-03-2022-05-25-26-98-AM.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn91@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-54-303_50c458fb9a24f689.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Manage%20YouTube%20Comments-2.jpeg?width=415&name=How%20to%20Manage%20YouTube%20Comments-2.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn41@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-52-948_a674e97be00fc99d.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/7e8681b3-9162-45a4-b6a1-f33ff244a78a.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn84@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-53-229_61f66f8328bd53cd.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fyoutube-comments&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn80@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-56-874_feaac1224660c825.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246408226},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"How to Write a Press Release [Free Press Release Template + Examples]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/press-release-template-ht","description":"<p>In today's world, brands have to generate their own buzz. Consumers aren't waiting for the daily newspaper anymore to get their news. Instead, they're scanning headlines on Twitter, Facebook, and other social media platforms.</p> \n<p>One way to control the narrative surrounding your brand is through press releases. Whether it's sharing a new product release or changes in your organizational structure, a regular cadence of meaningful news can help a company stand out and build mindshare with journalists over time.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=b7c60f4b-f797-44ee-978e-5ffedefb398c&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"Download Now: Free Press Release Template\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b7c60f4b-f797-44ee-978e-5ffedefb398c.png\" /></a></p> \n<p>In this post, we'll discuss:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/press-release-template-ht#what-is-press-release\">What is a press release?</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/press-release-template-ht#types-of-press-releases\">Types of Press Releases</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/press-release-template-ht#press-release-format\">Sample Press Release Format</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/press-release-template-ht#how-to-write-press-release\">How to Write a Press Release</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/press-release-template-ht#press-release-template\">Press Release Template</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/press-release-template-ht#press-release-examples\">Press Release Examples</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/press-release-template-ht#tips-for-publishing\">Tips for Publishing Press Releases</a></li> \n</ul> \n<p></p> \n<a></a> \n<h2>What is a press release/news release?</h2> \n<p>A press release is an official statement (written or recorded) that an organization issues to the news media and beyond. Whether we call it a \"press release,\" a \"press statement,\" a \"news release,\" or a \"media release,\" we're always talking about the same basic thing.</p> \n<p>While the heading should contain action verbs, the first paragraph should answer the \"who,\" \"what,\" \"why,\" and \"where.\" The press release should also contain understandable language and a quote.</p> \n<p>Most press releases are succinct at just a page long – two pages tops. Ultimately, companies want to provide enough information so that news outlets have sufficient material for publishing their own stories about whatever the company is announcing in the release.</p> \n<p>One thing to remember is that press releases live in the public domain, which means your stakeholders and customers can see them.</p> \n<p>So, instead of thinking of a press release solely as a ticket to earning news coverage, consider it as a valuable piece of marketing content.</p> \n<a></a> \n<p>While there's no cut-and-dried formula for what a press release should include, here are a few types of occasions to help you carve out a focus for your press release and determine what content would help you broadcast your news in the best way:</p> \n<p></p> \n<h3>Product Launches</h3> \n<p>The product launch type of press release is valuable to get the word out about the new solutions your organization is offering to consumers.</p> \n<p>It should emphasize the product's specs, pricing, availability, and any other details that may be valuable to consumers.</p> \n<h3>Mergers and Acquisitions</h3> \n<p>Organizational change is noteworthy enough to warrant a press release, especially for informing current and future stakeholders about the growth and trajectory of a company.</p> \n<p>To announce an acquisition or merger, include details about all organizations involved, information about the merger or acquisition, and quotes from the leadership teams.</p> \n<h3>Product Updates</h3> \n<p>Similar to a new product launch, product updates and expansions are also ripe for promotion. Explain what the change is, why it was made, and how it benefits the user.</p> \n<h3>Events</h3> \n<p>Press releases are an important component of event marketing to attract promotion from news outlets and other media sources.</p> \n<p>You'll want to include:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>What the event is about</li> \n <li>Who should consider attending</li> \n <li>When and where it will be held</li> \n <li>Pricing</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>Grand Openings</h3> \n<p>Whether you opened up a new office, relocated, or are opening for the first time, announce the details with a grand opening press release.</p> \n<p>Announce the date and location the grand opening will be held, who is involved, how the grand opening is being celebrated, and the reason for the move (if applicable).</p> \n<h3>New Partnerships</h3> \n<p>Similar to mergers and acquisitions, a press release announcing new partnerships is a mutually beneficial marketing tactic.</p> \n<p>To effectively execute this type of release, be sure to write a summary about each company, why the partnership was created, who benefits, and any additional important details for current and future stakeholders.</p> \n<h3>Rebranding</h3> \n<p>Rebranding is a difficult thing for any business to do, and it can occasionally result in confusion and awkwardness.</p> \n<p>One way to make the transition smoother is by announcing the rebrand with a press release, including details on what is changing, the reason for making the change, dates the changes go into effect, and quotes from the leadership team.</p> \n<h3>Executive Team Changes</h3> \n<p>Executives often serve as faces of the company, and a press release functions to kick off this role.</p> \n<p>It may include biographical information to establish their credibility along with a photo and other pertinent details.</p> \n<h3>Awards</h3> \n<p>When it comes to business excellence, it's OK to brag. Press releases about awards and accomplishments serve to cement your organization as an authority in your space.</p> \n<a></a> \n<p>Such a press release includes information about the company and why they were given the award, information about the award itself, and details about the ceremony (if applicable).</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>When formatting a press release, you want to write it in a newsy, straightforward way so a journalist who might write about it can imagine it as an article on their news site.</p> \n<p>To start, here are the basics every press release should include:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Your contact information located on the top left corner</li> \n <li>The phrase \"For immediate release\" located on the top right</li> \n <li>A headline that quickly explains the announcement</li> \n <li>Your business location in the first sentence of the press release</li> \n <li>A quick bio about your company at the end of your press release.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>You also might want to include \"###\" or another signifier to show the journalist that the release has ended. In the past, this prevented busy journalists from waiting or flipping the page for more information when there was no more news. However, this tradition is<a href=\"https://www.thehalogroup.com/what-does-mean-at-the-end-of-a-press-release/\"> </a><a href=\"https://www.thehalogroup.com/what-does-mean-at-the-end-of-a-press-release/\">still adopted and highly-respected today</a>.</p> \n<p>Now, onto the body of your press release:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Your first paragraph</strong> should state what the announcement while providing some context around your business and what it does.</li> \n <li><strong>The next two to three paragraphs</strong> should include quotes from a company spokesperson or business executive to explain the \"why\" behind this announcement.</li> \n <li><strong>Your last paragraph </strong>should be an \"About Us\" section that explains what your company is and what it offers.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>In this example, Catbrella Inc., a fictitious ad agency that just gained its 10th Twitter follower after two years of paid social media efforts, announces its achievement in a press release.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img alt=\"Sample press release format by HubSpot, with orange markers highlighting five key areas on the press release: headline, 3 paragraphs, about us section\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D.png?width=400&amp;name=How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 400px;\" title=\"press-release-example-hubspot.png\" width=\"400\" /></p> \n<a></a> \n<p><em>*Disclaimer: HubSpot is entirely responsible for the silliness of this faux announcement.</em></p> \n<p></p> \n<p>Writing a press release to break important company news can help businesses grow better, but doing it right is just as important. Here's how to write a press release, like the one above, step-by-step.</p> \n<h3>1. Write a compelling headline.</h3> \n<p>You've got your announcement in mind, and now it's time to get it down in words to share with your community, industry, and followers.</p> \n<p>Just like<a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/a-simple-formula-for-writing-kick-ass-titles-ht\"> </a><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/a-simple-formula-for-writing-kick-ass-titles-ht\">writing the perfect blog post title</a>, setting up your press release for success starts with your headline. You only have one line to work with, which can seem scary, but consider your words carefully to make your headline captivating.</p> \n<p>Here are some tips to make your headline stand out:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Use action verbs.</li> \n <li>Be specific.</li> \n <li>Keep it short.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Most importantly, make it interesting: Keep in mind that reporters get dozens, if not hundreds, of releases each day, so invest the time to write a compelling headline.</p> \n<p>Consumers, on the other hand, see news stories all over their timelines. As such, your headline needs to be interesting enough to reel them in.</p> \n<h3>2. Convey the news value to the press.</h3> \n<p>If you want your press release to be newsworthy, you have to give readers a reason to care.</p> \n<p>A good way to ensure this is by using the reverse pyramid formula when writing your press release: Going from the most important information to the least important.</p> \n<p>While the first paragraph of your release should explain the who, what, where, the second paragraph should cover the why.</p> \n<p>Reporters don't have a ton of time to sift through details and fluffy background information — they just need the facts that'll help them tell your story to someone else from a position of authority.</p> \n<p>There shouldn't be any new, crucial information covered after these sections because the readers could potentially miss them.</p> \n<h3>3. Offer a tempting quote.</h3> \n<p>Once you've set the scene, it's time to bring your details to life with a quote that reporters can use for context around your announcement and help paint a picture of how your news affects the given industry, customer base, and landscape.</p> \n<p>Ideally, quotes will be from key stakeholders in your company including your executive team, project leads, or those directly impacted by your announcement.</p> \n<p>Quoting key figures and authorities underlines the importance of your development. The chosen quote should shape your narrative and emphasize the core of the announcement.</p> \n<p>Don't ask everyone in your office for a comment or feel compelled to quote all 25 people included in the acquisition. Pick one or two critical spokespeople and focus the quotes around their unique perspective.</p> \n<h3>4. Provide valuable background information on the subject.</h3> \n<p>In this last paragraph, keep in mind that the reader should already have key details they need regarding your announcement.</p> \n<p>Offer details here that strengthen your narrative, like creative or noteworthy ways your company developed the project or announcement at hand. Or, when applicable, comment on the future implications of your announcement.</p> \n<p>Another good way to add value to your press release is by using<a href=\"https://blog.justreachout.io/how-to-write-press-release/\"> </a><a href=\"https://blog.justreachout.io/how-to-write-press-release/\">newsjacking</a>. A process of relating your press release to something currently going on to make it more valuable to the journalist and reader.</p> \n<h3>5. Summarize the \"who\" and the \"what\" in a boilerplate.</h3> \n<p>Twitter is chock-full of reporters lamenting press releases or pitches that don't clearly explain what the company does or what the announcement is actually about.</p> \n<p>Describe what your company does in clear, plain language and include a link to your company's website early on.</p> \n<p>If you cite data, include a reference link for the data source, and make sure every name in the release has an associated title and company as well.</p> \n<a></a> \n<p>To keep yourself honest on this front, ask a colleague to read the release without context and ask them to relay the information back to you. If they can't recall the who, what, or why get back to the drawing board.</p> \n<h2>Press Release Template</h2> \n<p>This template includes press release templates based on the type of announcement your company wants to make, whether it's a new product, a partnership, or a change within your organization.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/inbound-press-release-templates?hubs_post-cta=imagebottom&amp;_ga=2.195985199.227620996.1645120963-27426667.1645120963\"><img alt=\"press release template offer from hubspot\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D-1.png?width=350&amp;name=How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D-1.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 350px;\" title=\"\" width=\"350\" /></a></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><strong><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/inbound-press-release-templates?hubs_post-cta=imagebottom\">Download This Press Release Template for Free</a></strong></p> \n<a></a> \n<p>This template also offers creative replacements for the traditional press release and a guide on how to create a comprehensive promotional plan. You'll have exactly what you need to drive brand awareness and stand out among your competitors.</p> \n<h2>Press Release Examples</h2> \n<p>Many people think press releases have to be chock full of buzzwords and branded terms.</p> \n<p>\"Big data,\" anyone? Five-syllable words you have to look up on Thesaurus.com? Quotes from every executive on the planet that go on for pages? We've seen it all. Unfortunately, so have reporters – and they are <em>not</em> fans.</p> \n<p>Instead of stuffing your next release with industry jargon, take a page out of our book (OK fine, ebook),<a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/newsworthy-guide-to-inbound-public-relations\"> </a><em><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/newsworthy-guide-to-inbound-public-relations\">The Newsworthy Guide to Inbound Public Relations</a></em>, and brainstorm some creative approaches for your next announcement.</p> \n<p>Can you include new data? A remarkable graphic or video? A shareable SlideShare? If so, a creative angle can help carry your content and increase the likelihood of social sharing.</p> \n<p>Now, to get you thinking on the right track, take a look at some creative press release examples below, the type of news each one is reporting on, and what makes the release unique:</p> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/microsoft-to-acquire-activision-blizzard-to-bring-the-joy-and-community-of-gaming-to-everyone-across-every-device-301462759.html\">Microsoft</a></h3> \n<h4><strong>Type of press release: Acquisition</strong></h4> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img alt=\"snapshot of press release example from microsoft\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D.jpeg?width=500&amp;name=How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; width: 500px; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\" width=\"500\" /></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/microsoft-to-acquire-activision-blizzard-to-bring-the-joy-and-community-of-gaming-to-everyone-across-every-device-301462759.html\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>The first thing that stands out in this press release is the headline. It tells a full story without being too long: It covers <em>who's</em> involved (Microsoft and Activision), <em>what's</em> happening (an acquisition), and <em>why</em> it matters (to bring the joy and community of gaming to everyone).</p> \n<p>Throughout the press release, you get quotes from leaders in both organizations, helping explain the benefit of this acquisition and how it will move the industry forward.</p> \n<p>Toward the bottom of the press release, you get additional context surrounding each company's market share and how this acquisition will impact the industry.</p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/global-venture-capital-firm-flourish-expands-team-and-regional-efforts-301483989.html\">Flourish</a></h3> \n<h4><strong>Type of press release: Team and office expansion</strong></h4> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img alt=\"snapshot of press release example from flourish\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D-1.jpeg?width=500&amp;name=How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D-1.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 500px;\" title=\"\" width=\"500\" /></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/global-venture-capital-firm-flourish-expands-team-and-regional-efforts-301483989.html\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>Organizational changes can seem relatively boring. One way to generate some interest is to include visual elements to add more dimension to the story.</p> \n<p>In this press release announcing a team and office expansion, venture capital firm Flourish shares photos of some new hires right at the top, immediately drawing readers in.</p> \n<p>The release dives into the reason behind the expansion and the key areas of focus moving forward. Then, we get a quick bio for each hire featured in the image, which can help build excitement surrounding the brand's future.</p> \n<p>The key takeaway here is: Don't be afraid to use visual elements in your press release, as they can help draw readers in.</p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/supercom-to-present-at-aegis-virtual-conference-301484933.html\">SuperCom</a></h3> \n<h4><strong>Type of press release: Event</strong></h4> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img alt=\"snapshot of press release example from supercom\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D-3.jpeg?width=500&amp;name=How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D-3.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 500px;\" title=\"\" width=\"500\" /></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/supercom-to-present-at-aegis-virtual-conference-301484933.html\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>As the shortest press release in the bunch, SuperCom shows that less is often more.</p> \n<p>In this release, security solutions company SuperCom announced its participation in an upcoming conference.</p> \n<p>When it comes to events, the most important details are date and location. As long as you have those key pieces, everything else is a bonus.</p> \n<p>One thing that would've elevated this release is a quote on who can benefit from attending this event and why, as a way to reel in potential attendees.</p> \n<h3>4. <strong><a href=\"https://ir.hubspot.com/news/hubspot-ventures-announces-the-launch-of-new-100-million-fund-to-support-scaling-companies\">HubSpot</a></strong></h3> \n<h4><strong>Type of press release: Program launch</strong></h4> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img alt=\"snapshot of press release example from hubspot\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D-2.jpeg?width=500&amp;name=How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D-2.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 500px;\" title=\"\" width=\"500\" /></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://ir.hubspot.com/news/hubspot-ventures-announces-the-launch-of-new-100-million-fund-to-support-scaling-companies\">Image Source</a></p> \n<a></a> \n<p>We've also crafted this comprehensive, easy-to-follow<a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/newsworthy-guide-to-inbound-public-relations\"> </a><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/newsworthy-guide-to-inbound-public-relations\">press release template</a> complete with a promotional plan and considerations for your next announcement. We use these same guidelines when writing and formatting our releases here at HubSpot, and created a faux, sample release to illustrate what content goes where and why.</p> \n<h2>Tips for Publishing Press Releases</h2> \n<p><em>Writing</em> a press release is really only half the battle. Once you're finished with production, it'll be time to focus on distribution.</p> \n<p>Of course, we're all familiar with the traditional distribution levers we can pull, which include publishing the press release on our website/blog as well as sharing the press release with our followers/subscribers via social media and email.</p> \n<p>To get the maximum amount of distribution possible, here are some tips you can follow.</p> \n<h3>1. Reach out to specific journalists.</h3> \n<p>Instead of blasting a press release out to every journalist you can find an email address for, focus on a few journalists who have experience covering your industry (and company, hopefully) and send them personalized messages.</p> \n<p>Connect the dots. Show why what <em>you</em> wrote connects to what <em>they</em> write.</p> \n<h3>2. Send the release to top journalists the day before.</h3> \n<p>Give journalists some time to craft a story around your press release by sending it to them — under embargo — the day before it officially goes live.</p> \n<p>\"Under embargo\" just means they aren't allowed to share the information in the press release until the time you specify.</p> \n<h3>3. To avoid competition, don't publish your release on the hour.</h3> \n<p>If you're publishing your press release on a distribution service like PR Newswire or Business Wire, avoid publishing it on the hour (e.g., 1 p.m., or 3 p.m., or 5 p.m.).</p> \n<p>The reason? Most companies schedule their releases to go out on the hour, which means if your release goes out on the hour too, it's more likely to get lost in the shuffle.</p> \n<p>Instead, try going with a more distinct time (e.g., 1:12 p.m., or 3:18 p.m., or 5:22 p.m.).</p> \n<h3>4. Share your media coverage.</h3> \n<p>If all goes according to plan, and your press release gets picked up by the media, your job still isn't finished.</p> \n<p>To keep the buzz going, you can release a \"second wave\" of distribution by sharing the specific stories that news outlets write based on your press release.</p> \n<p>You can also share the news on your digital channels, like social media and email, to bring awareness to your announcement.</p> \n<h2>How To Stand Out In The News</h2> \n<p>The key to keeping your PR strategy new school is forgetting preconceived notions of what public relations is and instead focusing on creating highly remarkable content. Traditional press releases can still be really valuable when executed well.</p> \n<p>Instead of ditching releases as a tactic, give them a modern makeover to make them more useful for your marketing.</p> \n<p>Think about how you've used inbound methods to transform your marketing strategies to be more personalized, approachable, and build relationships. Those same principles apply to your PR strategy: Create content to craft your own story and use tactful outreach to get the media familiar with (and excited about) your brand.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in November 2019 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=686dd68a-454c-4c09-9fcc-a199380b234c&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"New Call-to-action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/686dd68a-454c-4c09-9fcc-a199380b234c.png\" /></a></p> \n<p></p> \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fpress-release-template-ht&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" (Hannah Fleishman)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b7c60f4b-f797-44ee-978e-5ffedefb398c.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn28@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-48-567_1e118d186c0c5196.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D.png?width=400&name=How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn73@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-57-207_3699cabb59ecdb49.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D-1.png?width=350&name=How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn39@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-26-51-805_1f37e25193b28687.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D.jpeg?width=500&name=How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn82@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-49-466_faf9c0d69e0d2974.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D-1.jpeg?width=500&name=How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D-1.jpeg":null,"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D-3.jpeg?width=500&name=How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D-3.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn89@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-51-629_c023abffe3f83eb1.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D-2.jpeg?width=500&name=How%20to%20Write%20a%20Press%20Release%20%5BFree%20Press%20Release%20Template%20+%20Examples%5D-2.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn27@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-54-156_30c739d85006819e.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/686dd68a-454c-4c09-9fcc-a199380b234c.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn55@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-52-453_c366e6bf4598cd8f.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fpress-release-template-ht&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn78@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-57-178_269056dc720495f5.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246408219},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"A Plain English Guide to Real Time Bidding","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/real-time-bidding","description":"<p>Because of its efficiency and cost-effectiveness, real-time bidding (RTB) has become one of the most popular ways to purchase ad inventory online.</p> \n<p>But even for experienced marketers, real-time bidding can be a very confusing concept. So let's break down what RTB is, how it works, and the pros and cons of using it — all while keeping it jargon-free.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=8ba68133-b408-456b-a531-171a91d2b38e&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Access Now: Free Media Planning Template\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/8ba68133-b408-456b-a531-171a91d2b38e.png\" align=\"middle\" /></a></p> \n<p>In this post, you'll learn:&nbsp;</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/real-time-bidding#what-is-real-time-bidding-rtb\">What is real-time bidding (RTB)?&nbsp;</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/real-time-bidding#how-does-rtb-work\">How does real-time bidding work?&nbsp;</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/real-time-bidding#real-time-bidding-platforms\">Real-Time Bidding Platforms&nbsp;</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/real-time-bidding#rtb-pros\">Real-Time Bidding Pros&nbsp;</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/real-time-bidding#rtb-cons\">Real-Time Bidding Cons</a></li> \n</ul> \n<a></a> \n<p>Let's get started.&nbsp;</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>Real-time bidding is the driving force behind most programmatic advertising campaigns. <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/agency/programmatic-advertising-glossary\">Programmatic advertising</a> is “the automated process of purchasing and selling online ads.” Real-time bidding allows advertisers to automatically buy ad inventory, place the ads online, and get a certain number of impressions in their programmatic advertising campaigns.&nbsp;</p> \n<h6 style=\"text-align: center;\"><em>⭐Don't have time to read the entire post? Listen to our podcast below about real-time bidding and programmatic advertising:&nbsp;</em></h6> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto; max-width: 392px; max-height: 219px;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\"> \n  <div> \n   <iframe width=\"100%\" height=\"215px\" style=\"border: none\" src=\"https://listen.hubspot.com/embed/v2/smallPlayer/d97fc91d\"></iframe> \n  </div> \n </div> \n</div> \n<h6 style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://listen.hubspot.com/public/83/MarTech-Podcast-%2F%2F-Marketing-%2B-Technology-%3D-Business-Growth-5b86063f?_ga=2.107998658.1584989010.1643233570-1637141335.1642730963\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Click here to find more valuable content from the MarTech podcast.</a>&nbsp;</h6> \n<p>In a traditional <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/media-buying\">media buying process</a>, you have to manually buy ads. Let’s say that you find a magazine that serves your buyer persona. You ask for the media kit, choose the ad dimensions that fit your budget, and then buy the ad for a certain amount of time. Once time runs out, the ad is taken down.</p> \n<p>Real-time bidding takes out all of that work. You can get space on that magazine and hundreds of others by letting a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/what-is-dsp\">Demand-Side Platform (DSP)</a> automatically choose the best publishers and ad spaces, then bid on them for you. You set several certain targeting parameters, such as maximum bid price and target audience. These parameters then determine where your ads are placed.</p> \n<p>The publisher accepts your ad only if you place the highest bid. But remember: real-time bidding automatically does all the bidding. You don’t have to take any additional steps.</p> \n<p>Still confused? No worries. We break down the concept further below.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h2>How does real-time bidding work?</h2> \n<p>There are several pieces involved in the real-time bidding process. Let’s take a look at each one of them one-by-one before putting it all together.</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Advertiser:</strong> The advertiser is the company or brand that wants to place an ad online.</li> \n <li><strong>Demand-Side Platform (DSP)</strong>: The Demand-Side Platform is the service advertisers use to launch ad campaigns.</li> \n <li><strong>Publisher</strong>: The publisher is the website or online property that wants to sell ad spaces, often referred to as “ad inventory.”</li> \n <li><strong>Supply-Side Platform (SSP)</strong>: The Supply-Side Platform is the service publishers use to make ad inventory available. SSPs run auctions where ad spaces are instantly purchased by the highest bidder. But this can’t happen unless an ad exchange facilitates the transaction.</li> \n <li><strong>Ad Exchanges:</strong> The ad exchange connects companies who want to advertise and publishers who want to sell ad space. Ad exchanges carry out the bidding transaction automatically in real time by connecting both Demand-Side Platforms and Supply-Side Platforms.</li> \n <li><strong>Impressions</strong>: Impressions refers to the number of times an ad is seen or scrolled past. In the real-time bidding process, advertisers don’t pay for one individual impression, but rather the cost per thousand impressions (CPM).</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Now, let’s put it together. How exactly does real-time bidding work?</p> \n<p>On the advertiser side, marketers use DSPs to set up their ad campaign and track its performance. Publishers, on the other hand, use Supply-Side Platforms (SSPs) to list their ad inventory and the price they charge. They then meet in the middle at the ad exchange, the marketplace where the real-time bidding actually takes place.</p> \n<p>To determine what ad inventory to bid on, advertisers will set targeting parameters. For instance, a brand may only want to target users who are in a specific region or have visited their website recently.</p> \n<p>So, advertisers, or specifically their Demand-Side Platforms, evaluate ad potential in real time and decide whether or not to place a bid and how much to bid.</p> \n<p>Remember, advertisers set their bid through the Demand-Side Platform, while publishers’ Supply-Side Platform either accept or reject the bid. The prices are negotiated on a cost per thousand impressions, so the advertiser isn’t paying based on uptime or even dimensions. Instead, they’re paying for the amount of times, in thousands, that their ad is seen.</p> \n<p>Let’s go through another example of how it works.</p> \n<h3>Real-Time Bidding Example</h3> \n<p>Let's say Silk is a UK-based beauty brand that just launched a new brow line and is running a campaign. They set up their campaign on a Demand-Side Platform (DSP) and are targeting users who regularly shop for makeup products, are located in the Manchester area, and are between 18 to 30 years of age. The brand also wants its ads to only show on sites related to beauty and lifestyle.</p> \n<p>A user visits a publisher's site. The publisher's Supply-Side Platform (SSP) sends a bid request to the ad exchange, where Silk's DSP will be evaluating the value of the impression. The DSP will then determine if the user meets the parameters outlined in the campaign. If so, the DSP will submit a bid.</p> \n<p>If Silk has the winning bid, the user will see the ad once the page loads. This process happens thousands of times on different webpages during the length of Silk's ad campaign.</p> \n<p>Silk's <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/media-planning\">paid ads </a>manager will also be monitoring their ad's performance on the DSP to see if it's reaching the desired audience, or if the parameters should be adjusted.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h2>Real-Time Bidding Platforms</h2> \n<p>There are no RTB platforms because real-time bidding is a method of purchasing impressions, not a channel. However, you can use tools that can help you start the real-time bidding process. These tools help you either purchase ad inventory or place ad inventory for sale through RTB.</p> \n<p>Below, we break down some platforms you might use if you’re looking to sell or purchase ad inventory online.</p> \n<h3>Real-Time Bidding Platforms For Advertisers</h3> \n<p>As an advertiser, you’ll want to find a Demand-Side Platform that allows you to manage several ad campaigns and set specific targeting parameters — down to the user’s most visited websites and preferred brands. Here are a few options:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.adroll.com/advertising-platform\">AdRoll</a>: Self-serve Demand-Side Platform that’s a good fit for beginners in the programmatic advertising space.</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://mediasmart.io/programmatic-performance-mobile-marketing-platform\">mediasmart</a>: Self-serve Demand-Side Platform that provides advanced targeting and segmentation capabilities. Good fit if you’ve set up ad campaigns with other tools, such as Google Ads.</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.thetradedesk.com/us/our-platform/dsp-demand-side-platform\">theTradeDesk</a>: Demand-Side Platform that allows you to place ads on multiple devices, including TV ad rolls, online videos, music streaming devices, mobile apps, and publishers across the web. Good fit if you’re planning to advertise across all of these channels.</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>Real-Time Bidding Platforms for Publishers</h3> \n<p>If you have ad inventory to sell, then signing up on a Supply-Side Platform is essential to take advantage of the real-time bidding process. You don’t have to speak with any advertisers, negotiate prices, or do any of the manual work that’s typically associated with account management.</p> \n<p>Here are a few channels that will allow you to sell ad inventory through real-time bidding:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.magnite.com/sellers/\">Magnite</a>: Supply-Side Platform for large-scale ad inventory sellers who also want to sell ad space through Private Marketplace (PMP) and Programmatic Guaranteed (PG). Good fit if you’re an experienced ad seller that wants to upgrade to a more capable system.</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.indexexchange.com/solution/publishers/\">Index Exchange</a>: Supply-side marketplace that allows you to get started with ad inventory selling on multiple channels, including display, video, mobile, and native. Good fit if you’d like to start selling ad inventory or if you plan to take advantage of all of the available channels.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>You can <a href=\"https://blockthrough.com/blog/best-supply-side-platforms-for-publishers-2021/#Index_Exchange\">find more SSPs here</a>.</p> \n<p>Still not sure whether you should sell or buy ad space through real-time bidding? We go over the pros and cons below.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h2>Real-Time Bidding Pros</h2> \n<h3>Better Tracking</h3> \n<p>With RTB, advertisers can monitor their campaigns easily without relying on vendors. No need to reach out to multiple publishers and ask for reports, you can get them yourself on your DSP.</p> \n<p>This also gives marketers the agility to pivot quickly if their campaign isn't performing as expected. For instance, you might find that switching out one keyword for another may boost your campaign's performance and align better with the audience you want to reach.</p> \n<h3>Better Targeting</h3> \n<p>When purchasing ads through RTB, you buy one impression at a time. This means that every time a website visitor or mobile app user visits a publisher's site, you're able to assess that person's particular profile and see if it matches your target audience.</p> \n<p>It makes for more accurate targeting as you can ensure your ads are only reaching the right people at the right time.</p> \n<h3>More Cost-Effective</h3> \n<p>The precision of the real-time bidding algorithm allows marketers to spend their ad dollars on high-value impressions.</p> \n<p>Too often, brands launch marketing campaigns that only reach a portion of their target market, leaving the rest of the budget wasted on users who don't fit the profile.</p> \n<p>In addition, RTB takes much of the manual labor out of the online advertising process, allowing marketers to focus on other efforts.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h2>Real-Time Bidding Cons</h2> \n<h3>Compromised Brand Safety</h3> \n<p>Where your ad shows up is as important as who sees it. This is because consumers judge brands' ads based on the surrounding content.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.adcolony.com/blog/2021/12/13/brand-safety-in-emea-latam-on-which-platforms-are-users-willing-to-encounter-ads/\">An Ad Colony survey</a> reported that 60% of consumers have a negative perception of brands whose ads appear near inappropriate, hateful, or offensive content. This can be anything from a site that hosts pirated movies to sites promoting hate speech.</p> \n<p>Due to the nature of RTB, there is a risk your ad may appear on a site with content you wouldn't want your brand associated with. However, brands can limit this issue by putting certain keywords and sites on a “deny” list. This protects brands from showing up on webpages or mobile apps that don't align with their identity.</p> \n<h3>Potential Ad Fraud</h3> \n<p>Ad fraud happens when scammers (or any parties with ill intent) try to trick digital ad networks by falsifying impressions and clicks using bots. Obviously, bots aren’t real people — so they aren’t potential buyers you can eventually convert into customers. Because you don’t get to hand-pick publishers through real-time bidding, there’s the very real chance your ad might be seen by bots instead of real people. The rising sophistication of bots can also cause brands to gather inaccurate data on their campaigns.</p> \n<p>Some deceitful publishers fabricate impressions to steal from advertisers. One way to combat this is by using a DSP or ad network with fraud detection software.</p> \n<h2>Real-Time Bidding is the Easiest Way to Increase Brand Awareness</h2> \n<p>Real-time bidding makes the online advertisement process fast and easy. Marketers can skip the back-and-forth previously associated with ad buying and focus on tracking the results, increasing the ROI from your campaigns and empowering your brand to grow better.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in March 2021 and has been updated for comprehensiveness. </em></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=42d905a8-656c-41d8-8c20-b93c7c9c5a12&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"paid media template\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/42d905a8-656c-41d8-8c20-b93c7c9c5a12.png\" /></a></p> \n<p></p> \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Freal-time-bidding&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \" />","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 21 Feb 2022 12:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/8ba68133-b408-456b-a531-171a91d2b38e.png","linkMd5":"acb724651d994013196c59940b7168f4","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn40@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-48-396_dd5e75e818f84a1f.webp","destWidth":389,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":4641,"destBytes":6192,"author":"mbretous@hubspot.com (Martina Bretous)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/8ba68133-b408-456b-a531-171a91d2b38e.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn40@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-48-396_dd5e75e818f84a1f.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/42d905a8-656c-41d8-8c20-b93c7c9c5a12.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn60@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-50-735_b0fecfde2c648704.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Freal-time-bidding&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn16@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-55-455_da5a5e6d69388abc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246408227},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"Mastering Facebook Ads In 2022 Through Incrementality","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/facebook-ads-incrementality","description":"<p>There are many resources out there telling you how to optimize your Facebook ads to scale your business's growth. And while I'm sure they can help in some aspects, you're probably optimizing your campaigns based on the wrong metrics.</p> \n<p>In 2022, Facebook has <a href=\"https://zephoria.com/top-15-valuable-facebook-statistics/\">1.79 billion daily users</a>. There are plenty of opportunities to create Facebook ads that will drive impressions, link clicks, leads, and more. However, these metrics only scratch the surface of how much impact your Facebook ads can truly have on your business.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=ed40e380-bf04-4fea-b0c3-257696630e08&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Sign Up for HubSpot Academy's Free Facebook Ads Training Course\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/ed40e380-bf04-4fea-b0c3-257696630e08.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p>As more industry experts focus their media buying on incremental gains, marketers can better measure their Facebook ads' positive, negative, or neutral impact on their business.</p> \n<h2>What is incrementality in Facebook Ads?</h2> \n<p>Incrementality allows marketers to understand how Facebook ads impact their business. Often, advertisers make optimizations to campaigns based on certain metrics, which can dramatically affect the end goal.</p> \n<p>It's crucial for businesses to identify what's working and what isn't — especially since Facebook's ad revenue worldwide was <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/277963/facebooks-quarterly-global-revenue-by-segment/\"><strong>$84.2 billion</strong> in 2020</a>. Whether you have a large or small Facebook advertising budget, you want to make sure it's generating results.</p> \n<p>Advertisers can measure incrementality by using control tests and comparing the results from those exposed to an ad versus those who have not. Once the tests have been completed, the results can help your business make smarter decisions on your Facebook ads and optimize your campaigns accordingly.</p> \n<h2>Why should marketers track incremental return on ad spend (iROAS)?</h2> \n<p>One minute you're a marketer, and the next, you're a data analyst. All jokes aside, information overload is very real in 2022. With all of this data available, there’s the assumption that it should be easy for marketers to pinpoint the best audience to target, understand what point they are at in the Facebook sales funnel, and the best methods to convert them.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Facebook-Sales-Funnel.png?width=1104&amp;name=Facebook-Sales-Funnel.png\" alt=\"Facebook Sales Funnel\" width=\"1104\" style=\"width: 1104px;\"></p> \n<p>However, data dumps and compiling all of this information is incredibly time-consuming. And as digital marketing continues to expand, time is not always on our side. Businesses need to refocus their efforts from heavy reliance on data collection to doubling down on finding the <em>right</em> data—that can assist in smart optimizations and <a href=\"https://vistasocial.com/social-media-analytics/\">actionable insights</a> to fuel your Facebook campaign's bottom line.</p> \n<h2>How to Calculate Incremental Return on Ad Spend</h2> \n<p>The method for calculating iROAS is different for every publisher. The most methodical approach is by applying a <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/help/1915029282150425\">holdout</a> to your Facebook campaign. The holdout on your campaign will act as a control group for Facebook users that will not see your ads. The remaining group of users will be the test audience for your Facebook campaign.</p> \n<p>After the test is complete, marketers can compare the results from the test group to the control group. The difference in the results will be your conversion lift, representing the incremental impacts on your conversions.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/ROAS-Formula.png?width=760&amp;name=ROAS-Formula.png\" alt=\"How to calculate return on ad spend ROAS\" width=\"760\" style=\"width: 760px;\">iROAS is calculated similarly to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/return-on-ad-spend?_ga=2.189840235.1519769113.1645056446-1004475094.1645056446\">ROAS</a>, which is revenue divided by cost. However, this measurement allows your business to understand which Facebook campaigns are working and which aren't. The calculation for iROAS is Incremental Revenue / Ad Spend = iROAS.</p> \n<p>In the YouTube video below, HubSpot details how to determine ad spend by understanding the bidding system used by ad networks.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/JtwEBXoMa80\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<h2>3 Simple Ways to Increase Your Facebook's Ads Incrementality in 2022</h2> \n<p>Frequently data dumps fail due to the sheer amount of information available. Marketers may find many valid insights, but the delivery of this information can get lost in translation — especially if there is no clear direction. Brands looking to increase their Facebook ads incrementality should work with a <a href=\"https://agencyvista.com/\">leading marketing agency</a> with proven experience.</p> \n<p>However, if you're looking to get started on your own, below we'll walk you through the top three ways to increase your Facebook ad's incrementality to exceed your 2022 growth goals.</p> \n<h3>1. Audience Targeting</h3> \n<p>Facebook users at the top of the funnel versus the bottom will yield very different incrementality results. For example, you will see very different results if you're using a 5% lookalike audience of customers who purchased in the last month vs. remarketing to customers who purchased in the last few years.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Facebook-Ad-Targeting.jpg?width=1600&amp;name=Facebook-Ad-Targeting.jpg\" alt=\"Creating audience for Facebook Ad targeting\" width=\"1600\" style=\"width: 1600px;\">Targeting new customers should be your most incremental audience segment since they would not have converted and made the purchase had it not been for your Facebook ad.</p> \n<p>This can also affect your bid strategies and budgets for remarketing audiences. For example, a customer who has purchased from you recently may not need a Facebook ad to prompt another purchase — this will depend on your product or service buying situation.</p> \n<h4><strong>Three Class of Buying Situations:</strong></h4> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Routine decision-making: </strong>involves purchases that require very little thought after the original decision has been made. Such as gum, a chocolate bar, or a soft drink.</li> \n <li><strong>Limited decision-making: </strong>involves purchasing products that require a moderate amount of time and effort to compare models and brands before making a choice. This could be comparing which phone you are planning to upgrade to.</li> \n <li><strong>Extensive decision-making: </strong>involves an extensive consumer decision regarding whether or not to purchase a product. Examples include cars, homes, and education.</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>2. Ad Creative</h3> \n<p>I'm sure every marketer has heard about the study that found that the average attention span has decreased from 12 seconds to 8 seconds—while a goldfish holds a 9-second attention span. There is so much noise and clutter on social media that often, consumers will scroll right past your ad.</p> \n<p>Advertisers need to create Facebook ads that grab the viewers' attention and drive action. Facebook ad creative is one of the top ways to increase your incrementality.</p> \n<p>Learn from the best! We've collected the 50 best Facebook ads to inspire your next campaign. <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/facebook-ad-examples?hubs_post-cta=body&amp;hubs_post=blog.hubspot.com/marketing/the-facebook-ad-types&amp;_ga=2.189840235.1519769113.1645056446-1004475094.1645056446\">Check out this exclusive lookbook</a> to get a head start on crafting the perfect ad to drive incremental revenue.</p> \n<h3>3. Facebook Placements</h3> \n<p>There are several placements for advertisers across Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, and Audience Network. But, not every placement works with every type of campaign.</p> \n<p>For example, an ad on audience network may spark brand awareness or interest but not drive an immediate conversion. The same goes for device targeting, often people are in discovery mode on mobile but complete the transaction on desktop.</p> \n<p>Most advertisers still recommend combining placements to maximize the results, but it is beneficial to understand where your most incremental audience is.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=4f0eef09-2c33-43c7-9dee-7dde3ae4071e&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"New call-to-action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/4f0eef09-2c33-43c7-9dee-7dde3ae4071e.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Ffacebook-ads-incrementality&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\"
