/myreaderx10/cdn87@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-51-186_b1e15dc979bbb11c.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/value-proposition-canvas-example-fedex.png?width=650&name=value-proposition-canvas-example-fedex.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn55@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-49-690_0fd2887a7d1a5a1c.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Write%20a%20Great%20Value%20Proposition%20%5B4%20Top%20Examples%20+%20Template%5D-Oct-01-2021-04-55-03-23-PM.png?width=650&name=How%20to%20Write%20a%20Great%20Value%20Proposition%20%5B4%20Top%20Examples%20+%20Template%5D-Oct-01-2021-04-55-03-23-PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn26@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-51-002_4e1b8bbd057f0216.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/value-proposition-canvas-example-LG.png?width=650&name=value-proposition-canvas-example-LG.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn72@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-50-379_373eb14b7cb1faad.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Write%20a%20Great%20Value%20Proposition%20%5B4%20Top%20Examples%20+%20Template%5D-2.png?width=650&name=How%20to%20Write%20a%20Great%20Value%20Proposition%20%5B4%20Top%20Examples%20+%20Template%5D-2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn79@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-52-834_b64476c492b56e75.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/value-proposition-canvas-example-subaru.png?width=650&name=value-proposition-canvas-example-subaru.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn2@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-26-55-181_4629e34aeabd4398.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Write%20a%20Great%20Value%20Proposition%20%5B4%20Top%20Examples%20+%20Template%5D-4.png?width=650&name=How%20to%20Write%20a%20Great%20Value%20Proposition%20%5B4%20Top%20Examples%20+%20Template%5D-4.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn62@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-54-148_b017bc4abddd56a9.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/value-proposition-canvas-example-samsung.png?width=650&name=value-proposition-canvas-example-samsung.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn39@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-50-033_fdf62c8d784907ec.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/512ec060-3806-4142-9fdd-160f6341ea4d.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn49@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-55-451_0990d74952384548.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fwrite-value-proposition&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn83@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-52-608_42b69982382e4efc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246408181},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"How-To: Conditional Formatting Based on Another Cell in Google Sheets","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/conditional-formatting-google-sheets","description":"<p>Conditional formatting is a feature in <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/google-sheets\">Google Sheets</a> in which a cell is formatted in a particular way when certain conditions are met. The formatting can include highlighting, bolding, italicizing – just about any visual changes to the cell.</p> \n<p>Just as it can be done for the cell you’re currently in, conditional formatting can also be set based on conditions met in another cell.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=e7cd3f82-cab9-4017-b019-ee3fc550e0b5&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"→ Access Now: Google Sheets Templates [Free Kit]\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/e7cd3f82-cab9-4017-b019-ee3fc550e0b5.png\"></a></p> \n<p>Let’s dive into how to create this condition based on multiple criteria.</p> \n<h2>How Conditional Formatting Works</h2> \n<p>To learn how to set conditional formatting, let’s use this workbook as an example.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"example of a google sheets workbook to show how conditional formatting works \" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-3.jpeg?width=600&amp;name=How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-3.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 600px;\" title=\"\" width=\"600\"></p> \n<p>It’s a workbook showing website traffic year over year from Q4 2020 to Q4 2021, with the page views along with the year-over-year percentage change.</p> \n<p>Here’s what we want to accomplish here: When the percentage change is positive YoY, the cell turns green. When it’s negative, the cell turns red. This makes it easy to get a quick performance overview before diving into the details.</p> \n<p>Here are the steps to set the conditional formatting.</p> \n<h3>1. Select the cell you want to format, click on \"Format\" from the navigation bar, then click on \"Conditional Formatting.\"</h3> \n<h3 style=\"font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-family: AvenirNext, 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #33475b;\"><img alt=\"how to set the conditional formatting step 1 \" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-Feb-11-2022-04-54-48-47-PM.jpeg?width=600&amp;name=How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-Feb-11-2022-04-54-48-47-PM.jpeg\" title=\"\" width=\"600\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 600px;\"></h3> \n<br> \n<h3>2. While staying in the \"Single color\" tab, double-check that the cell under \"Apply to range\" is the cell you want to format. <img alt=\"how to set the conditional formatting step 2\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-3.png?width=250&amp;name=How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-3.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 250px;\" title=\"\" width=\"250\"></h3> \n<br> \n<h3>3. Set your format rules.</h3> \n<img alt=\"how to set the conditional formatting step 3\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets.png?width=250&amp;name=How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets.png\" title=\"\" width=\"250\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 250px;\"> \n<p>It may automatically default to a standard conditional formatting formula. In this case, open the dropdown menu under \"Format cells if…\" to select your rules. Options will look as follows:</p> \n<h3>4. <span style=\"font-size: 1.5rem; font-weight: 500;\">Choose your formatting style, then click \"Done.\"</span><img alt=\"how to set the conditional formatting step 4\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-1.png?width=250&amp;name=How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-1.png\" title=\"\" width=\"250\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 250px;\"></h3> \n<h3>5. Confirm the rule was applied under \"Conditional Formatting Rules.\"</h3> \n<img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/conditional%20formatting%20step%205-png.png?width=250&amp;name=conditional%20formatting%20step%205-png.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 250px;\" width=\"250\" alt=\"conditional formatting step 5\"> \n<h3>6. Add another rule if needed.</h3> \n<img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/conditional%20formatting%20step%206-png.png?width=200&amp;name=conditional%20formatting%20step%206-png.png\" width=\"200\" style=\"width: 200px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" alt=\"conditional formatting step 6\">\n<br> \n<h3>7. Return to cell to view formatting, then drag the cursor to apply to other cells, if needed.</h3> \n<img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/conditional%20formatting%20step%207-gif.gif?width=600&amp;name=conditional%20formatting%20step%207-gif.gif\" alt=\"how to set the conditional formatting step 7\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 600px;\" width=\"600\"> \n<p>Now that you understand the basics, let’s cover how to use conditional formatting based on other cells.</p> \n<h2>Conditional Formatting Based on Another Cell Value</h2> \n<h3>1. Select the cell you want to format.</h3> \n<p><img alt=\"conditional formatting based on another cell value step 1\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets.jpeg?width=600&amp;name=How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 600px;\" title=\"\" width=\"600\"></p> \n<h3>2. Click on \"Format\" in the navigation bar, then select \"Conditional Formatting.\"</h3> \n<p><img alt=\"conditional formatting based on another cell value step 2\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-Feb-11-2022-04-54-50-23-PM.jpeg?width=250&amp;name=How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-Feb-11-2022-04-54-50-23-PM.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; width: 250px; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\" width=\"250\"></p> \n<h3>3. Under \"Format Rules,\" select \"Custom formula is.\"</h3> \n<p><img alt=\"conditional formatting based on another cell value step 3\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-Feb-11-2022-04-54-49-26-PM.jpeg?width=200&amp;name=How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-Feb-11-2022-04-54-49-26-PM.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 200px;\" title=\"\" width=\"200\"></p> \n<h3>4. Write your formula, then click \"Done.\"</h3> \n<p><img alt=\"conditional formatting based on another cell value step 4\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-4.png?width=200&amp;name=How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-4.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 200px;\" title=\"\" width=\"200\"></p> \n<h3>5. Confirm your rule has been applied and check the cell.</h3> \n<p><img alt=\"conditional formatting based on another cell value step 5\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-Feb-11-2022-04-54-48-82-PM.jpeg?width=600&amp;name=How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-Feb-11-2022-04-54-48-82-PM.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 600px;\" title=\"\" width=\"600\"></p> \n<h2>Conditional Formatting Based on Another Cell Range</h2> \n<p>To format based on another cell range, you follow many of the same steps you would for a cell value. What changes is the formula you write.</p> \n<h3>1. Select the cell you want to format.</h3> \n<p><img alt=\"conditional formatting based on another cell range step 1\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-2.jpeg?width=624&amp;name=How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-2.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\" width=\"624\"></p> \n<h3>2. Click on \"Format\" in the navigation bar, then select \"Conditional Formatting.\"</h3> \n<p><img alt=\"conditional formatting based on another cell range step 2\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-4.jpeg?width=350&amp;name=How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-4.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 350px;\" title=\"\" width=\"350\"></p> \n<h3>3. Under \"Format Rules,\" select \"Custom formula is.\"</h3> \n<p><img alt=\"conditional formatting based on another cell range step 3\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-Feb-11-2022-04-54-49-26-PM.jpeg?width=200&amp;name=How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-Feb-11-2022-04-54-49-26-PM.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 200px;\" title=\"\" width=\"200\"></p> \n<h3>4. Write your formula using the following format: <strong>=value range &lt; [value], </strong>select your formatting style, then click \"Done.\"</h3> \n<p><img alt=\"conditional formatting based on another cell range step 4\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-Feb-11-2022-04-54-50-58-PM.png?width=200&amp;name=How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-Feb-11-2022-04-54-50-58-PM.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; width: 200px; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\" width=\"200\"></p> \n<h3>5. Confirm your rule has been applied and check the cell.</h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20Range%20step%205-jpg.jpeg?width=600&amp;name=Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20Range%20step%205-jpg.jpeg\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" alt=\"conditional formatting based on another cell range step 5\"></p> \n<p></p> \n<h2>Google Sheets Conditional Formatting Based on Another Cell Color</h2> \n<p>Currently, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/google-sheets-templates\">Google Sheets </a>does not offer a way to use conditional formatting based on the color of another cell. You can only use it based on:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Values</strong> – higher than, greater than, equal to, in between</li> \n <li><strong>Text</strong> – contains, starts with, ends with, matches</li> \n <li><strong>Dates</strong> – is before, is after, is exactly</li> \n <li><strong>Emptiness</strong> – is empty, is not empty</li> \n</ul> \n<p>To achieve your goal, you’d have to use the condition of the cell to format the other.</p> \n<p>Let’s use an example.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"Google Sheets Conditional Formatting Based on Another Cell Color\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-1.jpeg?width=600&amp;name=How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-1.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 600px;\" title=\"\" width=\"600\"></p> \n<p>Say you want to format cell A2 (September 2020) to be red and match the color of cell E2 (-20%). There’s no formula that allows you to create a condition based on color. However, you can create a custom formula based on E2’s values.</p> \n<p>You can say that if cell E2’s values are less than 0, cell A2 turns red. The formula is as follows: <strong>= [The other cell] &lt; [value].</strong> In this case, the formula would be =e2&lt;0, as it signifies that cell A2 should turn red if E2’s value is less than 0.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"google sheets conditional formatting based on another cell's values\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-2.png?width=200&amp;name=How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-2.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; width: 200px; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\" width=\"200\"></p> \n<p>With so many functions to play with, Google Sheets can seem daunting. By following these simple steps, you can easily format your cells for quick scanning.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=0cedc81d-d358-4517-bd55-4a26f49c5a4e&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"business google sheets templates\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/0cedc81d-d358-4517-bd55-4a26f49c5a4e.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img 117_d966ab3e2f6db1c8.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20Range%20step%205-jpg.jpeg?width=600&name=Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20Range%20step%205-jpg.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn44@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-51-735_d33e7d15bdf4d6ae.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-1.jpeg?width=600&name=How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-1.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn2@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-50-277_402ee58d2eb69843.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-2.png?width=200&name=How%20to%20Set%20Conditional%20Formatting%20Based%20on%20Another%20Cell%20in%20Google%20Sheets-2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn24@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-52-871_c5fd120c4989249a.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/0cedc81d-d358-4517-bd55-4a26f49c5a4e.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn73@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-26-50-232_9fb0d0da7b424675.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fconditional-formatting-google-sheets&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246408194},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"3 Instagram Video Formats You Should Leverage in 2022 [Data from 500+ Marketers]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-video-formats","description":"<p>As a marketer, you've probably wondered which Instagram video format would perform the best for your audience.</p> \n<p>To help you, we asked consumers what type of video formats they watch the most. Plus, we surveyed marketers to discover their <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/instagram-marketing?_ga=2.168031905.1293077387.1645228002-849224622.1645228002\">Instagram marketing</a> strategies.</p> \n<a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=9294dd33-9827-4b39-8fc2-b7fbece7fdb9&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"New Data: Instagram Engagement Report [2022 Version]\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/9294dd33-9827-4b39-8fc2-b7fbece7fdb9.png\" align=\"middle\"></a> \n<p>You'll also learn what video format users like to watch on Instagram as well as the size, length, and aspect ratio you should be using.</p> \n<h2>How Marketers are Leveraging Video on Instagram</h2> \n<p>In 2021, we surveyed over 1,000 global marketers to understand which trends they currently (and plan to) leverage.</p> \n<p>The first thing that stood out to us is that ​​marketers who leverage video content on Instagram are 16% more likely to say their <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-for-business-guide\">Instagram strategy</a> was effective last year.</p> \n<p>We also found that 82% of marketers post video content on Instagram and the content formats they use most are video-based.</p> \n<p>The main difference we see in how marketers use video versus other content formats on Instagram is that they use humor more in video and market products and services less.</p> \n<p>As for the platform’s features, marketers surveyed say posting videos offers the highest engagement level and the highest ROI, more than images and live streaming.</p> \n<p>We know that <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/short-form-video-trends\">short-form video</a> is at the peak of its popularity on platforms like Instagram and TikTok and that could play a role in how popular video is. In fact, 85% of marketers say short-form is the most effective video style they leverage.</p> \n<p>With that said, only one in four <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-reels\">marketers use Reels</a>. At the time marketers were surveyed, they said it offered one of the lowest ROI. However, it’s still a feature they plan to invest in this new year.</p> \n<p>Now that we know how marketers are thinking of video, let’s switch to the consumer perspective.</p> \n<h2>Best Video Format for Instagram</h2> \n<p>Currently, Instagram offers three video formats:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>In-feed</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-reels-examples\">Reel</a></li> \n <li>Stories</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Back in June 2021, we surveyed more than 300 consumers to discover which video formats they watch the most. <img alt=\"lucid data survey results showing that consumers watch Instagram Stories the most\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/3%20Instagram%20Video%20Formats%20You%20Should%20Leverage%20This%20Year%20%5BData%20from%20500+%20Instagram%20Marketers%5D.png?width=600&amp;name=3%20Instagram%20Video%20Formats%20You%20Should%20Leverage%20This%20Year%20%5BData%20from%20500+%20Instagram%20Marketers%5D.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 600px;\" title=\"\" width=\"600\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><em><a href=\"https://luc.id/\" style=\"font-size: 12px;\">Data Source</a></em></p> \n<p>Ultimately, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-stories\">Instagram Story</a> videos were the most popular video format to watch on the social media site, with 43% of those surveyed watching this type of video content the most.</p> \n<p>Besides survey respondents who didn't use Instagram, the next highest video format to watch were live videos and then videos shared directly in the feed.</p> \n<p>The least popular video format was IGTV, which was discontinued in October, a few months after this survey.</p> \n<p>Now that we know how consumers and marketers are behaving, let's find out how you can post the best video content on Instagram.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>This is the proper video quality for a post on the<a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/ads-guide/video/instagram-feed/video-views\"> </a><a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/ads-guide/video/instagram-feed/video-views\">Instagram feed</a>. It will look something like the screenshot below.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"example of an instagram in-feed video\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/3%20Instagram%20Video%20Formats%20You%20Should%20Leverage%20This%20Year%20%5BData%20from%20500+%20Instagram%20Marketers%5D-1.png?width=200&amp;name=3%20Instagram%20Video%20Formats%20You%20Should%20Leverage%20This%20Year%20%5BData%20from%20500+%20Instagram%20Marketers%5D-1.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 200px;\" title=\"\" width=\"200\"></p> \n<p>For an <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-story-examples\">Instagram Story</a> or Reel, the video should be 1080 x 1080 pixels, with an aspect ratio of 9:16. The maximum file size should be 250MB.</p> \n<p>It will look something like this:</p> \n<p><img alt=\"example of an instagram Story video\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/3%20Instagram%20Video%20Formats%20You%20Should%20Leverage%20This%20Year%20%5BData%20from%20500+%20Instagram%20Marketers%5D.gif?width=200&amp;name=3%20Instagram%20Video%20Formats%20You%20Should%20Leverage%20This%20Year%20%5BData%20from%20500+%20Instagram%20Marketers%5D.gif\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 200px;\" title=\"\" width=\"200\"></p> \n<p>While these are the main types of videos to upload on Instagram, you can explore other spec requirements on the<a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/ads-guide/video/instagram-story\"> </a><a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/ads-guide/video/instagram-story\">Instagram site</a>.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>While all these stats are important, one of the ways to keep<a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/ads-guide/video/instagram-feed/video-views\"> </a><a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/ads-guide/video/instagram-feed/video-views\">file size down</a> is to shorten the video. You can't just upload 24 hours of video content on the platform.</p> \n<p>Now you might be wondering, <em>\"How long can my Instagram videos be?\"</em> Let's dive in below.</p> \n<h2>How Long Can Instagram Videos Be?</h2> \n<p>Instagram videos are a great way to reach Gen Z or millennial audiences. However, it's important to think about the type of video content that performs best on the platform.</p> \n<p>Additionally, knowing the right size and video specifications before filming your videos can help you reach success quicker.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's Note: This post was originally published in June 2021 and has been updated for comprehensiveness. </em></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=b1268983-9da6-4d67-9d3a-cfef2d9f3cff&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"Improve your website with effective technical SEO. Start by conducting this  audit.&nbsp;&nbsp;\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b1268983-9da6-4d67-9d3a-cfef2d9f3cff.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Finstagram-video-formats&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 28 Feb 2022 12:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/9294dd33-9827-4b39-8fc2-b7fbece7fdb9.png","linkMd5":"ab3a34aa261f83cd846ea231dc9649f9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn99@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-26-48-650_7e54748a32aeb250.webp","destWidth":500,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":5814,"destBytes":7884,"author":"Rebecca Riserbato","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/9294dd33-9827-4b39-8fc2-b7fbece7fdb9.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn99@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-26-48-650_7e54748a32aeb250.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/3%20Instagram%20Video%20Formats%20You%20Should%20Leverage%20This%20Year%20%5BData%20from%20500+%20Instagram%20Marketers%5D.png?width=600&name=3%20Instagram%20Video%20Formats%20You%20Should%20Leverage%20This%20Year%20%5BData%20from%20500+%20Instagram%20Marketers%5D.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn69@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-50-932_86ddfe90049fcdde.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/3%20Instagram%20Video%20Formats%20You%20Should%20Leverage%20This%20Year%20%5BData%20from%20500+%20Instagram%20Marketers%5D-1.png?width=200&name=3%20Instagram%20Video%20Formats%20You%20Should%20Leverage%20This%20Year%20%5BData%20from%20500+%20Instagram%20Marketers%5D-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn2@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-56-140_3279a9cb3ded603d.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/3%20Instagram%20Video%20Formats%20You%20Should%20Leverage%20This%20Year%20%5BData%20from%20500+%20Instagram%20Marketers%5D.gif?width=200&name=3%20Instagram%20Video%20Formats%20You%20Should%20Leverage%20This%20Year%20%5BData%20from%20500+%20Instagram%20Marketers%5D.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn28@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-56-479_683ea66a4e551589.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b1268983-9da6-4d67-9d3a-cfef2d9f3cff.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn92@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-49-811_a4245cc995397db3.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Finstagram-video-formats&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn7@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-54-055_a469a2b5cd2ffa62.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246408219},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"The Plain-English Guide to Conjoint Analysis","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/conjoint-analysis","description":"<p>Sometimes, commercials <em>really</em> get me.</p>  \n<p><a href=\"https://www.cbssports.com/nfl/video/2019-super-bowl-commercials-sprint/\">T-Mobile</a>'s Super Bowl commercial this year is a prime example — \"What's for Dinner?\" demonstrates the infuriating process of choosing what to do for dinner for a young couple, and it's<em> gold</em>.</p> \n<p>The reason T-Mobile's ad was so relatable is because of their market research. They looked at what their target audiences wanted — including their thought processes, what informs their decisions, and the trade-offs they're willing to make for their products.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=6ba52ce7-bb69-4b63-965b-4ea21ba905da&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"→ Download Now: Market Research Templates [Free Kit]\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/6ba52ce7-bb69-4b63-965b-4ea21ba905da.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p>To accomplish all of these important factors in one go, many companies use conjoint analysis.</p> \n<p>Think about buying a new phone. Attributes you might consider are color, size, and model. The reason phone companies include these specs in their marketing is due to research such as conjoint analysis.</p> \n<p><em>Would consumers purchase this product or service if brought to market?</em> That's the question conjoint analysis strives to answer. It's a quantitative measure in marketing research, meaning it measures numbers rather than open-ended questions. Questions on the phone company survey would include price points, color preference, and camera quality.</p> \n<p>Surveys intended for conjoint analysis are formatted to reflect the buyer's journey.</p> \n<p>For instance, notice in this example for televisions, the specs are the options and the consumer picks what best reflects their lifestyle:</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/conjoint%20analysis%20example.png?width=706&amp;name=conjoint%20analysis%20example.png\" alt=\"conjoint analysis example\" width=\"706\" style=\"width: 706px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"><em><span style=\"font-size: 10px;\"><strong><a href=\"https://www.surveygizmo.com/resources/blog/conjoint-analysis/\">Image Source</a></strong></span></em></p> \n<p>This direct method of giving consumers multiple profiles to then analyze is how conjoint analysis got its name. These answers are helpful when determining how to market a new product.</p> \n<p>If answers on the phone company survey proved that their target audience of adults ages 18-25 wanted a green phone from $400-600 and a camera with portrait mode, advertisements can cater directly to that.</p> \n<p>The conjoint analysis shows what consumers are willing to give up in order to get what they need. For instance, some might be willing to pay a little more money for a larger model of a phone if their preference is larger text.</p> \n<h2>Types of Conjoint Analysis</h2> \n<p>Choice-based conjoint (CBC) and Adaptive Conjoint Analysis (ACA) are the two main types of conjoint analysis.</p> \n<blockquote> \n <p>Choice-based is the most common form because it asks consumers to mimic their buying habits. ACA is helpful for product design, offering more questions about specs of a product.</p> \n</blockquote> \n<p>Choice-based conjoint analysis questions are usually presented in a \"Would you rather?\" format. For example, \"Would you rather take a ride-share service to a location 10 minutes away for $13 or walk 30 minutes for free?\" The marketer for the ride-share service could use answers from this question to think of the upsides to show off in different campaigns.</p> \n<p>ACA leans towards a Likert-scale format (most likely to least likely) for its attribute-based questions. Respondents can base their preference on specs by showing how likely they are to buy a product with slight differences — for example, similar cars with different doors and manufacturers.</p> \n<h2>How To Do A Conjoint Analysis</h2> \n<p>To create a conjoint analysis, you'll first need to define a list of attributes about your product. Attributes are usually four to five items that describe your product or service. Consider color, size, price, and market-specific attributes, such as lenses if you're selling cameras.</p> \n<p>Additionally, try to keep in mind your ideal respondents. Who do you want to answer your survey? A group of adult men? A group of working mothers? Identify your respondent base and ask specific questions catered to that target market.</p> \n<p>The next step is to organize your questionnaire depending on the type of conjoint analysis you want to conduct. For instance, to run an adaptive conjoint analysis, you will present questions with a Likert-scale.</p> \n<p>You can use a conjoint analysis tool to create and modify your survey. Then, you can distribute your questionnaire through multiple channels, including email, SMS, and social media.</p> \n<p>For more ways to introduce product marketing into your company, check out our <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/product-marketing?_ga=2.125836493.1138478006.1643301254-748143700.1643301254\"><span>ultimate guide here</span></a>.</p> \n<h2>Examples of Conjoint Analysis</h2> \n<p>Sawtooth Software offers a great example of conjoint analysis for a phone company:</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/conjoint%20analysis%20example%202.png?width=752&amp;name=conjoint%20analysis%20example%202.png\" alt=\"conjoint analysis example\" width=\"752\" style=\"width: 752px;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12px;\"><em><a href=\"http://www.sawtooth.com/index.php/consulting/conjoint-analysis-example/\">Image Source</a></em></span></p> \n<p>The analysis puts three different phone services next to each other. The horizontal column of the model identifies which service is offering a certain program, described by the vertical values. The bottom row shows a percent value of consumers' preferences.</p> \n<p>QuestionPro offers this <a href=\"https://www.questionpro.com/survey-templates/conjoint-analysis-retirement-housing/\">fun, interactive conjoint analysis template</a> about retirement home options. The survey gives you a scenario and asks your course of action. For instance, it asks if you would sign a rental agreement for retirement home housing immediately, and considers specs like rent, meals, size, etc.</p> \n<p>Conjoint analysis isn't limited to existing products. They're also very helpful for figuring out if a brand-new product is worth developing. For instance, if surveys show that audiences would be into the idea of an app that chooses clothes for consumers, that could be a new venture for clothing companies in the future.</p> \n<p>Looking to create a conjoint analysis of your own? Check out our top four conjoint analysis tools below.</p> \n<h2>Conjoint Analysis Tools</h2> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://www.qualtrics.com/research-core/conjoint-analysis/\">Qualtrics</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/dljE-fHFAUmTCRVjNx4YBrVtf_4f8piYKenWCKviyQso8_Vq1n60EkyKyE9VW5mVCSuxCoKNZh38TCz-U8yRWf5H8jU83bg59YC_3t-kMjiTqnfs-hkhNeokMs5GNzqffBO8yqqN\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px;\" alt=\"Conjoint Analysis from Qualtrics\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.qualtrics.com/design-xm/conjoint-analysis/\" style=\"font-size: 10px;\"><em><span>Image Source</span></em></a></p> \n<p>Qualtrics is an easy-to-use survey tool that offers comprehensive product insights. You can create, modify, distribute, and analyze a conjoint analysis in one place. All it takes is four steps — define your attributes, build and modify your questions in the survey editor, distribute the survey, and analyze the results.&nbsp;</p> \n<p><strong>What We Like:</strong> Qualtrics goes beyond product insights — this powerful software also captures customer, brand, and employee experience insights.</p> \n<p><strong>Pro Tip:</strong> Leverage email to invite respondents to take your survey. With Qualtrics, you can embed a survey question directly in your email survey invite.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://conjointly.com/\">Cojoint.ly</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/xHegCVzbKTJooNMiaKLoYCmdJ0qH55gOULr3GyYLtZyStm9GFSLI-igefEQITCuzMUMRE_2zpFBWoOZxd-L8ZqOE54jpZNQQRiZ_UoYfvlMOtCiBjJp_CEgB4xcRKdnREZfXeaeH\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px;\" alt=\"Conjoint Analysis from Conjoint.ly\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://conjointly.com/products/generic-conjoint/\" style=\"font-size: 10px;\"><em><span>Image Source</span></em></a></p> \n<p>Conjoint.ly offers a complete toolbox for product and pricing research — including a Product Description test, an A/B test, and a Price Sensitivity test. You can also source your own respondents for your survey or buy quality-assured respondents from Conjoint.ly.</p> \n<p><strong>What We Like:</strong> Users can simply choose a tool that best fits their research question. These tools are organized under four main categories: pricing research, features and claims, range optimization, and concept testing.</p> \n<p><strong>Pro Tip:</strong> If you want to \"try before you buy,\" you can use Conjoint.ly's Quick Feedback tool. For a small price, you get around 50 respondents to provide feedback within a 6-hour window.</p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://www.1000minds.com/\">1000minds</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/SHXkxL2-sEBDsMBAo_zs29VcUFCeNDq2jpGMrkCPZVQb30LE60lSIPWu1-GYYSaNb6kJWfUxxly-LQ-L0yaIGUfYLad0yh5npnqeADQz1wQm81i10rWfeBU6uQQE4oOmOxp_NHUu\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px;\" alt=\"Conjoint Analysis from 1000minds\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.1000minds.com/conjoint-analysis\" style=\"font-size: 10px;\"><em><span>Image Source</span></em></a></p> \n<p>1000minds offers an adaptive conjoint analysis tool. Meaning, each time a choice is made, it adapts by formulating a new question to ask based on all previous choices. This makes the survey feel more like a conversation.</p> \n<p><strong>What We Like:</strong> We're impressed by the scalability of 1000minds. The tool allows you to include as many participants as you like, potentially in the thousands.</p> \n<p><strong>Pro Tip:</strong> You can use their conjoint analysis templates or build your own model from scratch.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>4. <a href=\"https://www.qresearchsoftware.com/\">Q Research Software</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/rNDE1aPqKGAzfWfp76ksB6QOQQ_L023X5JAswfwCGghnqPfd9fhcZT6PS1KwWz3OGkA_pv6lobAg2x49XshiWQnLCFYx_FqQJGEp_ibFlZXpjE4nA-Ok5Z0yvHqaQSgaPnh6gCba\" width=\"624\" height=\"412\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" alt=\"Conjoint Analysis from Q Research Software\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.qresearchsoftware.com/\" style=\"font-size: 10px;\"><em><span>Image Source</span></em></a></p> \n<p>Q is analysis software that is specifically designed by market researchers. Its conjoint analysis tool is ideal for choice-based analyses. Users can create experimental designs, analyze the data, and generate reports.&nbsp;</p> \n<p><strong>What We Like:</strong> Q cuts through the grunt work with automation — including cleaning and formatting data, updating surveys, and producing reports.</p> \n<p><strong>Pro Tip:</strong> With just a few clicks, you can export any reports or visualizations from Q to PowerPoint and Excel.</p> \n<p>A conjoint analysis requires a solid survey design and analysis, but the extra effort is often worth it. By going the extra mile, you can access insights into your audience's preferences and buying decisions — which is invaluable when determining how to market a new product or service.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=560aa80b-9e0b-4615-851c-f23e4f49b62f&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"New Call-to-action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/560aa80b-9e0b-4615-851c-f23e4f49b62f.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 23 Feb 2022 12:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/6ba52ce7-bb69-4b63-965b-4ea21ba905da.png","linkMd5":"ed62aafd9224898a504aee07d3eadc22","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn24@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-26-48-507_3c323ccea639359f.webp","destWidth":486,"destHeight":60,"sourceBytes":5174,"destBytes":7456,"author":"Kayla Carmicheal","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/6ba52ce7-bb69-4b63-965b-4ea21ba905da.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn24@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-26-48-507_3c323ccea639359f.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/conjoint%20analysis%20example.png?width=706&name=conjoint%20analysis%20example.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn45@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-49-427_f87dfb8ddb0d4d7e.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/conjoint%20analysis%20example%202.png?width=752&name=conjoint%20analysis%20example%202.png":null,"https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/dljE-fHFAUmTCRVjNx4YBrVtf_4f8piYKenWCKviyQso8_Vq1n60EkyKyE9VW5mVCSuxCoKNZh38TCz-U8yRWf5H8jU83bg59YC_3t-kMjiTqnfs-hkhNeokMs5GNzqffBO8yqqN":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn6@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-56-230_58e869f665bc6d1e.webp","https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/xHegCVzbKTJooNMiaKLoYCmdJ0qH55gOULr3GyYLtZyStm9GFSLI-igefEQITCuzMUMRE_2zpFBWoOZxd-L8ZqOE54jpZNQQRiZ_UoYfvlMOtCiBjJp_CEgB4xcRKdnREZfXeaeH":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn63@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-49-835_ab528d1be9c2079a.webp","https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/SHXkxL2-sEBDsMBAo_zs29VcUFCeNDq2jpGMrkCPZVQb30LE60lSIPWu1-GYYSaNb6kJWfUxxly-LQ-L0yaIGUfYLad0yh5npnqeADQz1wQm81i10rWfeBU6uQQE4oOmOxp_NHUu":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn78@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-54-530_6750e3452eac57a6.webp","https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/rNDE1aPqKGAzfWfp76ksB6QOQQ_L023X5JAswfwCGghnqPfd9fhcZT6PS1KwWz3OGkA_pv6lobAg2x49XshiWQnLCFYx_FqQJGEp_ibFlZXpjE4nA-Ok5Z0yvHqaQSgaPnh6gCba":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn66@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-54-704_8d9735c57959c03d.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/560aa80b-9e0b-4615-851c-f23e4f49b62f.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn58@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-54-369_56bafbfb62a605be.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fconjoint-analysis&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn42@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-56-507_9a810506195f6307.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246408224},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"15 of the Best Women@INBOUND Quotes to Inspire You Today","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/inbound-women-quotes","description":"<p><a href=\"https://www.inbound.com/\">INBOUND</a> is a key milestone for professionals in industries spanning across marketing, sales, customer success, revenue operations, and more.</p>  \n<p>For Women's History Month, the INBOUND team is excited to highlight some of the most impactful quotes from the incredibly talented women who have graced our stages over the past 10 years.</p> \n<p>Providing opportunities that go beyond having a seat at the table to actually having a voice is how we will continue to transform the future of business.</p> \n<p>Let's dive in.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3 style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.inbound.com/?utm_source=HubSpot+Blog&amp;utm_medium=Blog&amp;utm_campaign=Womens+History+Month+Quotes\">Sign Up to Speak at INBOUND 2022</a></h3> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\"><span style=\"font—weight: normal;\">15 Inspirational Quotes from Past INBOUND Women Speakers</span></h2> \n<p>1. \"Fail is the F word for business. If failure is not an option, neither is success.\" — Beth Comstock, Advisor &amp; Author</p> \n<p>2. \"It is human emotion that drives all of our decision making. It's what drives us to be our best selves.\" — Bozoma St. John, Chief Marketing Officer, Netflix</p> \n<p>3. \"Vulnerability is the birthplace of innovation, creativity, and change.\" — Bren<span>é</span> Brown, Professor, Author, Podcast Host</p> \n<p>4. \"Maybe it's not about getting the part. It's about forging your own path through the wilderness. You chart a different course.\" — Brit Marling, Actress</p> \n<p>5. \"I define talent in a particular way, I don't look for polish as much as I look for promise.\" — Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie, Writer</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/chimamanda%20quote.png?width=1600&amp;name=chimamanda%20quote.png\" alt=\"chimamanda quote\" width=\"1600\" style=\"width: 1600px;\"></p> \n<p>6. \"Ignorance, at this point, can only be willful.\" — Emily Chang, Executive Producer, Bloomberg Technology&nbsp;</p> \n<p>7. \"It is the quality of our relationships that determines the quality of our lives.\"— Esther Perel, Psychotherapist</p> \n<p>8. \"Your best mentors are your peers, because you will rise together.\" — Joanna Coles, Former Chief Content Officer, Hearst Magazines</p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: normal;\">9. \"Nothing great has ever come out of a lot of easy days.\" — Leila Janah, CEO of Samasource</p> \n<p>10. \"Don't ask if your dream is crazy, ask if it's crazy enough.\" — Lena Waithe, Actress</p> \n<p>11. \"Time is the most important thing we have. Every minute of your life should be spent doing what you want to.\" — Payal Kadakia, Entrepreneur&nbsp;</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/payal%20quote.png?width=1600&amp;name=payal%20quote.png\" alt=\"payal quote\" width=\"1600\" style=\"width: 1600px;\"></p> \n<p>12. \"What's the point of being a woman in power if you can't help women in power?\" — Shonda Rhimes, Television Producer, Screenwriter, Author</p> \n<p>13. \"You don't have to lower your standards. There are people who share your values and have the skills to do the job well, you just need to take the time to look for them.\" — Tarana Burke, American Activist&nbsp;</p> \n<p>14. \"If I were to give one piece of business advice to my younger self it would be respect your workers and fight for change.\" — Judith Heumann, American Disability Rights Activist&nbsp;</p> \n<p>15. \"Start before you're ready. No idea is ever going to be 100% perfect, the timing is never going to be 100% right, I'm a big believer that if you jump in and get started, you'll find your way and if you start today, imagine where you could be in just one year.\" — Sarah Paiji Yoo, Founder/CEO of Blueland</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=6e386943-0655-4288-9829-0962158157f4&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"New Call-to-action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/6e386943-0655-4288-9829-0962158157f4.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Finbound-women-quotes&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 07 Mar 2022 20:22:17 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"8f9f3f5b9dc74df42ff958ced2d79a9e","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Andréa Hudson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/chimamanda%20quote.png?width=1600&name=chimamanda%20quote.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn93@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-53-549_3febf051b384b019.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/payal%20quote.png?width=1600&name=payal%20quote.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn22@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-56-623_dbc5aa55ac4476ea.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/6e386943-0655-4288-9829-0962158157f4.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn69@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-54-761_3a697e214feb5beb.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Finbound-women-quotes&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn5@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-49-574_21af4481054dbf03.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246408204},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"Ad Tracking: What It Is & How to Do It","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/7249/a-marketer-s-guide-to-tracking-online-campaigns.aspx","description":"<p>Tracking ad engagement and impact has been historically hit-or-miss. There wasn't a universal standard for measuring the success of an ad campaign. In fact, the term ROI (return on investment) wasn't even widely used <a href=\"https://mashable.com/2013/04/27/roi-definition/\">until the mid-1960s</a>.</p> \n<p>A lot has changed since then. Advertisers now have access to a wealth of granular ad tracking data for every single campaign they run. Ad tracking lets marketing teams leverage this data to more accurately measure, test, and revise ads based on how users interact with their online campaigns.</p> \n<a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=da1bfbbd-7ee9-4bf1-89d1-6d7a833deb08&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Download Now: Free Ad Campaign Planning Kit\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/da1bfbbd-7ee9-4bf1-89d1-6d7a833deb08.png\" align=\"middle\"></a> \n<p></p> \n<p>If you're new to running online ads, it's important to spend some time thinking about the specific metrics that will determine the success of your campaign. Ad tracking today exists across a number of different tools and platforms, and advertisers have the ability to collect data on everything from views and clicks, to impressions and behavior across multiple sessions and websites.</p> \n<p>The sheer amount of data available can be overwhelming (not to mention distracting from your goals), so deciding on one or two key performance indicators (KPIs) will help focus your efforts and make reporting more straightforward and effective.</p> \n<blockquote> \n <p>\"Good key performance indicators are simple, timely, critical to the success of a project, and not financial in nature. But you also need to add in one thing if you want it to be a successful marketing metric -- <strong>it must represent a key behavior you wanted to see</strong>. Look at your campaign and ask yourself: What’s the behavior I want to influence, not just something I can measure?\"</p> \n</blockquote> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\">— <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/agency/measure-kpi?_ga=2.55325803.159970128.1644874104-345458440.1644874104\">William Stentz, Director of Marketing Analytics at Carmichael Lynch</a></p> \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/analyze-performance-display-ads\">We wrote an article here</a> that can help you determine the right metrics to track based on the goals of your ad campaign.</p> \n<p>Once you've determined the metrics you want to track for your ad, it's time to find the best ad tracking method for your purposes. The exact ad tracking methods available to you will vary based on where you run your ads and which tools you're using, but here are a few basic types to keep in mind. It's important to note that the following ad tracking methods aren't mutually exclusive -- in fact, when used together they can provide even more powerful insights.</p> \n<h2>Technical Tracking Tools</h2> \n<p>When it comes to ad tracking, technical tools are a good place to start. These include options for tracking URLs from your website, ads placed in emails or sidebar displays or webpages and cookie-based tracking to unpack user behavior and fine-tune your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/marketing-plan-template-generator\">marketing plan</a>. Let’s explore each in more detail.</p> \n<h3>Tracking URLs</h3> \n<p>A tracking URL is a normal page URL from your website with a tracking token added to the end of it. Here's an example landing page URL by itself, and with a tracking token (in bold).</p> \n<p>Regular old landing page URL:</p> \n<p><code>http://www.yourwebsite.com/your-landing-page/</code></p> \n<p>Landing page URL with a tracking token:</p> \n<p><code>http://www.yourwebsite.com/your-landing-page/<strong>?utm_campaign=test-campaign&amp;utm_source=email</strong></code></p> \n<p>As you can see, the page URL is the same in both cases, but in the second case, there's some extra stuff added to the end. This extra stuff is your tracking token, also called a UTM parameter.</p> \n<p>So how does this \"extra stuff\" help you track things, exactly?</p> \n<p>When a user clicks on a URL with a UTM parameter added to the end, it essentially sends a signal back to your ad tracking tool that the URL was clicked. The \"<span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">source=_____</span>\" bit of the tracking token can provide information about where the user clicked the link. Similarly, the \"<span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">campaign=_____</span>\" bit can be used to signal to your tracking tool that the link should be bucketed as part of a campaign.</p> \n<p>For example, if you were to run the same ad on multiple websites and wanted to know which one generated the most clicks, you could define the two different websites as sources in the UTM parameters of your links.</p> \n<p>You can learn more about tracking parameters and how they work in <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/what-are-utm-tracking-codes-ht\">this article</a>.</p> \n<h4>When to use tracking URLs:</h4> \n<p>If you're running a PPC campaign, sending an email, or putting an advertisement on another website, tracking URLs are ideal for calculating the number of visits, leads, and conversions you've generated from your hard work.</p> \n<h3>Tracking Pixels</h3> \n<p>A tracking pixel is a tiny, often transparent, 1px by 1px image that can be placed in an email, display ad, or simply on a webpage. When it loads, it sends a signal back to your tracking tool that a user has viewed the page.</p> \n<p>Tracking pixels are also capable of collecting pretty comprehensive data about a user's activity and browser configuration -- but you should only ever track information that is directly useful to your buyer's journey and will provide a better, more personalized experience for your target users.</p> \n<p>When used correctly, tracking pixels can help optimize your ads and get them in front of a receptive audience. For example, using banner ad tracking with a pixel lets you gather information about how many people just view versus actually click on your ad, which will help you determine whether or not an ad was actually successful (and worth running again).</p> \n<p>For context, here's how big a tracking pixel appears (no, that's not just a speck of dust on your screen):</p> \n<p><img alt=\"Google tracking pixel\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Ad%20Tracking%20What%20It%20Is%20%26%20How%20to%20Do%20It.png?width=400&amp;name=Ad%20Tracking%20What%20It%20Is%20%26%20How%20to%20Do%20It.png\" title=\"\" width=\"400\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 400px;\"></p> \n<h4>When to use tracking pixels:</h4> \n<p>Tracking pixels are incredibly useful for tracking the success of your online campaigns through every step of your conversion path. They can give you insight into how users are interacting with your ads, and help you optimize each stage of your user journey from initial touch through final purchase.</p> \n<h3>Cookies</h3> \n<p>Cookies can help you gain insight into user behavior on your website across multiple sessions of activity. Marketers need to gain explicit consent from users before using cookies to track their activity. When explicit consent is given, cookies can be used to customize a user's experience. Here's a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/customers/what-is-cookie-tracking\">deeper dive on cookies</a> if you want to learn more about the technical aspects of how they function.</p> \n<p>From an ad tracking perspective, cookies are the driving force behind most ad retargeting campaigns. Cookies can be used to essentially build a user profile based on someone's web activity and habits, and advertisers can leverage this profile to serve ads that align with a user's observed interests. They can also capture information about a user's browser configuration, location, and preferred language.</p> \n<h4>When to use cookies:</h4> \n<p>Cookies are ideal when you want to serve a user ads aligned with their web browsing activity, or retarget them with ads for products they've demonstrated an interest in. Cookies can also be used to create a personalized experience for users on your website based on their previous interactions with you -- for example, you could create an abandoned cart email when users put items in their cart and then leave your website.</p> \n<p>Now that we've gone over a few core solutions related to ad targeting, let's take a deeper look at how ad targeting functions on a few of the biggest ad tracking platforms, and how you can use it to make your own ad campaigns stronger and more effective.</p> \n<h2>Search and Social Ad Tracking Solutions</h2> \n<p>Brands can also boost their ad tracking ability by using tools that integrate with search tools such as Google or social media sites such as Facebook and Instagram. This type of ad tracking provides more in-depth information about user behaviors and preferences to help companies fine-tune their marketing efforts.</p> \n<h3>DoubleClick Ad Tracking</h3> \n<p>If you've ever noticed an ad for a product you viewed weeks ago following you around on the internet, it's likely the result of DoubleClick ad tracking. <a href=\"https://support.google.com/faqs/answer/2727482?hl=en\">DoubleClick</a>, which was acquired by Google in 2008, is an ad management and ad serving platform that enables marketers to run ad campaigns across multiple channels.</p> \n<p>Online publishers use DoubleClick to essentially rent out ad space on their websites, and agencies and advertisers use the product to place ads on websites where their target audiences are spending time.</p> \n<p>In 2012, Google <a href=\"https://adexchanger.com/platforms/doubleclick-no-more-google-renames-its-ad-stack/\">rebranded</a> their DoubleClick products as Google Marketing Platform (formerly DoubleClick), Google Ads (formerly Google AdWords), and Google Ad Manager (formerly DoubleClick for Publishers and DoubleClick Ad Exchange).</p> \n<p>Google ad tracking offers advertisers a number of different options when they create campaigns on the platform -- most of which rely on the use of cookies.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://support.google.com/admanager/answer/2839090?hl=en\">According to Google</a>, \"Cookies themselves contain no personally identifiable information. Depending on the publisher’s and user’s settings, information associated with cookies used in advertising may be added to the user’s Google Account.\"</p> \n<p>These generic cookies can collect information on the time and date you viewed particular ads, the specific web pages you were on when you viewed an ad, and your IP address -- which can help the cookie infer where you're located.</p> \n<p>Although the cookies contain no personally identifiable information, <a href=\"https://thenextweb.com/google/2019/02/05/google-has-quietly-dropped-ban-on-personally-identifiable-web-tracking/\">Google can combine</a> the information it obtains via cookies with the personally identifiable information associated with your Google Account (which includes your browsing and search activity when you're logged into Google -- which, for most of us, is pretty much always).</p> \n<p>Google leverages two main types of cookies: first-party and third-party.</p> \n<p>First-party cookies are dropped (i.e., assigned to a specific user) by the owner of the website you're visiting. Information collected via first-party cookies can help publishers better understand your activity on their site and how ads are performing.</p> \n<p>Third-party cookies are dropped by an advertiser on a website where their ads are being displayed. These cookies send information back to advertisers about how their ad campaigns are performing across all the websites where their DoubleClick ads are being displayed.</p> \n<p>Over <a href=\"https://trends.builtwith.com/websitelist/Google-Adsense\">11.1 million websites</a> currently run ads as part of Google's AdSense network. If you visit a website within the network, the information collected via a DoubleClick ad tracking cookie will be pooled and leveraged by other websites and advertisers using AdSense.</p> \n<p>This consolidation of cookie information results in an extremely rich pool of data for Google advertisers, as they can keep track of what ads you're served across millions of different websites.</p> \n<p>To get started tracking ads with Google, you'll need to <a href=\"https://marketingplatform.google.com/about/\">get a Google Marketing Platform account</a>. Depending on the size of your business and your particular needs, you'll choose either an enterprise account -- which can accommodate large ad campaigns across multiple websites and mediums -- or a small business account -- with ad tracking tools more focused and specialized for early company growth.</p> \n<h3>Facebook Pixel</h3> \n<p>Advertisers on Facebook can leverage a number of different ad tracking strategies to optimize ads for their audience. Facebook's <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/facebook-pixel\">ad tracking pixel</a> is one of the more common methods for both desktop and mobile ad tracking. It functions similarly to the basic tracking pixel we outlined above, and can be used to track the path someone takes from viewing an ad, to visiting your website, to purchasing a product.</p> \n<p>When an action takes place on a page where a tracking pixel has been set up, the pixel will \"fire\" and send that information back to your Facebook Events Manager account. Information collected via the tracking pixel can also be used in the creation of custom audiences for future ad campaigns.</p> \n<p>For example, you could use data collected via a tracking pixel to create a custom ad audience targeting users who viewed a particular page on your website that implies purchase intent -- like a pricing page. We wrote an article that goes <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/facebook-pixel\">deeper into how the tracking pixel functions</a> if you want to learn more about different uses and how to set it up.</p> \n<p>Worth noting? Because Facebook owns Instagram, pixel works the same way on the photo-sharing site and will deliver the same type of insights. Collecting data from both Facebook and Instagram in tandem is a great way to pinpoint strategies that may work well on one platform but under-perform on the other. For example, longer text-driven ads may drive click-throughs on your Facebook page but fall flat on Instagram, where images drive interaction.</p> \n<h3>Additional Ad Tracking Options</h3> \n<p>While the Facebook pixel can offer advertisers valuable insights into how ads are influencing specific actions on their websites, it's not the only way to track ads on the social network.</p> \n<p>Another ad tracking option available to help improve <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/ad-management-tools\">ad management</a> is adding UTM parameters to links that appear on your ads. As we discussed above, tracking parameters use extra code on a URL to \"fire\" when a user loads the link. On Facebook, they can <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/help/1016122818401732\">be used</a> in Ads Manager to better understand which ads you're running are driving which types of traffic.</p> \n<h2>It All Adds Up: Improving Impact with Ad Tracking</h2> \n<p>Competitive Ad tracking can help your business see how your marketing efforts and campaigns are performing at scale. This starts with URL, pixel, and cookie tracking to explore how users are interacting with your brand. It’s bolstered by search-focused and social-focused tools that help your brand discover where ads are working, where they come up short, and where they need to improve to increase user engagement and drive sales conversions.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in July 2019 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=46d72524-f4a7-44e9-9af0-935be9bb3891&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"Improve your website with effective technical SEO. Start by conducting this  audit.&nbsp;&nbsp;\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/46d72524-f4a7-44e9-9af0-935be9bb3891.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fblog%2Ftabid%2F6307%2Fbid%2F7249%2Fa-marketer-s-guide-to-tracking-online-campaigns.aspx&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 10 Mar 2022 12:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/da1bfbbd-7ee9-4bf1-89d1-6d7a833deb08.png","linkMd5":"ee8c531d78b1cc8702e2da7c33713d83","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn35@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-26-48-718_91a8856cb36791e3.webp","destWidth":427,"destHeight":60,"sourceBytes":3972,"destBytes":6552,"author":"apitre@hubspot.com (Andy Pitre)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/da1bfbbd-7ee9-4bf1-89d1-6d7a833deb08.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn35@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-26-48-718_91a8856cb36791e3.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Ad%20Tracking%20What%20It%20Is%20%26%20How%20to%20Do%20It.png?width=400&name=Ad%20Tracking%20What%20It%20Is%20%26%20How%20to%20Do%20It.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn13@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-57-102_8a20d17136b0230e.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/46d72524-f4a7-44e9-9af0-935be9bb3891.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn45@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-55-047_8e21eaa098288b31.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fblog%2Ftabid%2F6307%2Fbid%2F7249%2Fa-marketer-s-guide-to-tracking-online-campaigns.aspx&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn37@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-49-694_e361954685a0df45.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246408185},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"34 of the Best Website Designs to Inspire You in 2022","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-website-designs-list","description":"<p>Your website inspiration journey starts here.</p> \n<p>Deciding to create a web presence is a big decision, but the best websites are a culmination of many small decisions. But one major decision that takes time, diligence, and a great deal of inspiration is the design of your website.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=c791aced-6180-48a5-916d-b2d76cec1836&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Free Download: 77 Examples of Brilliant Web Design&nbsp;\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/c791aced-6180-48a5-916d-b2d76cec1836.png\" align=\"middle\" /></a></p> \n<p>In this article, we’re sharing a few dozen of the best website designs we’ve seen. Click the links below to jump to explore website designs that crushed it in the last several years. We’ve also included a bonus section of designs that are just plain cool — so check them out, too!</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-website-designs-list#where-design-inspiration\">Where to Get Your Design Inspiration</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-website-designs-list#inspiration-sources\">Website Design Inspiration Sources</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-website-designs-list#design-2021\">Today's Cool Website Designs</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-website-designs-list#design-2020\">Best Website Designs from 2020</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-website-designs-list#design-2019\">Best Website Designs from 2019</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-website-designs-list#design-2018\">Best Website Designs from 2018</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-website-designs-list#design-2017\">Best Website Designs from 2017</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-website-designs-list#design-2016\">Best Website Designs from 2016</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-website-designs-list#design-2014\">Best Website Designs from 2015 – 2014</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-website-designs-list#design-ideas\">Website Design Ideas</a></li> \n</ul> \n<a></a> \n<h2>Where to Get Your Design Inspiration</h2> \n<p>If you want some design inspo, the good news is that you can find it just about everywhere.</p> \n<p>One of the best ways to get inspiration for design is through travel. When you visit new places, you’re forced to get out of your comfort zone and experience something foreign.</p> \n<p>What makes design so interesting is that everyone sees it differently and so, there’s always more to discover.</p> \n<p>Another way to get design inspiration IRL is through the media. Every day, we are inundated with visual content. We make decisions about what we like, what we don’t like, and continue on our day.</p> \n<p>But what if you were more intentional about how you viewed those interactions? You could come out of it with valuable insights.</p> \n<a></a> \n<p>You also can’t forget to leverage design communities. From design conferences to Reddit forums, there are hundreds of groups out there that can offer inspiration as well as advice.</p> \n<p>Now that we’ve covered some IRL design inspiration sources, let’s cover the digital ones.</p> \n<h2>Website Design Inspiration Sources</h2> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/cms\">HubSpot’s Asset Marketplace</a></h3> \n<p>HubSpot’s Asset Marketplace houses hundreds of website templates that you can sift through to get inspired for your own website.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"website design inspiration sources\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/34%20of%20the%20Best%20Website%20Designs%20to%20Inspire%20You%20in%202022-Feb-05-2022-12-30-34-43-AM.jpeg?width=600&amp;name=34%20of%20the%20Best%20Website%20Designs%20to%20Inspire%20You%20in%202022-Feb-05-2022-12-30-34-43-AM.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 600px;\" title=\"\" width=\"600\" /></p> \n<p>The best part of the marketplace is that you can narrow down by industry and feature, allowing you to see the templates that are most relevant.</p> \n<p>Once you find a template you like, you can view a live preview of the site to get a full experience then download it if you decide to use it.</p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://dribbble.com/\">Dribble</a></h3> \n<p>Dribble is where designers go to get inspired and to share their work. The website has everything from animation and branding to illustration and mobile.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"website design inspiration sources dribble\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/34%20of%20the%20Best%20Website%20Designs%20to%20Inspire%20You%20in%202022-Feb-05-2022-12-30-40-51-AM.jpeg?width=600&amp;name=34%20of%20the%20Best%20Website%20Designs%20to%20Inspire%20You%20in%202022-Feb-05-2022-12-30-40-51-AM.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 600px;\" title=\"\" width=\"600\" /></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://dribbble.com/shots/popular/web-design\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>Once you navigate to the “Web Design” tab on the homepage, you can filter results by color scheme, editing software, timeframe, and tags.</p> \n<p>Furthermore, if you find a designer whose work you like, you can save the design for future reference and follow their work to see other designs on their profile.</p> \n<p>This is an incredible resource to use whether you’re starting from scratch or already have a solid plan in mind.</p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://www.behance.net/\">Bēhance</a></h3> \n<p>This is another digital platform full of creative inspiration to leverage ahead of your website design project.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"website design inspiration sources behance\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/34%20of%20the%20Best%20Website%20Designs%20to%20Inspire%20You%20in%202022-Feb-05-2022-12-30-40-85-AM.jpeg?width=600&amp;name=34%20of%20the%20Best%20Website%20Designs%20to%20Inspire%20You%20in%202022-Feb-05-2022-12-30-40-85-AM.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 600px;\" title=\"\" width=\"600\" /></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://www.behance.net/search/projects?field=web%20design\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>One of the best features on this site is the ability to filter by location. This allows you to see how designers in different regions differ in technique and style.</p> \n<p>This can be particularly helpful if you are designing a website for a foreign, unfamiliar market. You can gain interesting insights by evaluating the decisions made by Behance designers.</p> \n<h3>4. <a href=\"https://www.pttrns.com/\">Pttrns</a></h3> \n<p>Want to focus on mobile web design? Pttrns is the place to go.</p> \n<p>This subscription-based platform allows you to gain access to thousands of mobile design templates and get advice from top designers all over the world.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/website%20design%20inspiration%20pttrns--jpg.jpeg?width=600&amp;name=website%20design%20inspiration%20pttrns--jpg.jpeg\" alt=\"mobile website design inspiration pttrns\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://www.pttrns.com/\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>Additional features on this platform include:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>A favorites and collections folder to store your favorite designs.</li> \n <li><a></a>A studio to interact with other designers and get advice.</li> \n <li>A design guide to understand the strategy behind the designs.</li> \n</ul> \n<p></p> \n<p></p> \n<p>From familiar corporations to small businesses, to international organizations, the following sites push the status quo on the web. Whether it's the design aesthetic, usability, interactivity, sound design, or value that the site provides, each one is a masterpiece in its respective industry and something to aspire to.</p> \n<p>Not surprisingly, many organizations exist to highlight these sites and the contributions they make to the web. To help surface some of the most inspirational designs, I gathered several award-winners that have made their way through several key awards organizations — including Red Dot, Awwwards, UX Awards, The Webby Awards, SiteInspire, Best Website Gallery, and FWA.</p> \n<p>As you browse through the list, know that each site excels in its own way and seeks to serve a unique purpose. While one site may be an excellent example of visual design, another may be an excellent example of interactivity.</p> \n<p>This means that not all of these sites may be \"conversion machines\" or blueprint ideas that you can easily copy over to your site. Rather, they're great ways to gain some website design inspiration and see the cutting-edge marketing that's happening in the different corners of the web.</p> \n<p>Keep in mind that web designs are fluid and change often. Some of the designs in this list have changed since they were awarded, but we do our best to keep them up-to-date.
