ete%20Marketing%20Strategy%20in%202021-3.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn60@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-56-876_ad7a5061c312fd16.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%20Step-by-Step%20Guide%20to%20Creating%20a%20Complete%20Marketing%20Strategy%20in%202021-4.jpeg?width=400&name=The%20Step-by-Step%20Guide%20to%20Creating%20a%20Complete%20Marketing%20Strategy%20in%202021-4.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn4@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-51-231_a0b3c9a15ba84e7c.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%20Step-by-Step%20Guide%20to%20Creating%20a%20Complete%20Marketing%20Strategy%20in%202021.jpeg?width=400&name=The%20Step-by-Step%20Guide%20to%20Creating%20a%20Complete%20Marketing%20Strategy%20in%202021.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn47@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-52-211_30c626d4be551968.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%20Step-by-Step%20Guide%20to%20Creating%20a%20Complete%20Marketing%20Strategy%20in%202021-1.png?width=400&name=The%20Step-by-Step%20Guide%20to%20Creating%20a%20Complete%20Marketing%20Strategy%20in%202021-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn50@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-55-355_8787daa2e38ff2ce.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/lacroix.png?width=330&name=lacroix.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn67@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-55-886_b1098ff6957c0b45.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/olay.png?width=330&name=olay.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn88@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-52-752_7f85c7b71ec89f2a.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%20Step-by-Step%20Guide%20to%20Creating%20a%20Complete%20Marketing%20Strategy%20in%202021-2.jpeg?width=218&name=The%20Step-by-Step%20Guide%20to%20Creating%20a%20Complete%20Marketing%20Strategy%20in%202021-2.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn17@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-49-473_f7aa8482b725554e.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%20Step-by-Step%20Guide%20to%20Creating%20a%20Complete%20Marketing%20Strategy%20in%202021-Oct-13-2021-10-44-03-56-PM.jpeg?width=300&name=The%20Step-by-Step%20Guide%20to%20Creating%20a%20Complete%20Marketing%20Strategy%20in%202021-Oct-13-2021-10-44-03-56-PM.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn94@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-50-216_44fe186af417d1fb.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/af934ebe-a3e6-4d2a-b12f-1c7ea40641fb.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn30@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-51-054_b69ef96b2d492171.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fmarketing-strategy&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn5@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-56-994_1f0f3cb385c096d2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246408223},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"How to Manage Your Entire Marketing Budget [Free Budget Planner Templates]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-manage-marketing-budget-free-budget-templates","description":"<p>Let's say your company decided to invest in a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/33924/how-to-develop-a-website-redesign-strategy-that-guarantees-results-free-template.aspx\">website redesign</a> to improve lead generation, and you're responsible for managing the project.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>Naturally, one of the first questions you ask is, \"How much is this website redesign <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/website/how-much-website-cost\">going to cost</a>?\"</p> \n<p>The answer, of course, is \"it depends.\" Are you simply switching to a new template and adding some new CTAs, or are you migrating your entire website to a new platform?</p> \n<p>If only there were a way to organize your answers to all of these questions — a place where you could enter in estimated costs for all of your line items, and then compare your projected marketing budget to what you actually end up spending. Good news: Marketing budget templates can help.</p> \n<a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=3e2abb94-93d9-4cf5-bd8e-6a96ecc14270&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Click here to download 8 free marketing budget templates.\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/3e2abb94-93d9-4cf5-bd8e-6a96ecc14270.png\" align=\"middle\"></a> \n<p>Included in our <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-budget-templates\">eight marketing budget templates bundle</a> is a template to manage your website redesign ... as well as templates for both Excel and Google Sheets to help you track your content budget, paid advertising budget, event budget, and more.</p> \n<p>Additionally, in this guide, we discuss how to manage your entire marketing budget from start to finish.</p> \n<p></p> \n<a></a> \n<p></p> \n<h3>Marketing Budget for Small Business</h3> \n<p>Marketing budgets are especially important for small businesses. Small business owners may lack the experience drawing up budgets; moreover, it's critical that these companies keep costs as low and lean as possible as they scale.</p> \n<p>Ironically, you need marketing to scale. Without it, it's hard to sell your products and services. In addition to the budgeting templates provided below, check out some of our <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/free-content-creation-templates\">free offers</a> and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/free-online-marketing-classes\">courses</a> to mitigate your company's marketing costs.</p> \n<p>Yet marketing budgets can be difficult to establish for companies of all sizes.</p> \n<h3>How much should a company spend on marketing?</h3> \n<p>Well, <a href=\"https://insights.digitalmediasolutions.com/articles/digital-spending-2020\">digital media makes up more than half</a> of both U.S. and global advertising spend. This includes initiatives that cater to audiences on desktop computers, search engines, video streaming platforms, social media, and mobile devices.</p> \n<p>Given the success marketers have seen in it, you might consider planning to spend at least half of your marketing budget on some of these digital channels.</p> \n<p>Let's talk about other ways to allocate your marketing budget.</p> \n<p></p> \n<a></a> \n<p></p> \n<p>As you build a budget, there are a few items you'll want to keep in mind when planning your marketing budget allocation.</p> \n<h3>Marketing Cost Examples</h3> \n<h4>1. Software</h4> \n<p>When it comes to digital and even print media, you may need software to create your marketing campaigns or handle your daily processes. There’s a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/marketing-tools\">marketing tool</a> for just about any task you can think of, but they are generally broken down into the following categories:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/benefits-of-crm\">Customer relationship management </a>(CRM)</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/online-marketing-tools\">Online advertising</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-social-media-management-tools\">Social media</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/content-creation\">Content creation</a> and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/website/free-web-design-tools-2020\">design</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/event-marketing\">Event marketing</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/lead-generation-tools\">Lead capture and lead generation</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/marketing-automation-information\">Marketing automation</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/content-marketing-analytics\">Data reporting and analytics</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/website/digital-asset-management\">Digital asset management</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/collaboration-tools\">Team collaboration</a></li> \n</ul> \n<p>The costs of these tools can quickly add up, so it’s worth it to try out the <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/marketing-tools\">free options</a> until you’re ready to commit to a tool your team loves.</p> \n<h4>2. Freelancers</h4> \n<p>If you have a temporary campaign or want to test out a new marketing strategy, you might want to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/find-manage-freelancers\">hire a short-term freelancer</a> before bringing on a full-timer.</p> \n<p>Reach out to your network for recommendations or consider using a site like UpWork. Freelancers typically charge an hourly rate, so be sure to examine your budget before hiring.</p> \n<h4>3. New Personnel</h4> \n<p>When you do hire full-time employees, you'll want to budget costs including their computer, technology, benefits, and onboarding-related needs. According to research from <a href=\"https://www.zippia.com/advice/cost-of-hiring-statistics-average-cost-per-hire/#Cost_Per_Hire_Demographic_Statistics\">Zippia</a>, the average cost of hiring a new employee is $4,425.</p> \n<h4>4. Advertising</h4> \n<p>Budget how much money you'll spend on paid opportunities such as physical ads, native ads, sponsored content, search engine ads, and social media promotions.</p> Most businesses will benefit from some form of online advertising whether via social media platforms, search engine, or native ads. \n<a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/273018/number-of-internet-users-worldwide/\">Statista</a> estimates there were an estimated 4.9 billion internet users worldwide as of 2021. If you’re not advertising online, you're missing out.\n<br> \n<h4>5. Content Creation</h4> \n<p>When you create content such as videos, photos, or even blog posts, you'll need to put paid time into it.</p> \n<p>Content marketing brings in <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/content-creation\">3X </a>as many leads as traditional options, so it’s worth dedicating funds to this area. Budget how much money will go into creating this content so you can adjust accordingly based on its return on investment.</p> \n<p>Now that you know more about what to include in your budget, let’s look at how to those funds are spent.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-style: italic; font-size: 12px;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Marketing%20budget%20breakdown.jpg?width=650&amp;name=Marketing%20budget%20breakdown.jpg\" alt=\"Marketing budget breakdown\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" width=\"650\"><a href=\"https://www.gartner.com/en/marketing/research/annual-cmo-spend-survey-research\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>If you’re not sure where to start with budget allocation, a good guideline to follow is the 70-20-10 rule. Using this as a benchmark:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>70% of your budget is allocated toward strategies you know work well</li> \n <li>20% of your budget is allocated toward new strategies aimed at helping you grow</li> \n <li>10% of your budget is allocated toward experimental strategies</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>Marketing Cost Example</h3> \n<p>Let’s say your business has a marketing budget of $10,000. The budget allocation may look like this:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>$7,000 towards a CRM or other software you love, successful paid search campaigns, social media marketing</li> \n <li>$2,000 towards marketing a new product, feature, or service you’re testing</li> \n <li>$1,000 towards testing sponsored content</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>Allocation by Channel</h3> \n<p>How you allocate your budget per channel depends on your company’s particular goals, so there is no hard and fast rule. However, the chart below from <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/1222784/marketing-budget-share-channel/\">Statista</a> can give you a ballpark idea as it illustrates the share of marketing budgets from large companies across North America, the UK, Germany, and France.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-style: italic; font-size: 12px;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Marketing%20budget%20by%20channel%20Statista.jpg?width=650&amp;name=Marketing%20budget%20by%20channel%20Statista.jpg\" alt=\"Marketing budget cost by channel \" width=\"650\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"><a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/1222784/marketing-budget-share-channel/\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>Organized by channel, you can see that the top spots belong to social marketing, digital advertising, and search engine optimization (SEO).</p> \n<p>By 2023, it's estimated that marketers will spend more than <a href=\"https://www.emarketer.com/content/digital-ad-spending-outlook-blows-past-previous-forecasts\">$52 billion</a> on ads across websites or apps that are mainly eCommerce-focused. Let’s look at some examples of how these digital marketing costs apply to your budget.</p> \n<h4>Paid Search Advertising</h4> \n<p>You’re probably familiar with the ads at the top of a Google results page that show up above the list of search results. Those are a form of paid advertising called <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/ppc\">pay-per-click (PPC)</a>. You can <a href=\"https://ads.google.com/home/campaigns/search-ads/\">create and run ads on Google</a>, and each time someone clicks, you pay. The cost-per-click (CPC) can range anywhere from a few cents to a few dollars. You can use Google’s <a href=\"https://support.google.com/google-ads/answer/7337243\">keyword planner</a> to help estimate costs.</p> \n<p>With this method, you only pay for clicks you receive. So even if you’ve set aside a budget of $2,000, your campaign may only generate $1,500 worth of clicks.</p> \n<h4>Social Media</h4> \n<p>Like Google Ads, social media platforms have advertising programs based on the PPC model, but also charge by impressions. The CPC of running a paid social campaign varies depending on the platform of choice, but ranges from a few cents to a several dollars.</p> \n<p>Some companies may opt to hire an agency to run their campaigns and to create a social media strategy. Outsourcing this function is more expensive and can cost anywhere from <a href=\"https://www.digitalstand.com/blog/social-media-agency-charges\">$2,000 to $20,000</a> per month.</p> \n<h4>Content Marketing</h4> \n<p>Having a brand blog is a great way to get into content marketing, especially if you have in-house staff tasked with keeping it updated. Instead of a blog, you may be more interested in creating case studies, eBooks, videos or guides. They’re all designed to promote your brand and attract new customers.</p> \n<p>Content marketing costs vary widely based on what your goals are and area of focus. Hiring outside consultants or agencies to handle content marketing for you can range from <a href=\"https://www.webfx.com/content-marketing/pricing/\">$2,000 to $10,000</a> per month for small to medium-sized businesses. While it isn’t cheap, paying an agency to handle this task will free up your team’s time to work on other projects and may yield better results than going solo.</p> \n<h4>Email Marketing</h4> \n<p>Email marketing is a must-have for businesses, especially online retailers. With a customer acquisition rate <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/email-marketing-guide\">40X more effective</a> than Facebook and Twitter combined, it’s no surprise why this tried and true method is a staple in most marketing budgets. Email marketing also provides higher ROI as you’re connecting with people already interested in your brand.</p> \n<p>Email marketing costs depend on the size of your business, your goals, and chosen software or platform. Hiring an outside firm to handle these efforts will cost significantly more than doing it yourself.</p> \n<h4>Search Engine Optimization</h4> \n<p>SEO aids marketing efforts by improving your webpages so that they show up in search engines like Google. The more often your website comes up in search, the more potential customers will see it and hopefully visit your website.</p> \n<p>If you don’t have staff to handle your SEO needs in-house you may need to work with an agency. Depending on what your business needs are, this can cost thousands per month.</p> \n<p>While the marketing channel choices can seem endless, don't feel pressured to use all of them. Every business is different and you should prioritize putting funds toward the methods that best suit your needs.</p> \n<a></a> \n<p></p> \n<p>Spreadsheet knowledge <em>alone</em> won't help you understand how you'll spend your marketing money this year. Creating a sound marketing budget starts with knowing what purpose this budget will serve and which marketing teams it will represent.</p> \n<h3>1. Know your buyer's journey.</h3> \n<p>Your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/what-is-the-buyers-journey\">buyer's journey</a> is the steps your audience takes as they 'journey' from prospect to paying customer. Knowing your buyer's journey allows you to understand how your audience interacts with your marketing — and where to set your goals <em>and</em> budget to better reach your customers.</p> \n<p>Ask yourself these questions as you define your buyer's journey:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>How do your leads and customers typically discover your products?</li> \n <li>What do they need to know before they make a purchase?</li> \n <li>How many site visits do you see per month?</li> \n <li>How many leads are you generating per month, and how many of these convert to paying customers?</li> \n <li>What is the cost of generating new leads and then converting them to customers?</li> \n <li>What's the typical value/revenue of each lead?</li> \n</ul> \n<p>This process should point out what marketing tactics are (and aren't working), where you should alter your marketing goals, and where you can focus your marketing budget.</p> \n<h3>2. Align your budget with your marketing goals.</h3> \n<p>What you spend and where you spend it will depend on what you're trying to accomplish.</p> \n<p>So, when starting to create your marketing budget, make sure you're only spending money on the things required by your current marketing goals — goals set based on your audience and their journey from prospect to customer. These could include:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Display ads <strong>to promote a new product</strong> you're launching this year.</li> \n <li>Sponsored social media posts <strong>to generate followers</strong> on your new Facebook page.</li> \n <li>Paid search engine ads <strong>to drive traffic (and purchases)</strong> to a specific product page.</li> \n <li>Contract bloggers <strong>to get more organic search traffic</strong> to your company's website.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Former Demand Generation Marketer at HubSpot and current Head of Marketing at Tailscale, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/jessicacwebb\">Jessica Webb Kennedy</a>, says this about how your costs can change when focusing on lead generation vs. lead conversion: \"The majority of the money you spend on paid efforts is usually calculated based on the volume of clicks or impressions. Because of this, you'll often want to put more budget toward campaigns with higher-volume offers and audiences.\"</p> \n<p>\"For example, a tweet or Facebook ad promoting a lead generation offer that leans more top of the funnel will likely receive more clicks than something that falls more toward the middle or bottom of the funnel,\" she explains.</p> \n<p>Your paid advertising costs will also change depending on how wide of an audience you are attempting to reach.</p> \n<p>\"You can look at Twitter advertising as an example,\" Webb says. \"You have to option to target your campaigns based on users' interests or keywords searched for. Interests are a much broader category, whereas smaller pockets of users are searching for any given keyword, therefore your interests-based audience is going to be much larger and require a larger budget.\"</p> \n<h3>3. Beware of hidden marketing costs.</h3> \n<p>One of the great advantages to having and maintaining a budget spreadsheet is that it helps you avoid those end-of-the-quarter or end-of-the-year freak-outs when you realize, \"Whoa … what did I spend all that money on?\"</p> \n<p>In many cases, unanticipated costs can force marketers to fork over cash that they didn't plan on spending. Product marketing offers a perfect example. According to former HubSpot VP of Marketing and current CMO at The Wanderlust Group, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/meghankeaney\">Meghan Keaney Anderson</a>, it's easy to forget that successfully marketing your products and services requires more than just promotion.</p> \n<p>\"When people allocate budget for product marketing, they tend to think in terms of product launches and promotional activities,\" Anderson explains.</p> \n<p>\"That's certainly an important part of it, but another area of focus to remember is setting aside resources to conduct research and message testing long before the product ever goes to market. Having conversations with customers about the pain points your product will ultimately address is critical to shaping the messaging and having a successful launch.\"</p> \n<h3>4. Remember where your priorities lie.</h3> \n<p>Marketing is overflowing with add-ons and extras, upsells, and \"premium\" versions. One of the best ways to assess what's nice to have versus what's absolutely necessary is to (you guessed it) organize all of your expenses.</p> \n<p>By keeping tabs on where your budget is being allocated, and cross-checking that spending with the results you're getting, it will be much easier to figure out what should keep getting budget and what should get kicked to the curb.</p> \n<p>For example, let's look to the world of public relations. In PR, there are countless tools to which you can allocate budget, which could leave you overspending where it doesn't matter — and underspending where it does.</p> \n<p>\"Tools abound to help PR practitioners not only create and distribute great content and find and target key stakeholders, but to ultimately measure reach and effectiveness,\" says <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/nathanieleberle\">Nathaniel Eberle</a>, HubSpot's former Director of PR &amp; Brand and GoTo’s current VP of Global Brand &amp; Creative Management.</p> \n<p>\"The key is making sure you're laser-focused on who you're setting out to reach and influence, then ensuring that your budget supports how they'll most likely want to receive (and share) your key messages.</p> \n<p>\"As the media and digital landscape evolves at breakneck speed, continually reassessing the tools, services, and programs you're employing is a great way to determine real-time ROI of your overall spend. Today's measurement tool may be worthless to you tomorrow.\"</p> \n<h3>5. Spend your budget smartly.</h3> \n<p>When you open up these budget templates and check out all the various expenses detailed in them, don't fret if you can't tick every box. I'm not advocating for an \"always spend more\" approach to marketing.</p> \n<p>I'm advocating for an \"always spend smart\" approach. The expenses listed out aren't mandatory — they're just meant to guide your thinking and to help ensure that you haven't overlooked any hidden costs.</p> \n<h3>6. Prepare to measure ROI.</h3> \n<p>When you put a certain amount of money into a certain area, you'll want to determine if your budgeting helped you or hurt you as you plan out future budgets. The best way to do this is by measuring ROI — or return on investment.</p> \n<p>If the money you spend on one item results in your company making more in return, you may want to increase budget in the next year. If your money went nowhere, you should examine your budget.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h2>8 Marketing Budget Templates You Need to Manage Your Marketing Spend</h2> \n<p>With the <em>8 Free Budget Planner Templates to Manage Your Marketing Spend</em><em>,</em> you'll be able to manage all of the moving pieces of your budget at a monthly and quarterly level.</p> \n<p>Use the Excel version of the templates to keep all of your budgets in one place. When you download the zip file, you'll find a separate file for each marketing team, as well as a <em>Master Budget Template</em> to maintain a high-level view of your overall expenses.</p> \n<p>Interested in sharing your marketing budget across a larger team? Try the<strong> Google Sheets version of our templates</strong> to share access with other Gmail users. For the Google Sheets templates, each team budget is found in a separate tab of the same Google Sheet.</p> \n<p>No matter which version you choose, each budget is optimized with the same line items, tips, and graphs. Read on to learn how to use each budget template.</p> \n<h3>1. Master Marketing Budget Template</h3> \n<p><em><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-budget-templates\"><strong>Download the Master Marketing Budget Template here.</strong></a></em></p> \n<p>While it's helpful to have individual budget templates for specific marketing departments and activities, it's also nice to be able to take a step back and see the bigger picture.</p> \n<p>The <em>Master Marketing Budget Template</em> lets you do just that: It's the place where you can collect the totals from the other seven templates in the bundle and see all of your expenses in one place.</p> \n<h3><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-budget-templates\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-05-18%20at%2010.12.17%20AM.png?width=650&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-05-18%20at%2010.12.17%20AM.png\" alt=\"master marketing budget template\" width=\"650\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></a></h3> \n<h3>2. Product Marketing Budget Template</h3> \n<p><em><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-budget-templates\"><strong>Download the Product Marketing Budget Template here.</strong></a></em></p> \n<p>This template will guide you step-by-step through the process of budgeting for a product launch. From determining product/market fit, to running user testing sessions, to promoting your finished product, our <em>Product Marketing Budget Template</em> will help ensure you don't overlook any important expenses.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-budget-templates\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-05-18%20at%2010.03.53%20AM.png?width=650&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-05-18%20at%2010.03.53%20AM.png\" alt=\"product marketing budget template\" width=\"650\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></a></p> \n<h3>3. Content Budget Template</h3> \n<p><em><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-budget-templates\"><strong>Download the Content Budget Template here.</strong></a></em></p> \n<p>The budget required for creating and promoting content can vary greatly from organization to organization. For example, while some organizations keep most of their content operations in-house, others rely more heavily on freelancers and contractors. And while some use many different software products, publishing tools, and services, others take a much simpler approach.</p> \n<p>Our <em>Content Budget Template </em>is designed to cover as many content-related bases as possible. So, if you see any expenses listed that don't apply to <em>your</em> organization, go ahead and delete them. (That's the beauty of Excel spreadsheets: You can customize them to your specific needs.)</p> \n<h3><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-budget-templates\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-05-18%20at%2010.03.40%20AM-1.png?width=650&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-05-18%20at%2010.03.40%20AM-1.png\" alt=\"content budget template\" width=\"650\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></a>4. Paid Advertising Budget Template</h3> \n<p><em><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-budget-templates\"><strong>Download the Paid Advertising Budget Template here.</strong></a></em></p> \n<p>Paid advertising: Does it <em>really</em> qualify as an inbound marketing tactic/channel? That is a loaded question, my friends, and one that I don't have room to answer in-depth in this post.</p> \n<p>What I can tell you for sure is that <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/inboundy-outbound-how-to-do-traditional-marketing-inbound-way\">you can do paid advertising in an \"inboundy\" way</a> — i.e. by targeting specific buyer personas and using paid advertising as a supplement to your organic efforts to help drive awareness and conversion opportunities.</p> \n<p>Measuring the effectiveness of your paid advertising campaigns is also paramount to doing things the inbound way. Using our <em>Paid Advertising Budget Template</em>, you can keep tabs on your monthly (and quarterly) ad spending, and then cross-reference the amounts with your lead-generation metrics to determine your cost-per-lead.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-budget-templates\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-05-18%20at%2010.02.44%20AM.png?width=650&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-05-18%20at%2010.02.44%20AM.png\" alt=\"advertising budget template\" width=\"650\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></a></p> \n<h3>5. Public Relations Budget Template</h3> \n<p><em><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-budget-templates\"><strong>Download the Public Relations Budget Template here.</strong></a></em></p> \n<p>Public relations expenses amount to more than just paying for press releases. From reputation monitoring software, to traveling (e.g., to events and trade shows), to applying for awards, there are many PR costs that can be all too easy to overlook.</p> \n<p>To ensure you're accounting for all of your organization's PR-related expenses, check out our <em>Public Relations Budget Template</em>.</p> \n<h3>6. Branding &amp; Creative Budget Template</h3> \n<p><em><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-budget-templates\"><strong>Download the Creative Budget Template here.</strong></a></em></p> \n<p>In order to produce high-quality, innovative graphics, videos, and other content, the branding and creative teams of today need more than just Photoshop ... a lot more. One of the largest — and often most overlooked — expenses is storage.</p> \n<p>If your organization is producing a lot of video, storage is especially important. Because as it turns out, when budgeting for video storage, you shouldn't be thinking on a megabyte (MB) or even a gigabyte (GB) scale, but on a terabyte (TB) scale. FYI: 1 terabyte = 1 trillion bytes. You can keep track of all your storage costs (and other branding and creative costs) using our free template.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-budget-templates\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-05-18%20at%2010.01.58%20AM.png?width=650&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-05-18%20at%2010.01.58%20AM.png\" alt=\"branding creative budget template\" width=\"650\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></a></p> \n<h3>7. Website Redesign Budget Template</h3> \n<p><em><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-budget-templates\"><strong>Download the Website Redesign Budget Template here.</strong></a></em></p> \n<p>Budgeting for a website redesign can be seriously tricky. With so many moving pieces to consider, there is a lot of room for underestimating or miscalculating costs. We created our <em>Website Redesign Budget Template</em> so you can keep all of your redesign-related expenses in one convenient location.</p> \n<p>Unsure if your current website is right for a redesign? Check out this HubSpot research report: <em><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/does-your-website-make-the-grade\">Does Your Website Make the Grade? Chances Are, It's Barely Passing</a></em>.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-budget-templates\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-05-18%20at%2010.01.11%20AM.png?width=650&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-05-18%20at%2010.01.11%20AM.png\" alt=\"budget for website redesign\" width=\"650\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></a></p> \n<h3>8. Event Budget Template</h3> \n<p><em><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-budget-templates\"><strong>Download the Event Budget Template here.</strong></a></em></p> \n<p>When planning an event, the associated costs can seem obvious at first. There's the venue to consider, of course. And the P.A. system and microphones. And then the costs associated with booking and bringing in presenters/performers. That's pretty much it, right?</p> \n<p>Wrong.</p> \n<p>For example, does the venue come with tables/chairs, or will you have to rent those separately? Do you want your attendees to wear name tags, and if so, will you be printing out the name tags ahead of time or will attendees be writing their own names on blank tags?</p> \n<p>If the latter, have you factored in the pens or markers you'll need to accommodate that? As you can see, planning for an event can lead you down many rabbit holes.</p> \n<p>Use our <em>Event Budget Template</em> to stay organized.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-budget-templates\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-05-18%20at%2010.01.01%20AM.png?width=650&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-05-18%20at%2010.01.01%20AM.png\" alt=\"event budget templates\" width=\"650\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></a></p> \n<a></a> \n<h2>Sample Marketing Budget</h2> \n<p>With your chosen template downloaded, it's time to consider which digital channels to allot a budget for. Hint: There's no right answer — it'll depend on the market research you do to figure out where your specific audience spends most of its time.</p> \n<p>If you find your buyer prefers learning and consuming content in the form of video, for example, you might invest more of your money in <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/youtube-video-advertising-guide\">YouTube advertising</a>.</p> \n<h3>Advertising Budget Example</h3> \n<p>Here's a small sample budget for a quarter's worth of expenses by a hypothetical company that has decided to invest heavily in video marketing. This template was created using the Master Budget Template, the first template listed in the section above.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/sample-marketing-budget-1.jpg?width=650&amp;name=sample-marketing-budget-1.jpg\" alt=\"Sample marketing budget showing a video advertising investment that exceeds budget by $2,420.\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></p> \n<p>Based on the figures above, video advertising's total expenses for the quarter exceeded budget by $20, while full-time recruitment's total expenses exceeded budget by $2,400. This means the company is trending over budget for the first three months of the year.</p> \n<p>Why might this happen? Perhaps a pay-per-click (PPC) campaign on YouTube received more clicks by viewers than expected, and a sharp video-savvy job candidate negotiated a higher salary.</p> \n<p>Based on the difference between this company's planned spend and actual spend, their budget template produced the following graph:<br><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/sample-marketing-budget-graph.jpg?width=650&amp;name=sample-marketing-budget-graph.jpg\" alt=\"sample marketing budget graph\" width=\"650\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></p> \n<h2>Create a Marketing Budget That Prioritizes Your Goals</h2> \n<p>A well-thought out marketing budget serves as roadmap to your team's success. Revisit the buyer’s journey, flesh out your goals, and stay away from tempting add-ons that are not in line with your marketing priorities.</p> \n<p>Go now, and plan wisely — your marketing staff is counting on you.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's Note: This blog post was originally published in December 2015 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\"
