waFUyPyJtkSnUs93qMYZU9RHUnK0u3h9vVdFlXti1_rAVZTU1hFYK14P9iUR2AfSgXGXKH-4aDe_r5D4fDC3K8dUcWmmBLBhfAJWN0QPza1DlUS1qHvvZJZ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn15@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-52-659_1e34cff95580ebc1.webp","https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/4HFWXYjCae6K8X-R4Q0nbPMbe_OI5m5-gNna6UISmZVQRoKQnFvXU5_rruzPmpCoKHgdYhunW_WVrUKqpzfQTGgJqSjz1UyAWHBGWxvwHtcwsxIcrEQx9V2nCvZufSTZ96LK4mXR":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn84@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-54-792_eb5cd933d8a3264d.webp","https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/1uBsYglIwFmXp-L0b_zQsSq5-lTYVSnN1B0-ewKYiRz9uZrXttvE8h38jEOFl9Q0GDD7s3x60WUknh7BxJEPMGIRuTCk7sMrPshNnxzyEkP935SLHiWrJrhNUPDh5Bf6JKu4kmMf":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn27@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-54-593_d726cfc1e804faf8.webp","https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/Uaesq2m_BCCmf8leXIo30qCSQcQ7-8aadq4wtiyYUw73FG31jU1oD36OD52zDcLdRqbzpK_JovaJTKZYfvfbKdthSwnY8DEICqnUMSwayGKMFX0VsRddFnKexXHPYvahohwIa_HU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn97@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-50-564_afddfadeb42832d7.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/1fb2d19e-9ff9-40a7-947e-cc67e7d472cb.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-56-597_39667621be686c34.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fhow-to-do-a-b-testing&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn80@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-51-067_400901fbdf23fa11.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246408210},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"Social Media Marketing: The Ultimate Guide","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-marketing","description":"<p>When it comes to social media, marketers' top goals are advertising their products/services and increasing their brand awareness, according to 2021 HubSpot Blog Research.</p>  \n<p>However, many brands struggle with creating engaging content and reaching their target audience. With social media playing such an important role at the top of the funnel, let's dive into all things social media marketing – what it is, its benefits, and how to actually<a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/courses/social-media?utm_source=marketing_blog&amp;utm_medium=blog&amp;utm_campaign=social_media\"> </a><a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/courses/social-media?utm_source=marketing_blog&amp;utm_medium=blog&amp;utm_campaign=social_media&amp;_ga=2.141453042.1704623175.1639779580-311726001.1639779580\">build a social media marketing strategy</a> that'll work for your specific business.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=3e56e15d-47bd-46c9-a256-99fde52abfe7&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"→ Free Download: Social Media Calendar Template [Access Now]\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/3e56e15d-47bd-46c9-a256-99fde52abfe7.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p> \n<p>Social media marketing is all about meeting your target audience and customers where they are and as they socially interact with each other and your brand.</p> \n<p>While social media marketing as a whole is incredibly valuable and beneficial to your business growth (as you'll see in the following section), your strategy will differ based on which social networks your audience spends their time on.</p> \n<p>Before we dig deeper into social media marketing, let's<a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5EG1TNEsMvQ&amp;feature=youtu.be\"> </a><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5EG1TNEsMvQ&amp;feature=youtu.be\">segment the strategy by platform</a>.</p> \n<h2>Social Media Marketing Platforms</h2> \n<h3>Facebook</h3> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Users</strong>:<a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/346167/facebook-global-dau/#:~:text=During%20the%20first%20quarter%20of,percent%20of%20monthly%20active%20users.&amp;text=With%20over%202.6%20billion%20monthly,most%20popular%20social%20network%20worldwide.\"> </a><a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/346167/facebook-global-dau/#:~:text=During%20the%20first%20quarter%20of,percent%20of%20monthly%20active%20users.&amp;text=With%20over%202.6%20billion%20monthly,most%20popular%20social%20network%20worldwide.\">1.9 billion</a> daily active users worldwide</li> \n <li><strong>Audience</strong>: An even spread of Generation X and Millennials</li> \n <li><strong>Industry impact</strong>: B2C</li> \n <li><strong>Best for</strong>: Brand awareness; advertising</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Facebook is the largest social media platform and the most established. Since its launch in 2004, it has become an invaluable tool for B2C businesses, offering advanced advertising tools as well as organic opportunities.</p> \n<h3>TikTok</h3> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Users</strong>:<a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/970920/monetizable-daily-active-twitter-users-worldwide/\"> </a><a href=\"https://newsroom.tiktok.com/en-us/1-billion-people-on-tiktok\">1 billion</a> active monthly global users</li> \n <li><strong>Audience</strong>: Primarily Gen Z followed by Millennials</li> \n <li><strong>Industry impact</strong>: B2B and B2C</li> \n <li><strong>Best for</strong>: Short-form, creative video content; user-generated content; brand awareness</li> \n</ul> \n<p>When you think of short-form video, you probably think of TikTok. The platform rose in popularity in 2020 and shows no signs of slowing down. It's one of the best platforms for community building, with marketers ranking it in second place behind YouTube.</p> \n<h3>Instagram</h3> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Users</strong>:<a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/253577/number-of-monthly-active-instagram-users/\"> </a><a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/253577/number-of-monthly-active-instagram-users/\">1 billion</a> monthly active users</li> \n <li><strong>Audience</strong>: Primarily Millennials</li> \n <li><strong>Industry impact</strong>: B2C</li> \n <li><strong>Best for</strong>: High-quality images and videos; user-generated content; advertising</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Although Instagram launched only 12 years ago, the platform has taken the world by storm. When it comes to sharing visually compelling content, Instagram is where brands go. Another thing that sets the platform apart is its advanced ecommerce tools.</p> \n<p>Today, users can discover brands, browse their products and/or service, and complete a purchase without ever leaving the app – making Instagram a hard platform to beat.</p> \n<h3>Twitter</h3> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Users</strong>:<a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/970920/monetizable-daily-active-twitter-users-worldwide/\"> </a><a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/970920/monetizable-daily-active-twitter-users-worldwide/\">211 million</a> <em>daily</em> active users worldwide</li> \n <li><strong>Audience</strong>: Primarily Millennials</li> \n <li><strong>Industry impact</strong>: B2B and B2C</li> \n <li><strong>Best for</strong>: Public relations; customer service; community building</li> \n</ul> \n<p>While Instagram focuses on visuals, Twitter focuses on words. Since the early days of 140-character Tweets, the platform has now expanded to include an audio tool called <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/what-is-twitter-spaces\">Twitter Spaces</a>, a community-building tool called <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/twitter-communities\">Twitter Communities</a>, and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/25084/the-ultimate-cheat-sheet-for-expert-twitter-marketing.aspx\">Twitter Moments</a> to share interesting content with your followers.</p> \n<h3>LinkedIn</h3> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>User</strong><strong>s</strong>:<a href=\"https://hootsuite.com/resources/digital-2020\"> </a><a href=\"https://www.statista.com/forecasts/1147197/linkedin-users-in-the-world\">774 million</a> active users worldwide</li> \n <li><strong>Audience</strong>: Baby boomers, Generation X, and Millennials</li> \n <li><strong>Industry impact</strong>: B2B</li> \n <li><strong>Best for</strong>: B2B relationships, business development, and social selling</li> \n</ul> \n<p>LinkedIn is Facebook's professional cousin. It's perhaps the only platform where its audience is clearly defined: Working professionals looking to network and seek out new opportunities.</p> \n<p>That makes it the ideal platform for B2B companies looking to identify key decision-makers and build an industry-specific community.</p> \n<h3>YouTube</h3> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Users</strong>: Over<a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/about/press/#:~:text=Global%20Reach,watchtime%20comes%20from%20mobile%20devices.\"> </a><a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/1252638/youtube-app-dau-worldwide/\">315 million daily active</a> users worldwide</li> \n <li><strong>Audience</strong>: Primarily Millennials but has a strong audience across gender and age demographics</li> \n <li><strong>Industry impact</strong>: B2C and B2B</li> \n <li><strong>Best for</strong>: Brand awareness; long-form entertainment, and how-to videos</li> \n</ul> \n<p>According to <a href=\"https://www.hootsuite.com/resources/digital-trends\">HootSuite</a>, YouTube is the second most visited website in the world. In addition, marketers name it the best platform to build community.</p> \n<p>In addition to being an incredibly popular platform, its users also tend to stay longer on it because it features mostly long-form content – making it an ideal platform to share educational content.</p> \n<h3>Snapchat</h3> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Users</strong>:<a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/545967/snapchat-app-dau/#:~:text=With%20an%20estimated%2046%20million,such%20as%20Twitter%20or%20Facebook.\"> </a><a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/545967/snapchat-app-dau/#:~:text=With%20an%20estimated%2046%20million,such%20as%20Twitter%20or%20Facebook.\">306 million</a> daily active users worldwide</li> \n <li><strong>Audience</strong>: Primarily Generation Z</li> \n <li><strong>Industry impact</strong>: B2C</li> \n <li><strong>Best for</strong>: Brand awareness; advertising</li> \n</ul> \n<p>When Snapchat came out in 2011, leading the charge in ephemeral content. It introduced content that you could share with your friends and that would expire after 24 hours.</p> \n<p>The platform peaked in 2015 and has held strong since then. Many thought the brand would disappear once Instagram introduced Stories, the same feature with a different name. However, Snapchat continues to be popular among young adults.</p> \n<h3>Pinterest</h3> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Users</strong>:<a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/463353/pinterest-global-mau/\"> </a><a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/463353/pinterest-global-mau/\">444 million</a> monthly active users worldwide</li> \n <li><strong>Audience</strong>: Primarily Millennials with a solid audience in Gen Z, Gen X and Baby Boomers</li> \n <li><strong>Industry impact</strong>: B2C</li> \n <li><strong>Best for</strong>: Visual advertising; inspiration</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Think of <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/31147/the-ultimate-guide-to-mastering-pinterest-for-marketing.aspx\">Pinterest</a> like a visual storyboard that allows users to get inspiration for everything from fashion to home decor.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://business.pinterest.com/audience/\">85% of Pinners</a> say Pinterest is where they go to start a new project. In addition, 80% of weekly Pinners say they've discovered a new brand or product on the platform. So, not only is it a great discovery tool but it's also a way for brands to build their narrative through visual stories.</p> \n<h3>Clubhouse</h3> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Users</strong>:<a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/463353/pinterest-global-mau/\"> </a>10 million weekly active users worldwide</li> \n <li><strong>Audience</strong>: Primarily Millennials</li> \n <li><strong>Industry impact</strong>: B2B and B2C</li> \n <li><strong>Best for</strong>: Visual advertising; inspiration</li> \n</ul> \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/what-is-clubhouse\">Clubhouse</a> made a strong impression as soon as it entered the social media world in 2020. The audio-only platform allows people to start interesting conversations with followers as well as strangers and build community.</p> \n<p>The platform also gained some buzz for its invitation-only set up when it was in beta testing. Today, the platform is open to everyone globally and on both IOS and Android devices. Another big selling point to this platform is that it works well for both B2B and B2C businesses and leverages audio, which has made a huge comeback in recent years.</p> \n<p>Now that we've detailed the fundamentals of each social media network, let's discuss why social media marketing is beneficial for your business.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h2>Benefits of Social Media Marketing</h2> \n<p>To illustrate the benefits of social media marketing, let's take a look at the experience from the user's perspective. Well, my perspective.</p> \n<p>As I scroll through my Instagram feed every day (cough, cough...multiple times a day), I consistently notice new posts and stories by <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/thefryecompany/?hl=en\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\">The Frye Company</a>. I’ve always been a fan of their boots, clothing, and accessories, but I also love the content they share on their Instagram profile.</p> \n<p>All of their photos have the same filter on them to ensure they match — this makes their profile look professional, artistic, and organized when visitors, like myself, browse their page.</p> \n<p>Frye’s account also encourages interaction between the company and its followers by providing them with a specific <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/explore/tags/inmyfrye/?hl=en\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\">hashtag</a> to use so they can be featured on the page when they post photos with Frye products.</p> \n<p>Frye’s Instagram account is a great example of successful social media marketing — it’s attractive, distinctly Frye, engages their ~200K followers, and promotes their products.</p> \n<p>But why is social media marketing so important? And how do you actually <a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/courses/social-media?utm_source=marketing_blog&amp;utm_medium=blog&amp;utm_campaign=social_media\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\">build a social media marketing strategy</a> that’ll work for your specific type of business?</p> \n<p>There are a variety of reasons why your company should use social media marketing. We've created a list of the most beneficial reasons to consider.</p> \n<p>Let's dive in.</p> \n<h3>1. Increase your brand awareness.</h3> \n<p>Due to the sheer amount of people on social media, you're missing out on the potential to reach thousands, and even millions, if you don't have a presence.</p> \n<p>In fact, social media has been proven to boost brand awareness by driving up engagement. Social engagement includes things like comments, likes, shares, and reposts, and saves.</p> \n<p>It also helps you increase brand awareness by directing traffic straight to your site. You can do this by including direct links to your website in your profile, bio, and posts.</p> \n<p><strong>Featured Resource</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/how-to-build-a-brand?hubs_post-cta=inline-text\">How to Build a Brand for Your Company</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>2. Generate leads and boost conversions.</h3> \n<p>Promoting and sharing your products on social media is a simple way to improve lead generation, boost conversions, and increase sales because you're advertising to people who have opted to engage with you by following your account.</p> \n<p>Here are some examples of ways you can use social media to generate more leads.</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Create contests</strong> for your visitors and followers to participate in on your social media profiles.</li> \n <li><strong>Include links to your website and offers</strong> in the bio sections of your profiles.</li> \n <li><strong>Host live videos </strong>to make announcements about products and provide updates or details about exciting news at your company.</li> \n <li><strong>Implement a social media marketing campaign</strong> on one of your channels.</li> \n <li><strong>Sell your products through your social profiles</strong>. For example, you can enable<a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/help/912190892201033\"> </a><a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/help/912190892201033\">Facebook's Shop Section</a> or<a href=\"https://business.instagram.com/a/shopping-on-instagram\"> </a><a href=\"https://business.instagram.com/a/shopping-on-instagram\">Instagram's Shopping feature</a> on your profiles. These features allow your visitors and followers to click on products you've shared in posts to view information such as price, material, and size. Then, visitors can easily proceed to checkout through the platform and buy the product directly from you.</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>3. Foster relationships with your customers.</h3> \n<p>By connecting and engaging with your social media followers, you'll be able to build lasting relationships between them and your business. You can do this by interacting with them on your posts, responding to their questions and comments, and providing them with any help they may need.</p> \n<p>You can also ask your followers questions about your products, their pain points, or create giveaways to help you build trust and show them how much you value their input and support.</p> \n<h3>4. Learn from your competitors.</h3> \n<p>Social media is a great way to keep tabs on your competitors — whether that's in reference to their social media tactics, the products they're promoting, the campaigns they're implementing, or their level of interaction with followers.</p> \n<p>Social media allows you to get a look at what is and isn't working for your competition, and therefore helps you decide what should or shouldn't change in terms of <em>your</em> company's approach.</p> \n<p>Lastly, reviewing the social accounts of your competitors can help you make sure your marketing stands out and is unique to your brand.</p> \n<p><em><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/competitive-analysis-kit?hubs_post-cta=pillar_allphrase\">Learn how to conduct a competitive analysis to discover how you can beat the competition.</a></em></p> \n<p>Now, let's talk strategy — there are severa steps to ensure your social media marketing plan is sustainable and positively impacts your business.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>Although social media is constantly evolving, most of the foundational steps you need to succeed stay the same. Essentially, you're following the same steps you would take to create a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/marketing-strategy\">marketing strategy</a> and narrow it to a specific channel.</p> \n<p>Let's cover these steps in more detail so you can begin applying them to your business.</p> \n<h3>Step 1: Research your buyer personas and audience.</h3> \n<p>The first step to creating a social media marketing strategy is to determine who your buyer personas and audience are so you can target their needs and interests appropriately.</p> \n<p>To do this, think about the people you're trying to reach and why, and how you would classify them as a group. For example, if your company sells trendy leggings and joggers, you might classify your target audience as millennials who like to wear stylish athletic apparel regularly — a style known as<a href=\"https://www.investopedia.com/terms/a/athleisure.asp\"> </a><a href=\"https://www.investopedia.com/terms/a/athleisure.asp\">athleisure</a>.</p> \n<p>By considering your buyer personas and audience, you'll then be able to determine what content will attract the type of followers and customers you hope to gain. Plus, learn how to create engaging content to keep your followers interested.</p> \n<h4>Recommended Tools</h4> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/persona-templates?hubs_post-cta=inline-text\">Buyer Persona Templates</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/make-my-persona?hubs_post-cta=inline-text\">Make My Persona Tool</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>Step 2: Determine which social platforms you'll market on.</h3> \n<p>As a social media marketer, it's crucial you determine which platforms you're going to share your content on.</p> \n<p>There's not necessarily a right or wrong answer when it comes to which social channels your business should use — it's more about the needs of your target audience and where they tend to spend their time.</p> \n<p>\"It's important to be where your audience of potential customers is today, and where they might be tomorrow,\" said Andrew Delaney, former social media marketing manager at HubSpot. \"It's better to be ahead of the curve than behind.\"</p> \n<p>For example, if you are going for that target audience of athleisure-loving millennials, you may want to focus the majority of your social media efforts on<a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/instagram\"> </a><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/instagram\">Instagram</a> — this is because<a href=\"https://blog.hootsuite.com/instagram-demographics/\"> </a><a href=\"https://blog.hootsuite.com/instagram-demographics/\">millennials</a> cover the largest portion of users on the platform.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/smorgan817/\">Stephanie Morgan</a>, founder and CEO of social media agency <a href=\"http://www.thesociallock.com\">Social Lock</a>, echoes this sentiment.</p> \n<p>\"Think about their behaviors and where they hang out online. If that's Pinterest, use that platform for your brand. If that's TikTok, use that platform for your brand,\" Morgan adds. \"Don't waste time on a platform that your ideal client avatar is not very active on.\"</p> \n<h4>Recommended Tools and Resources</h4> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/snapchat-for-business?hubs_post-cta=inline-text\">A Marketer's Guide to Snapchat for Business</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/facebook-ad-examples?hubs_post-cta=inline-text&amp;_ga=2.166263099.465005662.1556543642-1307414301.1541080541\">50 Facebook Ad Examples We Actually Clicked</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/youtube-for-business?hubs_post-cta=inline-text\">YouTube for Business: A 30-Day Roadmap for Growth</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/how-to-use-twitter-for-business?hubs_post-cta=inline-text\">How to Use Twitter for Business (+ Follower Tracking Template)</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/how-to-use-pinterest-for-business?hubs_post-cta=author\">12 Pinterest Templates for Business</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>Step 3: Establish your most important metrics and KPIs.</h3> \n<p>No matter your goals or industry, your social media strategy should be data-driven.</p> \n<p>That means focusing on the <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-metrics-ceos-cares-about\">social media metrics that matter</a>. Rather than focus on vanity metrics, dig into data that aligns directly with your goals.</p> \n<p>What metrics are we talking about? Check out the breakdown below:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Reach</strong>. Post reach is the number of unique users who saw your post. How much of your content actually reaches users’ feeds?</li> \n <li><strong>Clicks</strong>. This is the number of clicks on your content or account. Tracking clicks per campaign is essential to understand what drives curiosity or encourages people to buy.</li> \n <li><strong>Engagement</strong>. The total number of social interactions divided by the number of impressions. This sheds light on how well your audience perceives you and their willingness to interact.</li> \n <li><strong>Hashtag performance</strong>. What were your most-used hashtags? Which hashtags were most associated with your brand? Having these answers can help shape the focus of your content going forward.</li> \n <li><strong>Organic and paid likes</strong>. Beyond a standard “Like” count, these interactions are attributed to paid or organic content. Given how much harder organic engagement is to gain, many brands turn to ads. Knowing these differences can help you budget both your ad spend and the time you invest in different formats.</li> \n <li><strong>Sentiment</strong>. This is the measurement of how users react to your content, brand, or hashtag. Did customers find your recent campaign offensive? What type of sentiment do people associate with your campaign hashtag? It’s always better to dig deeper and find out how people talk or feel about your brand.</li> \n</ul> \n<h4>Recommended Resources</h4> \n<ul> \n <li><a>Which Social Media Metrics Are Marketers Tracking?</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-analytics\">The Ultimate Guide to Social Media Analytics</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>Step 4: Get to know your competition.</h3> \n<p>A competitive analysis allows you to understand who the competition is and what they’re doing well (and not so well). You’ll get a good sense of what’s expected in your industry, which will help you set social media targets of your own.</p> \n<p>It will also help you spot opportunities.</p> \n<p>Maybe one of your competitors is dominant on Facebook, for example, but has put little effort into Twitter or Instagram. You might want to focus on the networks where your audience is underserved, rather than trying to win fans away from a dominant player.</p> \n<h4>Recommended Tools and Resources</h4> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/competitive-analysis-kit\">What's a Competitive Analysis &amp; How Do You Conduct One?</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/competitive-intelligence-competitive-advantage\">A Marketer's Guide To Competitive Intelligence</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/customers/monitor-competitors-in-social-within-hubspot\">How to Monitor Your Competitors' Every Move in Social Within HubSpot</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>Step 5: Create unique and engaging content.</h3> \n<p>With the billions of social media users around the globe, there's no question that at least <em>some</em> of your followers — or the people browsing your profile — have also seen your competitor's content or that of other businesses in your industry.</p> \n<p>That's why you must have engaging social media content that stands out and provides viewers with a reason to click that \"Follow\" button and interact with your brand.</p> \n<p>Not sure what's considered engaging? Morgan has a recommendation.</p> \n<p>\"My number one tip to brands for creating engaging content on social media is to do market research first because what will be engaging depends on the audience,\" Morgan said. \"When you know what your audience likes and needs to know, you can create content that engages those interests.\"</p> \n<p>To help you get creative, consider the content your competitors are sharing and how you can uniquely promote your products. Also, take advantage of the features offered by the platform you're using.</p> \n<p>For example, you can create live videos on Facebook to share the latest details about a product launch or conduct a giveaway.</p> \n<p>You can also use your current customers and promoters to help you generate content. You can do this by re-posting their content or encouraging them to use a hashtag to share their own experiences and pictures with your products.</p> \n<p>Lastly, leverage trends. Social media trends are always coming up, especially on short-form video platforms like TikTok. Don't be afraid to join in but you still have to be intentional about how you do it.</p> \n<p>\"If the trend started happening three weeks ago, you've probably missed the boat,\" Morgan said. \"Catching the trends early is the best way to capitalize on it without coming across as inauthentic or like you're trying too hard, or worse [as] 'chuegy' – see Gen Z for that one.\"</p> \n<h4>Recommended Tools and Resources</h4> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/social-media-trends-report-2022\">The Social Media Trends Report </a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>Step 6: Organize a schedule for your posts.</h3> \n<p>One of the easiest ways to ensure your content is shared as planned is to use a social media management solution. These tools allow you to write captions, prepare pictures and videos, and schedule posts in advance. They also automatically share your content on schedule and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/29437/20-free-social-media-and-brand-monitoring-tools-that-rock.aspx?_ga=2.150639797.2053315133.1572189466-237440449.1568656505\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\">monitor</a> all post interactions and engagement for you. Social media management solutions save you time and allow you to focus on your other tasks.</p> \n<p>There are a number of solution options available — here are a few examples.</p> \n<h5><strong>HubSpot</strong></h5> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/social-inbox?hubs_post=blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-marketing&amp;hubs_post-cta=HubSpot\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\">HubSpot</a> offers a social media tool — as part of the <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing?hubs_post=blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-marketing&amp;hubs_post-cta=marketing%20software\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\">marketing software</a> — to help you publish and monitor your content and create real connections with your followers. You can schedule and publish your content in advance and compare in-depth reports on your posts’ engagement to understand the performance of various platforms, types of content, and posting times.</p> \n<h5><strong>Sprout Social</strong></h5> \n<p><a href=\"https://ecosystem.hubspot.com/marketplace/apps/marketing/social-media/sprout-social\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\">Sprout Social</a> is a social media marketing and management solution designed to help your team organize and plan content creation, manage campaigns, understand engagement, and review content reports and analysis.</p> \n<h5><strong>Hootsuite</strong></h5> \n<p><a href=\"https://hootsuite.com/\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\">Hootsuite</a> is a social media management platform for finding, scheduling, managing, and reporting on your content. You can schedule posts in advance on <em>all</em> of your channels at once and measure your ROI with comprehensive content analysis.</p> \n<h4><strong>How often should you post on social media?</strong></h4> \n<p>Now, you might be wondering how often you should post content on your social media channels.</p> \n<p>As a rule of thumb, you should only post on social when you have <em>quality</em> content to share. Meaning, there's a reason you're posting the content. This is how you'll strike the right balance when it comes to your posting frequency.</p> \n<p>Morgan says the top mistake she sees brands make in regards to social media marketing is focusing on quantity of content instead of the quality of content.</p> \n<p>\"They think they need to post every day, so they force themselves to create posts to fill up the calendar,\" she said. \"Odds are, every single one of those posts isn't going to be very valuable to the ideal customer, I've coined this 'clutter content.'\"</p> \n<p>Instead, she recommends downsizing in quantity and upping the quality.</p> \n<p>\"It's better to post two or three times a week with super valuable content, versus posting seven times a week with only one or two valuable posts,\" said Morgan.</p> \n<p>There are plenty of studies and resources available explaining social media post frequency standards by industry and platform for you to follow. Every business is different, so find what works for your audience.</p> \n<p>Then, you can begin experimenting with more or fewer posts – as well as other factors such as the time of day you're posting on social – to determine what provides the highest level of engagement.</p> \n<h4>Recommended Tools and Resources</h4> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/social-media-content-calendar?hubs_signup-url=www.hubspot.com%2Fresources&amp;hubs_signup-cta=directories__link&amp;q=social%2520media&amp;_ga=2.13241907.540916378.1639696309-1866752076.1638585232\">Social Media Content Calendar Template</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/startups/social-media-content-template-for-startups?hubs_signup-url=www.hubspot.com%2Fresources&amp;hubs_signup-cta=directories__link&amp;q=social%2520media&amp;_ga=2.9692465.540916378.1639696309-1866752076.1638585232\">Social Media Content Calendar Template for Startups</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h2>How to Analyze Your Social Media Marketing Impact and Results</h2> \n<p>One of the most important aspects of social media marketing is ensuring your efforts are successful in helping you meet your goals. To determine this, you'll need to keep track of all of your posts, on every channel. You can do this by reviewing and managing your social media metrics.</p> \n<h3>Social Media Metrics</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-metrics-ceos-cares-about\">Social media metrics</a> are data related to the success of your posts and your impact on your audience and customers on various platforms. These metrics may include data about your level of engagement, likes, follows, shares, and all other interactions on each platform.</p> \n<p>Here are 10 of the most important metrics for you to track:</p> \n<ol start=\"1\"> \n <li><strong>Engagement:</strong> This includes clicks, comments, likes, and replies on your social media posts. There are also platform-specific types of engagement such as \"<a href=\"https://help.instagram.com/1744643532522513\">Saved</a>\" posts on Instagram and \"<a href=\"https://help.pinterest.com/en/article/create-a-pin-from-your-photos\">Pinned</a>\" posts on Pinterest.</li> \n <li><strong>Reach: </strong>The number of people who have seen any content associated with your page or profile is your reach.</li> \n <li><strong>Followers: </strong>This is the number of people you have on your profile who have clicked your \"Follow\" button and see your content in their feeds regularly.</li> \n <li><strong>Impressions: </strong>This is the number of times a post from your profile or page is seen, whether or not your audience members click on it. This is often what happens when someone is scrolling through their newsfeed, but not clicking on anything.</li> \n <li><strong>Video views: </strong>On Facebook, Snapchat, Instagram, or any other social channel with video capabilities, this is the number of views each gets.</li> \n <li><strong>Profile visits: </strong>The number of people who have opened your social media page is your number of profile visits.</li> \n <li><strong>Mentions: </strong>This is the number of times your profile has been mentioned by audience members in their posts.</li> \n <li><strong>Tags: </strong>This is when your audience adds the name of your company's profile or your hashtag to another post.</li> \n <li><strong>Reposts: </strong>This is when a member of your audience posts a piece of your content on their profile.</li> \n <li><strong>Shares: </strong>These are the posts your followers and audience take from your profile and share with their network.</li> \n</ol> \n<p>You can influence all of these metrics, increase your social following, and improve overall engagement on your profile by using the same tactics you would to generate leads and boost conversions.</p> \n<p>Morgan adds that the metrics you focus on will depend on which season you're in. Here's her formula:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>If you're new, focus on building an audience and awareness. Key metrics: reach, impressions, audience growth.</li> \n <li>If you're growing, focus on building trust. Key metrics: Likes, saves, comments, DMs.</li> \n <li>If you're established, focus on retaining and nurturing. Key metrics: Likes, saves, comments, DMs.</li> \n <li>If you're launching something, focus on selling. Key metrics: DMs and clickthrough rate</li> \n</ul> \n<h4>How to Measure Social Media Metrics</h4> \n<p>You can review social media metrics in a variety of ways, For example, you can use the analytics tools built into the various platforms you use. Here are a few examples:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://business.twitter.com/en/analytics.html\">Twitter Analytics</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://analytics.facebook.com/\">Facebook Analytics</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://help.instagram.com/1533933820244654\">Instagram Insights</a></li> \n</ul> \n<p>You might also choose to use an analytics and tracking tool such as<a href=\"https://analytics.google.com/analytics/web/provision/?authuser=0#/provision\"> </a><a href=\"https://analytics.google.com/analytics/web/provision/?authuser=0#/provision\">Google Analytics</a>. This is a great option if you want to track your social media <em>and</em> website metrics. Lastly, many social media scheduling solutions — as we reviewed earlier — have monitoring and tracking features automatically built-in.</p> \n<p>All of these <a href=\"https://napoleoncat.com/features/analytics/\">metrics tracking tools</a> will give you a better understanding of what your followers and audience respond well to and what you should consider modifying to improve engagement.</p> \n<p>Now that we've reviewed the benefits of social media marketing and how to build your strategy, let's talk about the various resources available to help you along the way.</p> \n<h2>Social Media Marketing Resources</h2> \n<p>There are a plethora of social media marketing resources you can use to build a social strategy for your company. You're bound to feel more confident about working on your company's social media marketing initiative with the help of the following courses, training, and books.</p> \n<h3>Social Media Marketing Courses and Training</h3> \n<p>Here are three ways to earn an education in the field of social media marketing if you feel it's necessary for your specific business situation.</p> \n<h4><strong>1. Earn a certificate administered by a company.</strong></h4> \n<p>A certificate is a quick and simple way to gain a deep understanding of social media marketing courses.</p> \n<p>HubSpot offers a free<a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/courses/social-media?hubs_post-cta=user-blog-bottom-course-social-media-cert&amp;hsCtaTracking=e57a9bd8-9739-400f-b752-8ebbe9349272%7C2f1aaee4-ef3d-4e25-a55b-4b2fb351e97b\"> </a><a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/courses/social-media?hubs_post-cta=user-blog-bottom-course-social-media-cert&amp;hsCtaTracking=e57a9bd8-9739-400f-b752-8ebbe9349272%7C2f1aaee4-ef3d-4e25-a55b-4b2fb351e97b\">social media certification</a> course, which teaches you how to engage with your customers and improve conversions. You'll also get a better understanding of how to develop your strategy, extend your reach, and measure your social media ROI.</p> \n<p>LinkedIn Learning is another platform where you can earn a certification and share it on your profile.</p> \n<h4><strong>2. Leverage YouTube university. </strong></h4> \n<p>YouTube is a goldmine when it comes to educational content.</p> \n<p>With a quick search, you'll find hundreds of long-form videos that offer in-depth courses on social media marketing. Granted, you can't connect with a live educator. However, it's free and can be a great starting point before you dive into a paid course.</p> \n<h3>Social Media Marketing Books</h3> \n<p>Reading relevant content about social media marketing is another great way to learn more about the field. Here are a few examples of some highly-regarded books on the topic.</p> \n<p><strong>1. <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Likeable-Social-Media-Third-Irresistible/dp/1260453286/ref=pd_sbs_1/139-4945452-0043310?pd_rd_w=XyY8L&amp;pf_rd_p=3676f086-9496-4fd7-8490-77cf7f43f846&amp;pf_rd_r=N414T45KKQA00N1P0P02&amp;pd_rd_r=31578bde-bdbc-4dff-bb1b-91ec76e6a326&amp;pd_rd_wg=uMS9i&amp;pd_rd_i=1260453286&amp;psc=1\"><em>Likable Social Media, Third Edition: How to Delight Your Customers, Create an Irresistible Brand, and Be Generally Amazing on All Social Networks That Matter</em></a> by Dave Kerpen</strong></p> \n<p>This New York Times Bestseller covers the reasons why being likable and engaging with followers on social media is one of the most powerful ways to grow your base of customers and promoters.</p> \n<p>The book teaches you how to make impactful content for your followers to interact with and share with <em>their</em> networks. Author Dave Kerpen also describes why you need to ensure you're consistently delighting your followers to avoid losing them at any point in time.</p> \n<p><strong>2.</strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Jab-Right-Hook-Story-Social/dp/006227306X\"> </a><em><strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Jab-Right-Hook-Story-Social/dp/006227306X\">Jab, Jab, Jab, Right Hook: How to Tell Your Story in a Noisy Social World</a></strong></em><strong> by Gary Vaynerchuk</strong></p> \n<p>According to author Gary Vaynerchuk, the key to social media marketing success isn't about pushing out a lot of content — it's about pushing out specific content tailored towards your target audience and using the right platform to do so.</p> \n<p>In his book, Vaynerchuk covers how to do this as well as connect with your followers and customers on a deeper level through social media. You'll learn how to create memorable and unique content that stands out in comparison to the competition's content.</p> \n<p><strong>3.</strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/B2B-Social-Media-Book-Generating/dp/1118167767/ref=asc_df_1118167767/?tag=hyprod-20&amp;linkCode=df0&amp;hvadid=312045876164&amp;hvpos=1o1&amp;hvnetw=g&amp;hvrand=469068391632046674&amp;hvpone=&amp;hvptwo=&amp;hvqmt=&amp;hvdev=c&amp;hvdvcmdl=&amp;hvlocint=&amp;hvlocphy=1018127&amp;hvtargid=pla-593904282434&amp;psc=1\"> </a><em><strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/B2B-Social-Media-Book-Generating/dp/1118167767/ref=asc_df_1118167767/?tag=hyprod-20&amp;linkCode=df0&amp;hvadid=312045876164&amp;hvpos=1o1&amp;hvnetw=g&amp;hvrand=469068391632046674&amp;hvpone=&amp;hvptwo=&amp;hvqmt=&amp;hvdev=c&amp;hvdvcmdl=&amp;hvlocint=&amp;hvlocphy=1018127&amp;hvtargid=pla-593904282434&amp;psc=1\">The B2B Social Media Book: Become a Marketing Superstar by Generating Leads with Blogging, LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, Email, and More</a></strong></em><strong> by Kipp Bodnar</strong></p> \n<p>HubSpot's CMO, Kipp Bodnar, writes about the ways B2B businesses can generate more leads and conversions through social media marketing.</p> \n<p>There are actionable methods you can take to increase your base of followers and drive leads as well as understand the ROI of various B2B social media marketing strategies.</p> \n<h2>Emerging Social Media Platforms</h2> \n<p>Recent HubSpot Blog Research found that marketers are constantly on the lookout for new or emerging platforms, as often as even week.</p> \n<p>Though it takes a while for platforms to take off, once they do, you want to have a plan in place for how you're going to tackle it.</p> \n<p>For instance, brands like Chipotle were one of the first to try short-form video content on TikTok. As a result, they have a strong presence on the platform while many others are still struggling to find their place.</p> \n<p>Emerging platforms can offer a new avenue to reach your target audience in a way that may be more effective than what you're doing now. <a href=\"https://www.clubhouse.com/\">Clubhouse</a> and <a href=\"https://discord.com/\">Discord</a> are among some of the most popular emerging platforms.</p> \n<p>However, others like <a href=\"https://flyy.life/\">Flyy</a> and <a href=\"https://spacehey.com/\">SpaceHey</a> are looking to make their mark.</p> \n<p>Want to learn more about what's out there? Check out this article on <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/new-social-media\">new social media platforms</a> you should keep your eye on this year.</p> \n<h2>Start Marketing on Social Media</h2> \n<p>Considering there are billions of people on social media today, it's easy to see why so many businesses and marketers use the channel to promote their products and engage with customers.</p> \n<p>Although determining <em>your</em> company's social media course of action may seem daunting, you can avoid feeling overwhelmed by understanding social media marketing trends and using some of the many resources available about the topic. So, start working on your business' social media marketing strategy today to increase your number of followers, improve engagement, and boost conversions.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in March 2019 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=659a3090-804c-4d76-8969-b510ad71a935&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"New Call to action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/659a3090-804c-4d76-8969-b510ad71a935.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fsocial-media-marketing&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 11 Mar 2022 12:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/3e56e15d-47bd-46c9-a256-99fde52abfe7.png","linkMd5":"49e0788d0af1ee5b9ad57b15d093f41e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn44@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-48-839_f265e6907ec7aa82.webp","destWidth":454,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":5078,"destBytes":7114,"author":"krbaker@hubspot.com (Kristen Baker)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/3e56e15d-47bd-46c9-a256-99fde52abfe7.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn44@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-48-839_f265e6907ec7aa82.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/659a3090-804c-4d76-8969-b510ad71a935.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn89@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-56-459_ae0be0e5a7d89bf8.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fsocial-media-marketing&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn22@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-50-933_3b9b05668901d2a1.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246408179},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"YouTube vs. Vimeo: Which Video Platform is Best for Your Business? [New Data]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/youtube-vs-vimeo","description":"<p>While YouTube is obviously the <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/yt/about/press/\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><span>largest video hosting platform</span></a> on the web, it might not be the best choice for every business.</p>  \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=b33cfd44-133a-49e3-a943-086c5679d485&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"→ Free Templates: How to Use YouTube for Business [Download Now]\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b33cfd44-133a-49e3-a943-086c5679d485.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p>There are other factors to consider when choosing a home for your video marketing — such as cost, tech support, and video and audio quality — to name a few.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>To help you find the best fit for your company's unique needs, we compared YouTube directly against the smaller, more niche platform Vimeo across a number of factors. Read on to see the results, and decide for yourself.</p> \n<p class=\"p1\"></p> \n<h3>Number of Users</h3> \n<p><strong>Winner: YouTube</strong></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">There's no real competition here. YouTube commands an audience of </span><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/yt/about/press/\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><span>over two billion monthly users</span></a><span style=\"color: #33475b;\"> — almost half of the entire internet-using population. Vimeo's </span><a href=\"https://expandedramblings.com/index.php/vimeo-statistics/\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><span>230 million monthly viewers and 1.9 million </span></a><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">paid subscribers seem insignificant in contrast. For maximum reach, choose YouTube.</span></p> \n<h3>Search Optimization</h3> \n<p><strong>Winner: YouTube</strong></p> \n<p>YouTube leaves Vimeo in the dust here. YouTube is <a href=\"https://www.alexa.com/topsites\">the second largest search engine on the internet</a>, right after parent company Google. If you're planning to create a video tailored to a specific search query, (e.g., <em>how to pick a font for your website</em>), your video belongs on YouTube. Not only will it appear in search results directly on YouTube, but Google also <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/google-steers-users-to-youtube-over-rivals-11594745232\">seems to favor</a> videos from YouTube over those posted on other platforms.</p> \n<h3>Mobile</h3> \n<p><strong>Winner: YouTube</strong></p> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/intl/en-GB/about/press/\">70% of all YouTube views come from mobile</a>, and the YouTube mobile app is absolutely <a href=\"https://www.digitalinformationworld.com/2020/02/youtube-dominates-all-the-major-apps-takes-away-most-streaming-time-on-smartphones.html\">dominating the mobile streaming space</a> — outranking even formidable competitors like Netflix, Hulu, and Twitch.</p> \n<p>Videos uploaded to Vimeo and YouTube are both optimized automatically for mobile, but YouTube offers more opportunities for mobile discovery and reach.</p> \n<h3>Cost</h3> \n<p><strong>Winner: YouTube</strong></p> \n<p>YouTube is free — even for businesses. But you might be wondering if Vimeo is as well.</p> \n<h4>Is Vimeo free to use?</h4> \n<p><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">Vimeo operates on a tiered pricing model, </span><a href=\"https://vimeo.com/upgrade\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><span>ranging from a free basic plan to a $75/month package </span></a><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">that includes unlimited live streaming.</span></p> \n<h4>Vimeo Pro vs YouTube</h4> \n<p>While Vimeo does have a free basic plan, it limits you to 500MB maximum storage per week.</p> \n<p>If you're okay with paying some money, you can get a Vimeo Pro plan. With Vimeo Pro, you'll have access to support, advanced analytics, and professional privacy.</p> \n<p>On the other hand, you can have unlimited storage for free on YouTube.</p> \n<h3>Support</h3> \n<p><strong>Winner: Vimeo</strong></p> \n<p>With their paid packages, Vimeo <a href=\"https://vimeo.com/upgrade\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><span>offers several levels of technical support</span></a> that could be a game-changer for businesses with little video expertise. YouTube offers plenty of <a href=\"https://support.google.com/youtube?__hstc=20629287.6ac66382cd6445e9a532bf78e26b2936.1629761983054.1644432577944.1644443037198.247&amp;__hssc=20629287.5.1644443037198&amp;__hsfp=2104872287#topic=7505892\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><span>free help documentation</span></a> and access to a (rather crowded) <a href=\"https://productforums.google.com/forum/?__hstc=20629287.6ac66382cd6445e9a532bf78e26b2936.1629761983054.1644432577944.1644443037198.247&amp;__hssc=20629287.5.1644443037198&amp;__hsfp=2104872287#!forum/youtube\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><span>support community</span></a>. Still, if you're seeking higher-touch, personalized support on-demand, a paid Vimeo account is the better option.</p> \n<h3>Storage</h3> \n<p><strong>Winner: YouTube</strong></p> \n<p>YouTube offers unlimited, free storage for all accounts, while Vimeo <a href=\"https://vimeo.com/upgrade\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><span>charges for storage on a tiered basis</span></a>. The basic, free Vimeo account option gives you 500MB of storage per week. With their highest level, $75/month package, you can store 7TB total with no weekly limits.</p> \n<h3>No Pre-Roll Ads</h3> \n<p><strong>Winner: Vimeo</strong></p> \n<p>If you upload your videos to YouTube, there's a good chance a pre-roll ad will play before it, which has the potential to deter some viewers from sticking around. Vimeo currently doesn't allow ads, and it doesn't look like they'll be changing this policy anytime soon.</p> \n<h3>Running Ad Campaigns</h3> \n<p><strong>Winner: YouTube</strong></p> \n<p>If you're thinking of running your own ads on a video platform, you can't beat YouTube (You also <a href=\"https://help.vimeo.com/hc/en-us/articles/224968628-Vimeo-PRO\">can't</a><a href=\"https://help.vimeo.com/hc/en-us/articles/224968628-Vimeo-PRO\"> purchase ad space on Vimeo</a>, even if you wanted to, because they don't allow it.)</p> \n<p>YouTube <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/yt/advertise/\">offers an advanced, user-friendly ads platform</a>, as well as personalized support from a \"YouTube Advertising Expert\" when you spend $10 a day on ads.</p> \n<h3>Community</h3> \n<p><strong>Winner: Vimeo</strong></p> \n<p>User numbers don't tell the entire story. With such a massive audience on YouTube, the environment is naturally more competitive. It's easier for your video to get drowned out by thousands of others if you aren't planning to feature it somewhere off YouTube. Vimeo's smaller, more community-driven platform might be a better option if you're hoping to tap into an existing creative niche, or get featured on their <a href=\"https://vimeo.com/channels/staffpicks\">hand-curated staff picks page</a>.</p> \n<h3>Advanced Privacy Options</h3> \n<p><strong>Winner: Vimeo</strong></p> \n<p>Both YouTube and Vimeo give you the option to set videos to private or public (the default setting on YouTube is public), but Vimeo offers a handful of more nuanced, specific privacy options if that serves your interests. You can add a password protection option to videos, share a video only with people who follow your account, or even hide it from the Vimeo community — which could be useful if you plan on embedding the video on your website and want it to be viewable in only one place.</p> \n<h3>Customizable Player</h3> \n<p><strong>Winner: Vimeo</strong></p> \n<p>Vimeo's sleek embedded player <a href=\"https://help.vimeo.com/hc/en-us/articles/224972808-Customizing-the-embedded-player\">offers a number of useful customization options</a> that YouTube can't match, including hex color customization and the ability to include a custom player logo (on Business and PRO accounts). Plus, when you change the default customization options on your account, all previously embedded videos will update to reflect the changes automatically, with no need to go back and tinker with any code.</p> \n<h3>Analytics</h3> \n<p><strong>Winner: YouTube </strong></p> \n<p>YouTube takes the win here because <a href=\"https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/1714323?hl=en&amp;__hstc=20629287.6ac66382cd6445e9a532bf78e26b2936.1629761983054.1644432577944.1644443037198.247&amp;__hssc=20629287.5.1644443037198&amp;__hsfp=2104872287\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><span>all their analytics</span></a> — ranging from basic statistics like views to more advanced options — are completely free. Vimeo also offers <a href=\"https://vimeo.com/stats\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><span>powerful analytics tools</span></a> to evaluate performance, but you'll have to pay to access everything but basic stats.</p> \n<h3>Video Quality</h3> \n<p style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Winner: Vimeo</p> \n<p>When it comes to video quality, Vimeo beats out YouTube. In a test done by <a href=\"https://medium.com/@GreatUX/vimeo-vs-youtube-video-quality-18e51f83f916\">Medium</a>, Vimeo's video quality was crisp, clean, and easier to read. On the other hand, the same video on YouTube was blurry, making it much harder to follow.</p> \n<h3>Audio Quality</h3> \n<p style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Winner: Vimeo</p> \n<p>Again, when it comes to quality, Vimeo comes out on top. Sound quality is higher on Vimeo because the platform supports 320Kbps. However, to enjoy higher-quality videos and audio, you'll need to be subscribed to one of the paid plans.</p> \n<h3>Live Streaming</h3> \n<p style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Winner: YouTube</p> \n<p>Both Vimeo and YouTube have live streaming options, however, YouTube is the clear winner here because it's free. Vimeo offers live streaming with a paid plan. However, with Vimeo, you can upload new versions of the video and keep on using the same URL and upload higher quality recorded versions of a live stream, which you can edit before posting.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Imported%20sitepage%20images/youtube-vs-vimeo-mini-infographic-market-motive.jpg?width=790&amp;name=youtube-vs-vimeo-mini-infographic-market-motive.jpg\" alt=\"YouTube vs. Vimeo infographic\" width=\"790\" style=\"width: 790px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://www.marketmotive.com/blog/online-marketing/vimeo-vs-youtube-which-should-you-be-using\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a></span></p> \n<h3>So which one should you choose?</h3> \n<p>It depends on what exactly you want to accomplish with your videos. If you're looking for a creative community where you can connect with other video creators and gain some exposure in a specific niche, Vimeo is a better place to start sharing your content. If you have business goals that revolve heavily around search optimization and ads, YouTube is your best bet.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=7e8681b3-9162-45a4-b6a1-f33ff244a78a&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"New call-to-action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/7e8681b3-9162-45a4-b6a1-f33ff244a78a.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img Hesterberg)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b33cfd44-133a-49e3-a943-086c5679d485.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn34@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-26-48-389_cf13f3171c1652e5.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Imported%20sitepage%20images/youtube-vs-vimeo-mini-infographic-market-motive.jpg?width=790&name=youtube-vs-vimeo-mini-infographic-market-motive.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn88@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-26-54-682_5c49f26b5a0d36be.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/7e8681b3-9162-45a4-b6a1-f33ff244a78a.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn84@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-53-229_61f66f8328bd53cd.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fyoutube-vs-vimeo&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn25@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-54-994_4ad67a02c3a430ec.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246408203},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"370 Best Instagram Captions: Good, Cool, Funny, & Cute IG Quotes","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-captions","description":"<p>If you're anything like me, you take about four minutes choosing a filter for your Instagram photo, and about four hours deciding on a caption.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>Worst of all, after much creative effort and advice from friends, I'm usually barely able to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/write-good-instagram-caption?_ga=2.101382273.1039695984.1631207651-2064995039.1631207651\">write a caption</a> that goes beyond, \"Had a fun day with friends!\"</p> \n<p>And I'm a writer — go figure.</p> \n<p>Next time you're contemplating a witty line of text to go with your Instagram photo, take a look at our complete list of captions that suit any mood or occasion you’ll be sharing with the world. You can also <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/write-good-instagram-caption?_ga=2.147341055.959074795.1619841072-1268939333.1619841072\">customize these captions</a> to make them perfect for your feed.</p> \n<p>Want more inspiration? Check out our <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/hubspot/\">Instagram page</a> to see how we incorporate fun, witty, and engaging captions into our social media content.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=5e999bfc-f8b2-4ab7-96a8-c1467f450ca2&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Download Now: Free Instagram for Business Kit + Templates\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/5e999bfc-f8b2-4ab7-96a8-c1467f450ca2.png\" align=\"middle\" /></a></p> \n<p>You can incorporate many of these captions into an <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-for-business-guide\">Instagram business strategy</a> (just make sure your audience would find your caption funny, clever, or the right amount of sassy).</p> \n<p>Click one of the following links to jump to a section:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-captions#business\">Business Instagram Captions</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-captions#quote\">Quote Instagram Captions</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-captions#funny\">Funny Instagram Captions</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-captions#clever\">Clever Instagram Captions</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-captions#cute\">Cute Instagram Captions</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-captions#sass\">Sassy Instagram Captions</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-captions#lyrics\">Song Lyrics for Instagram Captions</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-captions#holiday\">Holiday Instagram Captions</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-captions#seasonal\">Seasonal Instagram Captions</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-captions#selfie\">Selfie Instagram Captions</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-captions#vacation\">Vacation Instagram Captions</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h2>Features of Good Instagram Captions</h2> \n<h3>1. Your caption is on-brand.</h3> \n<p>Whether your Instagram page is personal or for your business, your captions should be on-brand, or reflective of your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/agency/develop-brand-identity\">brand identity</a>.</p> This encapsulates the nature of your Instagram's branding and tone of voice. For example, if your page is based on self-love, you should use captions that are friendly in tone, and use inclusive language to make people feel good when they scroll through your Instagram profile. \n<br> <h3>2. Your caption is simple.</h3> <p>Instagram captions can fit up to 2,200 characters, but you don't have to use all of them for your caption to be considered a good one. You ideally want to keep your captions clear, short, and simple for easy readability. You also want to keep your audience's attention enough to read it to finish.</p> <p>The exception to this is if you're making posts that champion storytelling or other lengthy formats. Ultimately, it comes down to what your audience is looking for.</p> <h3>3. Your caption is memorable.</h3> <p>While your Instagram caption doesn't have to be a profound piece of literature, you can make it memorable in a number of ways. Depending on the type of post you're sharing, you can make it hilarious, thought-provoking, inspiring, or anything you want it to be.&nbsp;</p> <p></p> <a></a> <h2>Business Instagram Captions</h2> <p>If you’re running a business account, you should use your captioning to humanize your business more than your average paid ad.</p> <p>Your business Instagram captions are an opportunity to give your brand some personality while getting the word out about your product or service offering. Here are some of our go-to captions that prospects and customers will love.</p> <p><img src=\"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/r1WjSm56W13yxdtfr__8LHh-2JsSQwQrluZfW343DUMU-RKrtQ3JPEdnPBAYVxeXNXD70ccKYmQNNVpJGSPKuD3KaGpMAOpe6RHMsM7TD74Fe0uLXvmJl_uR02QvhSfRx-g-NxuY\" width=\"350\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 350px;\" alt=\"Instagram captions: If you're offered a seat on a rocket ship, don't ask what seat. Just get on.\" /></p> \n <ol> \n  <li>Good evening, [city]! We're in town for [event] at Booth [#]. Stop by and say hi!</li> \n  <li>\"If you're offered a seat on a rocket ship, don't ask what seat. Just get on.\" <em>-Sheryl Sandberg, COO of Facebook</em></li> \n  <li>Our [#]-person squad completed the [road race name]! And we did it all for the post-run sneaker selfie. 👟</li> \n  <li>We got product in the pipeline ... check back for an exciting announcement on [date]!</li> \n  <li>Diversity isn't a recruitment metric — it's an ingredient for success. At [company], we thrive on the unique backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of our people.</li> \n  <li>Spot the CEO. 😉</li> \n  <li>At [company name], our best asset is our people.</li> \n  <li>We had a great time with our customers at [meeting/event]! @[client/partner], you guys rock.</li> \n  <li>Thrilled to have [customer] at our office today! Come back any time. 😊</li> \n  <li>[Company name] is off for [holiday]! We hope you all have a safe long weekend.</li> \n  <li>Big things have small beginnings. [Company]'s HQ began right here.</li> \n  <li>\"It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.\" -<em>Herman Melville</em></li> \n  <li>How many [company name] employees does it take to spell \"TEAM\"?</li> \n  <li>Want to work with these awesome people, working on a lot of awesome things? We're hiring! Click the link in our bio to see our current openings.</li> \n  <li>Check, check, one, two ... is this thing on? [Company name] is now on Instagram! Follow us to learn about our culture, product, and (awesome) people.</li> \n  <li>Tired of [customer pain point]? We’ve got good news. Click the link in our bio to learn about [product]’s latest feature.</li> \n  <li>[Company] presents our latest product — made with love just for you. <strong>❤️ </strong>Link in bio to learn more.</li> \n  <li>Stop wasting time with [customer pain point]. Our [product] will help you achieve [X] more efficiently — just ask our current customers. Check out our latest case study here: [Link]</li> \n  <li>Handmade in [location] and delivered to your door. That’s the [Company] promise.</li> \n  <li>When life gives you lemons, you make lemonade. When [company name] gives you [type of product], you make money.</li> \n </ol> <a></a> <h2>Quote Instagram Captions</h2> <p>If you can’t find the words yourself, there’s a quote out there to help you convey that idea.</p> <p>Using quotes for your Instagram caption is a great way to evoke and share your emotions. Quotes can propel people to think more open-mindedly, and optimistically — or even motivate them to do something great. Below is a list of some of our favorites.</p> \n <ol> \n  <li>“The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.” -<em>Nelson Mandela</em></li> \n  <li>\"Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.\" <em>-Margaret Mead</em></li> \n  <li>“You change the world by being yourself.”<em> -Yoko Ono</em></li> \n  <li>\"In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.\"<em> -Abraham Lincoln</em></li> \n  <li>\"What I know for sure is that speaking your truth is the most powerful tool we all have.\"<em> - Oprah Winfrey</em></li> \n  <li>\"The purpose of our lives is to be happy.\" <em>-Dalai Lama</em></li> \n  <li>\"You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.\" <em>-Mae West</em></li> \n  <li>\"Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air.\"<em> -Ralph Waldo Emerson</em></li> \n  <li>\"I would rather die of passion than of boredom.\" <em>-Vincent van Gogh</em></li> \n  <li>“Success isn’t about the end result, it’s about what you learn along the way.”<em> -Vera Wang</em></li> \n  <li>\"It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.\"<em> -Confucius</em></li> \n  <li>\"Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.\" <em>-George Addair</em></li> \n  <li><em>\"</em>You become what you believe.\"<em> -Oprah Winfrey</em></li> \n  <li>\"Believe you can and you're halfway there.\" <em>-Theodore Roosevelt</em></li> \n  <li>“The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.\"<em> -Walt Disney</em></li> \n  <li>\"Love the life you live. Live the life you love.\"<em> -Bob Marley</em></li> \n  <li>\"My mission in life is not merely to survive, but to thrive; and to do so with some passion, some compassion, some humor, and some style.\" <em>-Maya Angelou</em></li> \n  <li>\"Embrace what makes you unique, even if it makes others uncomfortable.” <em>- Janelle Monae</em></li> \n  <li>“Success is a collection of problems solved.” <em>- I.M. Pei</em></li> \n  <li>“To be beautiful means to be yourself. You don’t need to be accepted by others. Lewis</em></li> \n  <li>“If you are depressed you are living in the past. If you are anxious you are living in the future. If you are at peace you are living in the present.” <em>-Lao Tzu</em></li> \n  <li>“Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.” <em>-Albert Einstein</em></li> \n  <li>“If you are working on something that you really care about, you don’t have to be pushed. The vision pulls you.”<em> -Steve Jobs</em></li> \n  <li>“Security is mostly a superstition. Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.” <em>– Helen Keller</em></li> \n  <li>“Stay true to yourself and never let what somebody else says distract you from your goals.” <em>-Michelle Obama</em></li> \n </ol> <a></a> <h2>Funny Instagram Captions</h2> <p>We don’t always have to take social media so seriously, so explore some funny Instagram captions for your upcoming posts.</p> <p>Instagram can be a tool to convey aesthetic picture taking or stoic model shoots, it can also be a fun place to share a laugh or lighthearted content, too. Sharing a funny caption can boost your page’s personality, and potentially brighten someone else’s day. We hope the following captions make you crack a smile.</p> <p><img src=\"https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/tCfSv9WwxO6cfB2Ec-D9UcckmCm8oSueVhYcmIf3oZbUJ4A3eUR53XnzB6cAck7sclSrEgLyEvUIC3pJcQpr0LJis9XoksUH9MZPhwKNEpv98a9KgeDSq3jhZksYUSKDfwADZIID\" width=\"350\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 350px;\" alt=\"Instagram captions: We know the voices in our heads aren't real, but sometimes their ideas are just too good to ignore.\" /></p> \n <ol> \n  <li>My favorite exercise is a cross between a lunge and a crunch ... I call it lunch.</li> \n  <li>I need a six-month holiday, twice a year.</li> \n  <li>We tried to be normal once. Worst two minutes of our lives!</li> \n  <li>There are 16-year-olds competing at the Olympics and some of us (me) still push on \"pull\" doors.</li> \n  <li>That awkward moment when you're wearing Nike's and you can't do it.</li> \n  <li>I'm just a girl, standing in front of a salad, asking it to be a cupcake.</li> \n  <li>What if we told you ... you can eat without posting it on Instagram?</li> \n  <li>I know the voices in my head aren't real, but sometimes their ideas are just too good to ignore.</li> \n  <li>We don't know what's tighter: Our jeans or our company culture.</li> \n  <li>Friday ... Our second-favorite F word.</li> \n  <li>We don't care what people think of us. Unless they're our customers. We build amazing apps and eat amazing apps.</li> \n  <li>They say \"Do what you love and money will come to you.\" Let’s see what happens, I just ordered tamales.</li> \n  <li>My favorite subject in school was recess.</li> \n  <li>No thoughts brain empty just tacos and cats.</li> \n  <li>[Food item] so good it’s got me weak in the knees.</li> \n  <li>The best part about waking up is going to sleep eighteen hours later.</li> \n  <li>The older you get, the better you get, unless you’re a banana.</li> \n  <li>Bring the alcohol! Because no great story started with someone eating a salad.</li> \n  <li>Don't worry if plan A fails. Signed, Floor.</li> \n  <li>The first thing I do after coming to work is logging off.</li> \n  <li>I used to think I was indecisive, but now I am not so sure.</li> \n  <li>Friends buy you lunch. Try getting me out of bed before 12 PM.</li> \n  <li>Looking at these pictures won't fix all your problems, but it's a good start.</li> \n  <li>My sauce is too hot that's why you'll never ketchup.</li> \n  <li>Google Maps said it's MY TURN.</li> \n  <li>I got my haters seasick, they see me and get sick.</li> \n  <li><span>If there would be an award for being lazy, I would send someone to pick it up for me.</span></li> \n </ol> <a></a> <h2>Clever Instagram Captions</h2> <p>Trying to come up with some clever Instagram captions on your own can be a lot of work, so we’ve done it for you. If you find it, let me know so I can get some.</li> \n </ol> <a></a> <h2>Cute Instagram Captions</h2> <p>If there’s one thing people on the internet love to see — it’s anything and everything that falls into the category of cute. Historically speaking, more powerful.</li> \n  <li>Be a little more you, and a lot less them.</li> \n  <li>We're an acquired taste. [Show 1], [Show 2], and [Show 3], to name a few.</li> \n  <li>Everyone has that one annoying friend. If you don’t have one, then it’s probably you.</li> \n  <li>Above: A photo of me pretending to be listening.</li> \n  <li>Oh, you sent me an email? Expect a response in approximately never.</li> \n  <li>Everyone is entitled to be stupid, but some abuse the privilege.</li> \n  <li>If you like me, raise your hand. Not everyone has good taste.</li> \n  <li>I'm a work of art, showing you the art or working.</li> \n  <li>I only show up wearing my best and you shouldn't expect less.</li> \n  <li>You couldn't even outshine my shadow.</li> \n  <li>Please don't call me, I'm out of your range.</li> \n </ol> <a></a> <h2>Song Lyrics for Instagram Captions</h2> <p>People of all different backgrounds can relate to music.
