16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"How Market Intelligence Will Make Your Marketing Team More Agile","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/market-intelligence","description":"<p>When I was younger, my dream was to open a cheese store with my family. My mom, brother, sister, and I — we're all obsessed with cheese.</p>  \n<p>So anytime I see a cheese store, I'll go in and sample everything … for research, obviously.</p> \n<p>Although I'd never thought about it this way before, I was already thinking in terms of market intelligence and market research (two different concepts, but more on that below).</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=6ba52ce7-bb69-4b63-965b-4ea21ba905da&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"→ Download Now: Market Research Templates [Free Kit]\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/6ba52ce7-bb69-4b63-965b-4ea21ba905da.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p>I was thinking about the product and its competitors.</p> \n<p>As a marketer, market intelligence is important because it can help you understand your position in the market, evaluate your product, know your target audience, and conduct competitive analysis.</p> \n<p>With this information, your marketing team will be better equipped to position your company in the marketplace. For companies that prioritize intelligence data, decision-making can be <a href=\"https://techjury.net/blog/business-intelligence-statistics/#gref\">five times faster</a>.</p> \n<p>Feeling hesitant to rely on intelligence data? <a href=\"https://www.gartner.com/smarterwithgartner/gartner-top-10-trends-in-data-and-analytics-for-2020\">Gartner reports</a> over one-third of organizations will rely on decision intelligence by 2023, making data intelligence a must for remaining competitive.</p> \n<p>Below, let's review what market intelligence is, how it's different from market research, and the intel tools that can facilitate the process.</p> \n<p>Market intelligence is used to learn about the existing market, customers, problems, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/competitive-intelligence-competitive-advantage\">competition</a>, and growth potential. Businesses can gather this information through internal and external sources such as sales logs, surveys, social media, news websites, manufacturers, clients, or distributors.</p> \n<p>For instance, companies can gather general demographics and spending habits of their consumers to write better, more targeted <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-marketing?_ga=2.89808924.622785003.1614973949-456434430.1614973949\">social media ads</a>. Additionally, market intelligence can help a company make decisions on product development and establish a stronger brand.</p> \n<h2>How to Gather Market Intelligence</h2> \n<p>So, what type of information should you collect? Generally, market intelligence can be divided into four main categories of information:</p> \n<h3>Competitor Intelligence</h3> \n<p>This is the process of <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/competitive-intelligence-competitive-advantage\">learning more about your competitors</a>. To do this, you might conduct a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/swot-analysis\">SWOT analysis</a>, so you can look at the competition's strengths and weaknesses. The goal is to uncover why customers would choose competitors over your product or service.</p> \n<h3>Product Intelligence</h3> \n<p>Once you've analyzed how you compare to your competitors, look inward at your own product or service. The goal is to learn about its quality and performance and identify opportunities for improvement.</p> \n<p>If you have a physical product, you should also analyze your manufacturing process. Are you building your product in the most efficient way? This information should help you improve the user experience and improve your product.</p> \n<h3>Market Understanding</h3> \n<p>To truly understand how your product is performing, you'll have to look at the various markets where it's available. Could you <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/market-development-strategy\">expand your product </a>to other markets? Are there other markets that could benefit from your product or service?</p> \n<p>Ultimately, this information should help you understand where your audience is and what gaps exist, so you can fill them.</p> \n<h3>Customer Understanding</h3> \n<p>Understanding your customer helps to increase your product or service life cycle. That's because it's usually more expensive to gain a new customer than to keep an existing one.<a href=\"https://www.invespcro.com/blog/customer-acquisition-retention/\"></a></p> \n<p>For this reason — and many others — you have to know your audience. Why do your customers buy from you? What challenges do you help them resolve? The goal here is to gather the information that can help your marketing team come up with targeted campaigns.</p> \n<p>Overall, gathering market intelligence should answer questions like:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Where should we devote more resources?</li> \n <li>What markets can we enter next?</li> \n <li>What are our customers purchasing patterns?</li> \n <li>What audiences should we market to?</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Now, you might be wondering, <em>\"How do I gather this information?\"</em></p> \n<p>To conduct market intelligence, you'll use internal and external sources of data, such as:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Surveys</li> \n <li>Polls</li> \n <li>Forms</li> \n <li>Focus groups</li> \n <li>Interviews</li> \n <li>Observation</li> \n <li>A/B tests</li> \n <li>Competitor tracking analytics</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Depending on the analytics you have available, a lot of this information can be found on your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/7969/what-is-a-cms-and-why-should-you-care.aspx\">content management system </a>(CMS) or <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/how-to-use-crm\">customer relationship management </a>(CRM).</p> \n<p>However, before we jump into the software you can use to find this information, I know you're probably thinking, <em>\"How is this different from market research?\" </em>Let's dive into that below.</p> \n<p>Alternatively to market intelligence, market research focuses on learning more about the buyer's research process and what influences their buying decisions.</p> \n<h2>Example of Market Intelligence</h2> \n<p>Let’s walk through an example of how a fictional company could use market intelligence to create a competitive advantage.</p> \n<p>JKL Podcasting Co offers online software podcasters can use to record, edit, and distribute their podcast to major streaming platforms. As marketers at JKL look to expand the company’s user base, they performed an in-depth analysis of the market for podcast recording software.</p> \n<p>In this analysis, they covered four areas:</p> \n<ol> \n <li>Competitor landscape — They identified the top-ranking podcast recording software companies to understand their product features, pricing model, sales funnel, marketing tactics, and customer demographics.</li> \n <li>Product — After gathering competitor information, they worked with their product team to gain a deep understanding of their own product including key features, how it was like competitor products, and what differentiated it from competitor products. They also learned about up-and-coming features launching later in the year.</li> \n <li>Market analysis — Next, the team did research to understand the overall valuation and growth potential of the podcast recording software market. They learned podcast listenership has <a href=\"https://www.insiderintelligence.com/insights/the-podcast-industry-report-statistics/\"><span>grown over the past decade</span></a> and is expected to grow more in coming years, which could lead to more podcasts being produced. With seeing growth and investment in the podcasting space, along with increased interest in people wanting to start podcasts, marketers at JKL learn there is a potential market for new, or up-and-coming podcasters who want easy-to-use software.</li> \n <li>Customer base — Finally, the JKL marketing team reached out to a focus group of their current customers to understand their relationship to the product. The customers walk them through their podcast production workflow using JKL software and share what features they love, along with what new features or changes they would like to see.</li> \n</ol> \n<p>After going through this exercise, JKL has gained valuable insight into their competitive landscape, product features to highlight, market growth opportunities, and ways to keep their current customer base engaged and using the platform.</p> \n<p>You're probably wondering, <em>\"How do I gather this information?\" </em>Below, let's review what tools and software you can use.</p> \n<h2>Market Intelligence Tools</h2> \n<p>For market intelligence to be useful, companies need to conduct research and sort through their collected data for analysis. A lot of this can be done through your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/how-to-use-crm\">CRM software</a>.</p> \n<p>To start, many CRMs allow you to create competitor profiles in which you will track your competitors' products, price points, organizational updates, social media activity, and more.</p> \n<p>You'll likely also find <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/battle-cards\">battle card templates </a>in your CRM, making it easy for your sales reps to access the information they need during their calls to combat objections and persuade prospects.</p> \n<p>In addition, you can conduct regular <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/questions-to-ask-win-loss-review\">win/loss analysis </a>with your sales team to determine strengths and weaknesses in your sales and/or marketing strategy. You'll want to know:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>What factors are contributing to your wins and losses?</li> \n <li>What other company was the prospect considering for the sale? Why?</li> \n <li>Which competitors are you beating and which ones you are losing to?</li> \n</ul> \n<p>If you don't already have a CRM, there are many out there that cater to businesses ranging from small to enterprise-level. Pricing is usually structured on a monthly basis and can range anywhere from $20/month to $1200+.</p> \n<p>If your team would rather focus on specific tools, there are several online options to help you achieve your goals. Below are a few we recommend, divided into sections depending on your goals. Additionally, if you're a HubSpot user, many of these tools integrate with <a href=\"https://ecosystem.hubspot.com/marketplace/apps/all-categories?eco_search=market%20intelligence\"></a><a href=\"https://ecosystem.hubspot.com/marketplace/apps/all-categories?eco_search=market%20intelligence\">HubSpot</a>.</p> \n<h3>Competitor Intelligence</h3> \n<h4>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing\">HubSpot's Marketing Hub</a></h4> \n<img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/HubSpot-homepage.jpg?width=600&amp;name=HubSpot-homepage.jpg\" alt=\"Market-Intelligence-Marketing-Hub\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"http://Hubspot.com\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>HubSpot's Marketing Hub has extensive tools to help marketing teams manage, track and scale their efforts. The platform offers both free and premium subscription plans ranging from $45 to $3,200 a month.</p> \n<h4>2. <a href=\"https://www.crayon.co/\">Crayon</a></h4> \n<p><img alt=\"Market-Intelligence-Crayon-Homepage\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/%5BUpdate%5D%20How%20Market%20Intelligence%20Will%20Make%20Your%20Marketing%20Team%20More%20Agile.jpeg?width=600&amp;name=%5BUpdate%5D%20How%20Market%20Intelligence%20Will%20Make%20Your%20Marketing%20Team%20More%20Agile.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 600px;\" title=\"\" width=\"600\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 12px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"http://Crayon.co\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>Crayon is one of the leading competitive intelligence (CI) tools in the industry. Its software can fetch and categorize data from over 300 million sources.</p> \n<p>The platform also makes it easy for sales and marketing teams to find the intel they need, through battle cards, email digests, and a centralized dashboard.</p> \n<p>For pricing information, you must contact the company.</p> \n<h4>3. <a href=\"https://www.semrush.com/\">SEMrush</a></h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/SEMrush-homepage.jpg?width=600&amp;name=SEMrush-homepage.jpg\" alt=\"Market-Intelligence-SEMrush-homepage\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"http://Semrush.com\">Image Source</a></span></p> \n<p>If you want to track your competitors' SEO performance, SEMrush is a great place to start. The platform has extensive tools, including keyword research, domain overview, and keyword difficulty. This will give you more insight into your competitors' strategies and how their efforts are performing.</p> \n<p>Similar to HubSpot, SEMrush offers a free version of its platform. It also offers premium subscription plans ranging from $119 to $449 a month.</p> \n<h3>Product Intelligence</h3> \n<h4>1. <a href=\"https://ecosystem.hubspot.com/marketplace/apps/customer-success/survey/surveymonkey\">SurveyMonkey</a></h4> \n<p><img alt=\"Market intelligence Survey Monkey homepage\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/%5BUpdate%5D%20How%20Market%20Intelligence%20Will%20Make%20Your%20Marketing%20Team%20More%20Agile-1.jpeg?width=600&amp;name=%5BUpdate%5D%20How%20Market%20Intelligence%20Will%20Make%20Your%20Marketing%20Team%20More%20Agile-1.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 600px;\" title=\"\" width=\"600\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 12px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.surveymonkey.com/\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>Surveys are one of the best ways to learn more about how customers are responding to your products. Survey Monkey allows you to customize your survey to get the insights you need. Beyond a wide range of survey features like advanced survey logic and pagination, the platform also has tools to promote team collaboration.</p> \n<p>Access to <a href=\"https://www.surveymonkey.com/\">Survey Monkey </a>starts at no cost, but their premium versions begin at $25/month.</p> \n<h4>2. <a href=\"https://inmoment.com/\"><span>InMoment</span></a></h4> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img src=\"https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/VEBz4QjG_mC2Cy0dKSXRQu1VDeAMlGvQkOByf1L9GfyjXDLJMjKfLW44cfEnj4P0_1Fezf7r1dmxVPME7qYH-A9QSX0Y-4uEl1hsmbrZ2OUCv57pRqTFHIF_BKWeNnvrKNG0-nFY\" width=\"624\" height=\"373\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://inmoment.com/roles/market-research-insights/\"><span>Image Source</span></a></p> \n<p>InMoment, formerly Wootric, an analytics platform that helps you learn more about customer sentiment. You can gather real-time analytics, which arms your team to make decisions quickly.</p> \n<p>The platform also has many integrations for easy team collaboration, including <a href=\"https://slack.com/\">Slack</a>, <a href=\"https://zapier.com/\">Zapier</a>, and <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/\">HubSpot</a>.</p> \n<p>For pricing details, you must contact the company.</p> \n<h4>3. <a href=\"https://ecosystem.hubspot.com/marketplace/apps/marketing/marketing-automation/metadata\">Metadata</a></h4> \n<img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Metadata.io-homepage.jpg?width=600&amp;name=Metadata.io-homepage.jpg\" alt=\"Metadata.io Homepage\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"> \n<p style=\"font-size: 12px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"http://metadata.io\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p><a href=\"http://metadata.io\">Metadata </a>is a SaaS company that helps B2B brands generate demand for their products and/or services. On the platform, you can identify audiences, conduct experiments, and track the full sales journey.</p> \n<p>Pricing starts at $3,950 for growing companies, with custom plans available for enterprise-level businesses.</p> \n<h3>Customer Understanding</h3> \n<h4>1. <a href=\"https://www.google.com/forms/about/\">Google Forms</a></h4> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google-Forms.jpg?width=600&amp;name=Google-Forms.jpg\" alt=\"Google Forms homepage\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://www.google.com/forms/about/\">Image Source</a></span></p> \n<p>The stand-out feature on Google Forms is the simple and easy-to-use interface. In just a few minutes, you can have a survey ready to send out to your audience to collect data. You can receive alerts every time someone answers your survey and add collaborators.</p> \n<p>The best part? It's free for individuals and included in your plan if you have a Google Business account.</p> \n<h4>2. <a href=\"https://ecosystem.hubspot.com/marketplace/apps/marketing/marketing-automation/calltrackingmetrics\">CallTrackingMetrics</a></h4> \n<p><img alt=\"CallTrackingMetrics homepage\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/%5BUpdate%5D%20How%20Market%20Intelligence%20Will%20Make%20Your%20Marketing%20Team%20More%20Agile-3.jpeg?width=600&amp;name=%5BUpdate%5D%20How%20Market%20Intelligence%20Will%20Make%20Your%20Marketing%20Team%20More%20Agile-3.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 600px;\" title=\"\" width=\"600\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://www.calltrackingmetrics.com/\">Image Source</a></span></p> \n<p>Too often, there's a disconnect between sales and marketing teams – <a href=\"https://www.calltrackingmetrics.com/\">CallTrackingMetrics </a>helps solve that. The platform offers a robust analytics tool that can identify which marketing campaigns are driving conversions, automate call processes for smoother interactions, and provide analytics — all in one place.</p> \n<p>Pricing ranges from $39/month to $299/month, with custom plans available.</p> \n<h4>3. <a href=\"https://analytics.google.com/\">Google Analytics</a></h4> \n<img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google-Analytics-homepage.jpg?width=600&amp;name=Google-Analytics-homepage.jpg\" alt=\"Google Analytics homepage\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"http://analytics.google.com/\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>Google Analytics is a website analytics tool with powerful reporting capabilities to understand how users are behaving on your site. It's a great software for brands that are already using other Google products, such as Google Ads or Google Business, as they work together seamlessly.</p> \n<p>On the platform, you can get detailed reports by goal: acquisition, retention, engagement, and monetization. The visual dashboard also allows you to get a snapshot of your site is performing.</p> \n<p>The standard version is free and ideal for small to medium-sized companies. Entreprise-level businesses must contact sales for pricing.</p> \n<h2>How To Leverage Market Intelligence Data</h2> \n<p>Once you start collecting data, unpacking it is the next step.</p> \n<p>But before you dive in head-first, come back to your goal. What do you want to learn and why? Use that to steer your approach.</p> \n<p>Having a clear direction is essential during this stage to narrow down what data to focus on. You'll be compiling a lot of data, and not all of it will be relevant to your main objective. Knowing which will be most impactful will save you so much time and allow you to use your resources efficiently.</p> \n<p>Now that you know what to focus on, start organizing and reviewing your data. You'll want to look for patterns. During this step, keep an open mind. Confirmation bias (the tendency to interpret information to support a pre-existing idea or belief) can greatly impact how you interpret data, so it's important to consider all perspectives.</p> \n<p>Once you identify a theme or trend, dive deeper to answer the 5Ws. <strong>When </strong>did it start? <strong>Who </strong>or <strong>what </strong>is influencing this? <strong>Why </strong>is it happening? <strong>Where </strong>else is this trend identified?</p> \n<p>From there, it's time to strategize. Based on what your data is telling you, you can develop an action plan and make recommendations to key stakeholders.</p> \n<p>For instance, let's say your latest intel revealed that consumers are unaware of a key feature in your product line, which is steering them toward your competitors. Your recommendation could be to launch a marketing campaign that highlights that feature, create stronger messaging on your website product pages, and adjust the sales team's scripts to place more emphasis on this feature and how it's better suited for your customers than a competitor's.</p> \n<p>The formula is easy: collect, organize, identify, and recommend. Understanding your market is key to entering the market and maintaining your place in it. But if you want to stand out among your competition, you'll need to leverage market intel.</p> \n<p>Market intelligence can give you a holistic view of the market, improve customer retention, boost your efficiency, and give you a competitive advantage. So, I'm not being hyperbolic when I say market intelligence is vital for your company to succeed.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=560aa80b-9e0b-4615-851c-f23e4f49b62f&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"New Call-to-action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/560aa80b-9e0b-4615-851c-f23e4f49b62f.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img rx3/cdn10@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-55-319_f858af862c01f911.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/%5BUpdate%5D%20How%20Market%20Intelligence%20Will%20Make%20Your%20Marketing%20Team%20More%20Agile-3.jpeg?width=600&name=%5BUpdate%5D%20How%20Market%20Intelligence%20Will%20Make%20Your%20Marketing%20Team%20More%20Agile-3.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn43@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-50-280_54ef9f2700766d63.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google-Analytics-homepage.jpg?width=600&name=Google-Analytics-homepage.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn98@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-50-047_4297be3c29aa9c9e.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/560aa80b-9e0b-4615-851c-f23e4f49b62f.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn58@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-54-369_56bafbfb62a605be.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fmarket-intelligence&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn66@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-54-618_b56b13e70ea8bb43.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246408221},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"What is Content Governance? 4 Easy Steps to Create a Model in 2022","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/content-governance-model","description":"<p>Without a content governance model in place, your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/content-marketing\">content marketing</a> efforts can seem scattered and chaotic, opening the opportunity for your audience to replace you with a competitor.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>Content governance keeps your relationship with your customers thriving, and allows you and your team to more effectively focus on your content goals.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=a145a75e-59f6-4b51-a482-4f3ea486e740&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Free Resource: Content Marketing Planning Template\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/a145a75e-59f6-4b51-a482-4f3ea486e740.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p>In this post, we’ll cover the topic of content governance — what it is, why it’s important, and how you can create a model for your business.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>The goal of a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/content-marketing-plan\">content strategy</a> is for your company to create meaningful and engaging content that aligns with your business objectives and drives consumers to a particular action. Content governance ensures that you have a definitive way for this content to reach them. Who creates the content? On what platform is it published? How will it be updated in the future? While these questions and their answers help shape content governance, its framework involves more.</p> \n<p>Content governance is more than consumer-facing content. It requires preliminary and behind-the-scenes work seen in an asset like an <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/business-blog-editorial-calendar-templates\">editorial content calendar</a>. Consumers don’t have access to your company’s content calendar; however, this is an irreplaceable tool to keep your company on track with its strategy. <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/31247/the-simple-template-for-a-thorough-content-style-guide.aspx\">Style guides</a> and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/company-content-audit\">content audits</a> are other tools that assist with content governance but are unseen by consumers.</p> \n<p>Content governance encompasses content sent to consumers and content that waits for them. It is not only reserved for social media posts that land on their feed or emails sent to their inbox. It includes banner ads or frequently asked questions on your website. It’s your Instagram bio or the answering message you have for phone calls. In a business, content is <em>everywhere</em>, and content governance allows your business to manage all of its avenues.</p> \n<h2>Why is content governance important?</h2> \n<p>To illustrate the importance of content governance, let’s look at an analogy.</p> \n<p>Content marketing is like a first date. You wine and dine with visuals and information and hope it builds a budding relationship. If it does, how do you move forward and keep building?</p> \n<p>After that initial interaction, you publish two emails, one blog post, and four social media posts during week one. You drop the ball in week two. The amount of content decreases to one email and two social media posts. Week three is worse, but during week four, you’re able to publish three emails, two blog posts, and five social media posts. While the increase in content <em>seems</em> remarkable, your potential long-term customer has unsubscribed from your content after a month. Why?</p> \n<p><em>Content</em> needs to be <em>governed</em> by procedures and systems. Procedures mean consistency, and consistency is key to the success of any business. It shows effort and demonstrates to customers that you <em>care</em>.</p> \n<p>Content works as a cycle. Although the number of steps might differ for each organization, content life cycles typically follow this process:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Develop a strategy.</li> \n <li>Create the content.</li> \n <li>Store the content.</li> \n <li>Edit.</li> \n <li>Publish.</li> \n <li>Analyze.</li> \n <li>Update or repurpose content.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>The content cycle never ends. There is always work to do. Use the steps above. If you finish strategizing, focus on content creation. If you’re not creating, your company can work on storing, editing, publishing, and more.</p> \n<p>Content governance is important because it ensures that your company maintains an efficient process in its continuous content cycle. It can prevent delays, inconsistent messaging, or even legal issues. Content governance helps:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Provide structure</li> \n <li>Establish clear roles and responsibilities</li> \n <li>Create detailed processes and workflows</li> \n <li>Outline company standards and policies</li> \n</ul> \n<p>A comprehensive content governance model creates a standard for effective, consistent content, resulting in continued success.</p> \n<p>The online world is fast-paced, and to keep up, businesses need to make sure that they’re covering all avenues. It used to mean website and email content; however, the growth of social media has expanded the number of channels businesses need to account for. Companies have had to shift gears and adjust their content strategies to accommodate social platforms like Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn.</p> \n<p>While content grows and changes, its governance models help companies scale, sustain, and recreate their content.</p> \n<h2>Creating a Content Governance Model</h2> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/content-governance-models.png?width=650&amp;name=content-governance-models.png\" alt=\"content governance model components\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>You’re ready to create your content governance model. While each step might require extensive work, the process isn’t complicated. Building your content governance model requires four steps.</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Establish and define the roles and responsibilities of the content team.</li> \n <li>Design content workflows.</li> \n <li>Create policies, standards, and procedures for content.</li> \n <li>Document guidelines and ensure company-wide compliance.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Let's go over these one-by-one.</p> \n<h3>1. Establish and define the roles and responsibilities of the content team.</h3> \n<p>Good content doesn’t exist without people. While you could argue that the most vital person in the content experience is the consumer, you could also contend that content would not exist without the team.</p> \n<p>To create a content governance model, decide on the roles and responsibilities of those within the company. Content roles include strategists, writers, editors, and analysts. When defining the obligations of the people in these roles, think about their function. Team members typically have a strategic, operational, or specialist function.</p> \n<p>A strategic function, usually seen in roles like a content strategist, is for those who plan long-term strategy. Staff, who are operational, implement the content strategy daily. This work is carried out by writers, editors, photographers, and more. Lastly, members of the specialist function provide expert data to other team members. This could be an SEO specialist providing analytical information to strategists or writers that shape how they fulfill their role.</p> \n<p>When establishing the roles and responsibilities for your team, you might find it necessary to create an overlap in function. For example, it could be beneficial to have your content writers specialize in SEO. As long as there is a clear distinction in role and responsibility, there should be no issue in team management.</p> \n<h3>2. Design content workflows.</h3> \n<p>How does your content go from Point A to Point B? Point A is an idea while Point B is publication. Consumers cannot see this process, but multiple steps are necessary to reach publication.</p> \n<p>Content workflows follow these stages:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/content-marketing-plan\"><strong>Strategy</strong></a><strong>:</strong> planning content</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/content-creation\"><strong>Creation</strong></a><strong>:</strong> writing, designing, filming, content</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/ultimate-editing-checklist\"><strong>Review</strong></a><strong>:</strong> editing and fact-checking content</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/content-distribution\"><strong>Publication/Distribution</strong></a><strong>:</strong> publishing and sharing content</li> \n</ul> \n<p>While the list is short, the process isn’t. Content takes time. Once you’re aware of what it takes to create your content, use this to shape your policies, standards, and procedures.</p> \n<h3>3. Create policies, standards, and procedures for content.</h3> \n<p>Once you have the proper people in place, it is time to focus on your policies, standards, and procedures. Content policies are the values and goals of a company. Standards are targets used to make sure that a company upholds its policies. Procedures are a step-by-step breakdown of who is involved and what steps are needed to achieve the ultimate goal.</p> \n<p>Consider this example. An online company has the <strong>policy</strong> to be a leading source of global news. The company enforces this policy by setting a <strong>standard</strong> for publishing at least 10 daily articles. Members of the content team, like the writers, editors, and publishers, have <strong>procedures</strong> to guide them through the content process and ensure that 10 articles are shared with the public every day.</p> \n<p>Once your company creates policies, standards, and procedures for content, finish the process with documentation and compliance.</p> \n<h3>4. Document guidelines and ensure company-wide compliance.</h3> \n<p>There is no use in creating a content governance model if no one knows about it. The most significant element of content governance is ensuring that the entire company has access to it and complies with it.</p> \n<p>Create documents for your company policies, standards, and procedures, and put them in a central location. Hold a meeting to walk through content processes and workflows. And lastly, regularly review and update your content governance models.</p> \n<h2>Content never ends.</h2> \n<p>Content lives on a lifecycle. You might think a blog post is complete after it is published and distributed, but its cycle continues with updates and redistribution. Managing one blog post without a system is most likely doable, but imagine an additional 20 content assets in one week. Scary, right?</p> \n<p>Without any checks and balances, creating and managing your content can become chaotic. Content governance prevents this. With a content governance model in place, your company will have the framework and processes in place to successfully execute your content strategy.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=dc23c777-516f-4c62-b371-70b180c87a3e&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Blog - Content Mapping Template\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/dc23c777-516f-4c62-b371-70b180c87a3e.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p>  \n<img 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"The Top 16 Best Email Marketing Services in 2022","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-email-marketing-services","description":"<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/email-marketing-guide\"><span>Email marketing</span></a> continues to be a critical strategy for marketing (and sales teams) across an array of industries and business types, and an email marketing platform is one of the first additions to a marketer's tool belt — and for good reason.<br><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=4d91cc7a-0d35-48ce-89af-31794c494de9&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Boost Opens &amp; CTRs with HubSpot’s Free Email Marketing Software\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/4d91cc7a-0d35-48ce-89af-31794c494de9.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p>Email marketing remains a quick and effective way to engage and nurture leads into loyal customers. It's also extremely cost-effective — some studies show an <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/email-marketing-stats\"><span>ROI of up to 4,400%</span></a>. Simply, email marketing services exist to make the process of email marketing simpler — they have features and capabilities that enhance and streamline email communication (among other things) to help you identify qualified leads, nurture those leads, and close more deals.</p> \n<p><span></span></p> \n<p>Many of these tools not only offer email support, but they may also help you organize and store contact information in your <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/crm?hubs_post=blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-email-marketing-services&amp;hubs_post-cta=CRM&amp;_ga=2.159189182.522328022.1643232277-1877729306.1643232277\">CRM</a>. But with so many email marketing tools available today, where should you start? We'll answer those questions and more in this guide to email marketing services — let's dive in.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h2>What is an email marketing service?</h2> \n<p>Email marketing services and software streamline all of your email marketing efforts. They have a wide range of features depending on the service you choose — however, they often have functionality related to automation, subscription, general email communication, notifications, monitoring, campaigns, integration with other marketing, sales, and service software, and analytics.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h3>Why is an email marketing service important?</h3> \n<p>Today, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/email-marketing-2017\">email marketing services continue to be an integral, strategic tool</a> for businesses of all sizes across all industries — they help businesses build strong relationships with prospects and customers all while moving them through the buyer's journey and maintaining strong communication throughout.</p> \n<p>Not to mention, as <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/free-email-accounts\">ESPs</a> continue to develop, features like A/B Testing, automation, and personalization have made the tools even more valuable to a marketer looking to engage with an increasingly fragmented audience.</p> \n<p>Now let's look at some of the best email marketing services today — one of which you might choose to implement at your company.</p> \n<a></a> \n<p></p> \n<p>For each of the following services, we've listed notable features as well as pricing details but we still recommend reviewing the service's product and pricing pages for greater detail.</p> \n<h3>1. HubSpot Email Marketing Software</h3> \n<p>Best for email marketing that’s powered by CRM data.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/HubSpot-email-marketing.jpg?width=1244&amp;name=HubSpot-email-marketing.jpg\" alt=\"HubSpot email marketing software\" width=\"1244\" style=\"width: 1244px;\"><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/email\">HubSpot's free email marketing software</a> is easy to use, has an extremely high deliverability rate, plus all the bells and whistles you'd expect to see within an ESP.</p> \n<h4>HubSpot Email Marketing Software Features</h4> \n<p>When creating an email, you can pick from one of many drag-and-drop email templates, or you can craft a custom template tailored to your brand. Once you've got your template, incorporating content is simple and intuitive.</p> \n<p>You can also personalize and preview your emails for different recipients based on device type, country, or list inclusion — or use a simple personalization token to ensure that each email includes content that's specific to each recipient.</p> \n<p>When it comes time to send an email, using the smart send feature will ensure recipients receive your messages at an ideal time. Additionally, you can run <a href=\"https://knowledge.hubspot.com/email/run-an-a/b-test-on-your-marketing-email\">A/B tests</a> to compare different versions of an email to understand which one resonates the most with your audience. You also won't have to worry about deliverability — HubSpot maintains a 99% deliverability rate across the network for all marketing email sends.</p> \n<p>Outside of the email marketing functionality, HubSpot offers a wide range of reports on your email’s performance, letting you judge what's resonating with your audience so you can optimize your strategy accordingly.</p> \n<p>For instance, you can report on something as broad as your overall email performance in Q1 or you get granular and see how one particular lead is interacting with your emails.</p> \n<p>Lastly, <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/marketing-automation?_ga=2.164206779.567721879.1555430872-644648569.1551722047\">HubSpot's automation platform</a> makes it easy to scale your email marketing strategy, which will help you quickly turn leads into loyal customers.</p> \n<h4>HubSpot Email Marketing Software Price</h4> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/email\">Hubspot's Email Marketing Software</a> (and <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/crm\">CRM</a> for small to enterprise companies, for that matter) is <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/pricing/marketing\">free forever</a>. However, if you need enhanced capabilities, it may be worth paying for one of the <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/pricing/marketing?term=annual&amp;edition=starter\">upgraded Marketing Hub plans</a>.</p> \n<h3>2. Moosend</h3> \n<p>Best for creating automations and sending multimedia, interactive emails.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/moosend.jpg?width=1239&amp;name=moosend.jpg\" alt=\"moosend email marketing platform\" width=\"1239\" style=\"width: 1239px;\"><a href=\"https://moosend.com/\">Moosend</a> is an email marketing and marketing automation platform that offers a variety of features at an affordable price.</p> \n<h4>Moosend Features</h4> \n<p>Moosend's platform allows you to create email newsletter campaigns, landing pages, and subscription forms in a fast and reliable way.<br><br>With the drag-and-drop editor, you can either create an email newsletter from scratch, using interactive elements like videos, or use one of the ready-made templates. You can create specific campaigns for segments of your audience by using the advanced automation features. You can use one of the ready-made workflow recipes or create your own with the drag-and-drop builder.<br><br>The reporting and analytics tools give you measurable results, allowing you to make informed, data-backed decisions.</p> \n<h4>Moosend Price</h4> \n<p>Moosend's pricing model is subscriber-based and consists of <a href=\"https://moosend.com/pricing/\">three tiers</a>. The free trial includes most features and allows users to send unlimited email campaigns. The Pro plan starts at $7 per month, billed annually, and includes up to 1,000,000 subscribers. For more advanced functionality and additional support, the Enterprise plan is based on custom pricing.</p> \n<h3>3. Omnisend</h3> \n<p>Best for creating custom workflows.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/omnisend.jpg?width=1264&amp;name=omnisend.jpg\" alt=\"omnisend email marketing platform\" width=\"1264\" style=\"width: 1264px;\"><a href=\"https://www.omnisend.com/\">Omnisend</a> is an easy-to-use platform that offers automation workflows for any stage of the customer journey.</p> \n<h4>Omnisend Features</h4> \n<p>What separates Omnisend from other email marketing tools is the omni-channel functionalities, which offer greater control over how and where you connect with your audience. In the automation workflow, you can add email, SMS, push notifications, Facebook Messenger, WhatsApp, and more.</p> \n<p>If you're trying to reach a specific audience that might not respond well to traditional email communication, using a tool like Omnisend can help you build and manage more customized, targeted communication workflows. This doesn't just help you connect with your audience better — it also provides a less disruptive, more personalized experience for your contacts.</p> \n<p>Omnichannel features combined with user-friendly segmentation mean you can send the right message to the right person, at the right time, on the right channel.</p> \n<p>Omnisend also offers templates for email capture, campaigns, and automation workflows so you can get started quickly.</p> \n<h4>Omnisend Price</h4> \n<p>Omnisend has <a href=\"https://www.omnisend.com/pricing/\">three pricing plans</a> — one of which is free with very limited capabilities as well as a customizable pro plan. Their plans come with a free trial so you can experiment with the service to determine what works best for you.</p> \n<h3>4. Pabbly Email Marketing</h3> \n<p>Best for delivering bulk emails.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Pabbly.jpg?width=1232&amp;name=Pabbly.jpg\" alt=\"Pabbly email marketing platform\" width=\"1232\" style=\"width: 1232px;\"><a href=\"https://www.pabbly.com/email-marketing/?utm_source=hubspot-email&amp;utm_medium=blog&amp;utm_campaign=campaign\">Pabbly Email Marketing</a> is an email marketing software that enables you to send bulk emails either by connecting via SMTP or external SMTP.</p> \n<h4>Pabbly Email Marketing Features</h4> \n<p>Pabbly provides access to SMTP routing, workflow automation, email scheduling, and much more without any restrictions. With the help of marketing automation and autoresponders included in the tool, you can schedule emails in advance and create triggers to avoid manual follow-up responses.</p> \n<p>Additionally, Pabbly offers responsive email templates and a drag-and-drop email editor for easy customization. The email tracking feature allows you to track data such as bounce rate, open rate, and click-through rate so you can improve upon your email marketing and campaigns.</p> \n<h4>Pabbly Email Marketing Price</h4> \n<p>Pabbly offers <a href=\"https://www.pabbly.com/email-marketing/pricing/\">multiple plans</a> based on your number of subscribers. They offer a free plan — which allows you to send unlimited emails to up to 1,000 subscribers — as well as an advanced plan tailored to websites with large audiences.</p> \n<h3>5. SendinBlue</h3> \n<p>Best for sending automated nurturing and text message campaigns.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Sendinblue.jpg?width=1261&amp;name=Sendinblue.jpg\" alt=\"Sendinblue email marketing platform\" width=\"1261\" style=\"width: 1261px;\"><a href=\"https://www.sendinblue.com/\">SendinBlue</a> is an email marketing platform that helps customers send a total of over 30 million automated emails and text messages every day.</p> \n<h4>SendinBlue Features</h4> \n<p>On top of email, SendinBlue also has a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/form-builder-tools?_ga=2.262995208.567721879.1555430872-644648569.1551722047\">forms tool</a> that allows you to collect new leads, which you can then segment into specific lists and enter into email nurturing campaigns.</p> \n<p>Not sure how to kick off your email nurturing campaign? No problem. SendinBlue has workflows that give you access to a number of pre-made automation campaigns tailored to your specific goals.</p> \n<p>If you want to run a more nuanced email nurturing campaign, you can always create a campaign from scratch to meet your specific business needs.</p> \n<h4>SendinBlue Price</h4> \n<p>SendinBlue has <a href=\"https://www.sendinblue.com/pricing/\">four main plans</a>, one of which is free, two of which range in price between $25 and $65 per month, and one that is enterprise and requires you to get a customized quote. The plans vary in cost based on the number of emails sent per day/ month.</p> \n<h3>6. SendX</h3> \n<p>Best for offering visual email marketing performance data.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/SendX.jpg?width=1237&amp;name=SendX.jpg\" alt=\"SendX email marketing platform\" width=\"1237\" style=\"width: 1237px;\"><a href=\"https://www.sendx.io/\">SendX</a> is an intuitive, affordable, and feature-rich email marketing software for marketers and business owners.</p> \n<h4>SendX Features</h4> \n<p>With SendX, you can send unlimited emails to opted-in subscribers, across all pricing plans. You get charged per subscriber - not per emails sent - no matter how many lists, tags, or segments you have them in.</p> \n<p>You can optimize your email campaigns based on 30+ parameters, including past open behavior, time zone, domain name, email client, ISP, etc. You can automate your email marketing with a rule-based interface and send the right message to the right user using email drip sequences and audience segmentation.</p> \n<p>SendX can also help you grow your email lists with forms and popups. You also get pre-built email templates which you can further design with the drag and drop email editor, without HTML.</p> \n<p>The tool also features a heatmap report for different types of campaigns to give you a quick visual overview of which CTAs are working and which links people are clicking.</p> \n<h4>SendX Price</h4> \n<p>SendX’s pricing is based on the number of subscribers you have. For 1,000 subscribers, <a href=\"https://www.sendx.io/pricing\">plans</a> start at $7.49 per month for the annual subscription (or $9.99 for a monthly subscription). They also offer a 14-day free trial.</p> \n<h3>7. Constant Contact</h3> \n<p>Best for creating email drip campaigns and easy-to-use templates.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Constant-Contact.jpg?width=1263&amp;name=Constant-Contact.jpg\" alt=\"Constant Contact email marketing platform\" width=\"1263\" style=\"width: 1263px;\"><a href=\"https://www.constantcontact.com/features/email-plus\">Constant Contact</a> is a popular email marketing service that works well for many industries.</p> \n<h4>Constant Contact Features</h4> \n<p>The service comes with over 100 email templates that you can either use as-is or customize. Once your email looks good, you can easily schedule it to send to your contacts at any time you choose.</p> \n<p>In addition to drip email campaigns, you can also have emails go out at a regular cadence to celebrate specific events — for example, you could have a regular email go out on each customer's birthday.</p> \n<p>Once an email contact list is uploaded, bounces and unsubscribes are automatically updated for you. Constant Contact also has \"Plus\" features that allow you to execute specific types of campaigns such as coupon offers, donation collections, or surveys.</p> \n<h4>Constant Contact Price</h4> \n<p>Constant Contact has <a href=\"https://www.constantcontact.com/pricing\">two plans</a> depending on the features you need that start at $20 and $45 per month. The price differentiation is related to your number of contacts. They offer a free trial so you can experiment with the service prior to committing to it.</p> \n<h3>8. Campaign Monitor</h3> \n<p>Best for building personalized emails.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Campaign-Monitor.jpg?width=1258&amp;name=Campaign-Monitor.jpg\" alt=\"Campaign Monitor email marketing platform\" width=\"1258\" style=\"width: 1258px;\"><a href=\"https://www.campaignmonitor.com/\">Campaign Monitor</a> prides itself on providing powerful, personalized email marketing tools that are simple and easy to use.</p> \n<h4>Campaign Monitor Features</h4> \n<p>Their drag-and-drop email editor is intuitive, and the included analytics make it simple to optimize your email strategy and create targeted customer segments.</p> \n<p>Personalization is key for campaign monitor. It uses data to increase personalized content and inform your list segmentation to boost your engagement. They also offer a visual marketing automation tool so you can create a unique customer journey at scale.</p> \n<p>Not to mention, Campaign monitor has an extensive <a href=\"https://www.campaignmonitor.com/resources/\">library of resources</a> available to help you become an email marketing pro.</p> \n<h4>Campaign Monitor Price</h4> \n<p>There are <a href=\"https://www.campaignmonitor.com/pricing/\">three major plans</a> you can choose from with Campaign Monitor ranging from $9 up to $149 per month. You can choose to pay annually rather than monthly and take advantage of the option to pay per campaign if that schedule works better for your needs.</p> \n<h3>9. iContact</h3> \n<p>Best for customer service and support.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/iContact.jpg?width=1255&amp;name=iContact.jpg\" alt=\"iContact email marketing platform\" width=\"1255\" style=\"width: 1255px;\"><a href=\"https://www.icontact.com/\">iContact</a> has been providing one of the top-choice email marketing services since 2003, as it has an easy-to-use email marketing tool that helps you and your team see results fast</p> \n<h4>iContact Features</h4> \n<p>While iContact doesn't necessarily stand out from competitors in terms of features, their customer support and service teams set them apart. Customers are paired with a strategic advisor to create an effective email marketing strategy right with the tool.</p> \n<p>They also have Social+ marketing consultants who help boost your entire online presence through creative social posts that drive traffic to your site.</p> \n<h4>iContact Price</h4> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.icontact.com/pricing/\">iContact </a>offers a free plan for up to 500 contacts, and an advanced plan starting at $20 per month.&nbsp; You can choose to pay monthly or annually depending on your needs.</p> \n<h3>10. MailChimp</h3> \n<p>Best for actionable data insights to improve your email marketing strategy.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Mailchimp.jpg?width=1264&amp;name=Mailchimp.jpg\" alt=\"Mailchimp email marketing platform\" width=\"1264\" style=\"width: 1264px;\">Over the years, <a href=\"https://mailchimp.com/\">MailChimp</a> has added landing pages and various ads tools to their capabilities but, their email marketing service remains their claim-to-fame.</p> \n<h4>MailChimp Features</h4> \n<p>MailChimp has millions of customers in over 175 countries and they use the data they collect off those customers to provide you with actionable insights to improve your email strategy. The tool is flexible enough for an enterprise company, yet simple enough for someone just getting started with their startup's email marketing strategy.</p> \n<p>Best of all, MailChimp has over 300 integrations that help you customize the tool to your business. By using these integrations to further personalize your marketing, you'll get the most out of your email strategy.</p> \n<h4>MailChimp Price</h4> \n<p>MailChimp has <a href=\"https://mailchimp.com/pricing/\">four plans</a> to choose from that range in price from free to $299 per month. Aside from the free plan, depending on the option you go with, your monthly payment increases with the number of contacts you have.</p> \n<h3>11. AWeber</h3> \n<p>Best for small businesses and entrepreneurs just starting to build their email lists.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/AWeber.jpg?width=1255&amp;name=AWeber.jpg\" alt=\"AWeber email marketing platform\" width=\"1255\" style=\"width: 1255px;\"><a href=\"https://www.aweber.com/\">Aweber</a> is an email platform built specifically for small businesses and entrepreneurs.</p> \n<h4>AWeber Features</h4> \n<p>The goal of AWeber is to make it simple for those who are just getting started with email marketing to segment their contacts, design a professional email, and start nurturing leads. Customers have praised AWeber for its deliverability — AWeber's deliverability team monitors their servers around the clock to ensure your campaign consistently reaches the' inboxes of your recipients.</p> \n<h4>Aweber Price</h4> \n<p>AWeber offers <a href=\"https://www.aweber.com/pricing.htm\">two plans</a>: free and pro. The AWeber Pro plan starts at $16.15 per month, and increases in price depending on the size of your list. You can also choose to pay on a quarterly or annual cycle if that's preferred over monthly billing.</p> \n<h3>12. ActiveCampaign</h3> \n<p>Best for segmentation and live chat options.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/ActiveCampaign.jpg?width=1253&amp;name=ActiveCampaign.jpg\" alt=\"ActiveCampaign\" width=\"1253\" style=\"width: 1253px;\"><a href=\"https://www.activecampaign.com\">ActiveCampaign</a> is a marketing automation platform that offers <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/crm/live-chat?_ga=2.262995208.567721879.1555430872-644648569.1551722047\">live chat</a> and a <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/crm?_ga=2.95719576.567721879.1555430872-644648569.1551722047\">CRM service</a> in addition to email marketing capabilities.</p> \n<h4>ActiveCampaign Features</h4> \n<p>By adding a CRM to their functionality, ActiveCampaign can help surface the right leads to your sales team using features like lead scoring. The service also allows you to share dynamic content in your emails — this allows you to provide different experiences to your contacts based on the way you segment them.</p> \n<h4>ActiveCampaign Price</h4> \n<p>ActiveCampaign has <a href=\"https://www.activecampaign.com/pricing/\">four plans</a> which you can choose to pay for monthly or annually. Their plans vary based on the number of contacts you have and range in price from $9 to $259. You can experiment with the service before buying it with a free trial, as well.</p> \n<h3>13. AutoPilot</h3> \n<p>Best for collaborative email marketing teams.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Autopilot.jpg?width=1263&amp;name=Autopilot.jpg\" alt=\"Autopilot email marketing platform\" width=\"1263\" style=\"width: 1263px;\"><a href=\"https://www.autopilothq.com/\">Autopilot</a> differentiates themselves from the competitors with their visual marketing tools.</p> \n<h4>AutoPilot Features</h4> \n<p>Everything from AutoPilot's email editor to their automation tool is set up to work via a drag-and-drop interface, making the system intuitive and easy to use.</p> \n<p>AutoPilot offers collaborative tools to help your team work together effectively — it allows you to quickly share your work with your team, ensuring everyone is on the same page before you launch a campaign. And with the \"annotate &amp; collaborate\" feature, you can quickly mark-up a customer journey and ask your team for feedback and assistance.</p> \n<h4>AutoPilot Price</h4> \n<p>AutoPilot offers <a href=\"https://www.autopilothq.com/pricing\">three plans</a> which range in price between $49 and $249 that vary based on your number of contacts. There are three types of billing cycles including monthly, monthly with an annual commitment, and annual.</p> \n<h3>14. GetResponse</h3> \n<p>Best for global email marketing audiences.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/GetResponse.jpg?width=1258&amp;name=GetResponse.jpg\" alt=\"GetResponse email marketing platform\" width=\"1258\" style=\"width: 1258px;\"><a href=\"https://www.getresponse.com/\">GetResponse</a> is a marketing automation service that's available in over 20 languages.</p> \n<h4>GetResponse Features</h4> \n<p>On top of email marketing and automation, GetResponse also offers a CRM, landing pages, and a complete webinar solution.</p> \n<p>The service offers over 500 templates to help you get started with email marketing and integrates with Shutterstock, giving you access to a creative library at your fingertips. Also, their drip campaign tool is managed through a calendar interface, allowing you to see exactly when you will be reaching out to your leads.</p> \n<h4>GetResponse Price</h4> \n<p>There are <a href=\"https://secure.getresponse.com/pricing/en\">four GetResponse plans</a> that you can choose from ranging in price from $15 to $99 per month (plus a customized enterprise-level option that requires you to reach out for a quote). Pricing varies based on your list size and you can pay monthly or annually. Each plan offers a free trial so you can test out the service before investing.</p> \n<h3>15. Ontraport</h3> \n<p>Best for creating detailed email marketing campaigns.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Ontraport.jpg?width=1265&amp;name=Ontraport.jpg\" alt=\"Ontraport email marketing platform\" width=\"1265\" style=\"width: 1265px;\"><a href=\"https://ontraport.com/\">Ontraport</a> offers a full suite of marketing automation tools including ecommerce functionality for businesses with online stores.</p> \n<h4>Ontraport Features</h4> \n<p>Ontraport's visual campaign builder allows you to create detailed campaigns to engage your audience. You can create a campaign from scratch or tap into the marketplace where they offer dozens of the most common marketing campaigns to choose from, including abandoned cart nurturing or webinar sign-up and follow-up.</p> \n<p>The service also provides insight into detailed reports so you can gain insight into your pipeline, traffic sources, and conversion timelines.</p> \n<h4>Ontraport Price</h4> \n<p>Ontraport offers <a href=\"https://ontraport.com/pricing\">four plans</a> that range in price between $79 and $497 per month. No matter which plan you choose, you'll receive one-on-one onboarding. The plans differ in price based on your number of contacts. You can cancel your monthly plan at any time and if you choose to pay annually, you'll benefit from a discount.</p> \n<h3>16. Flodesk</h3> \n<p>Best for creating visually appealing emails and landing pages from easy-to-use templates.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Flodesk.jpg?width=1252&amp;name=Flodesk.jpg\" alt=\"Flodesk email marketing platform\" width=\"1252\" style=\"width: 1252px;\"></p> \n<p><a href=\"https://flodesk.com/\">Flodesk</a> is an affordable email provider that makes creating beautiful branded emails simple and easy.</p> \n<h4>Flodesk Features</h4> \n<p>Flodesk’s email building tools are intuitive and easy to use for beginners and email marketing experts alike. For those with creative businesses or strong visual brands, Flodesk works like a design tool to craft on-brand emails and landing pages.</p> \n<p>Flodesk also offers tagging and workflow options that make creating email automations a straightforward process, and integrations with tools such as Zapier and Shopify to streamline the different areas of your business.</p> \n<h4>Flodesk Price</h4> \n<p>Flodesk offers one plan with unlimited emails and contacts for a flat fee of <a href=\"https://flodesk.com/pricing.html\"><span>$38 per month</span></a>. For annual subscribers, Flodesk costs $418 per year. Users can try Flodesk for free for 30 days.</p> \n<h2>Choose Your Email Marketing Service</h2> \n<p>Most email marketing tools offer the essentials needed to craft a basic email newsletter, but there are fewer options if you want a range of top-notch features such as complete customization, available support, <em>and</em> data analysis.</p> \n<p>Not to mention, as a marketer, you might want to consider combining your <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/email\">email marketing service</a> with a <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/crm\">CRM</a> to give you even greater functionality that can impact your email marketing as well as other marketing sales, and service efforts. But. ultimately, the best email marketing tool for you depends on your team's goals and particular needs — so, review the options above as well as the services' product and pricing pages to get started.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in April, 2019 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\"
