16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"Everything You Need to Know About Brand Experience","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/brand-experience","description":"<p>Online sales are reaching all-time highs as buyers become more comfortable with digital transactions — in 2021, for example, consumers spent a collective <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/shelleykohan/2021/11/27/online-sales-for-thanksgiving-and-black-friday-reach-14-billion/\">$14 billion online</a> across Black Friday and Cyber Monday.</p> \n<p>For businesses, the shift to online-first purchasing offers substantive potential, but also underpins prospective problems: As the number of digital product offerings ramps up, competition for customer conversions is also on the rise.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=814dd420-0d49-40e0-b59c-f01066e186c1&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Download Now: Free Brand Building Guide\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/814dd420-0d49-40e0-b59c-f01066e186c1.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p>The result? A battlefield for brand experience. If companies can create a lasting positive impression among potential customers, they can drive sales and set the stage for long-term loyalty. But what exactly is brand experience? What does effective design require and what does it look like in practice? Most importantly, how do brands create experience strategies that deliver reliable results over time?</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>Brand experience describes the tangible and emotional experience consumers have while interacting with your brand. Think of it as a holistic approach that combines elements of user experience, customer experience, and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/agency/develop-brand-identity\">brand identity</a> all in one.</p> \n<p>Brand experience encompasses all the feelings consumers have before, during, and after interacting with your brand. Take <a href=\"https://www.nestle.com/brands/allbrands/toll-house\">Nestlé Toll House</a> for example. When most people think of them, they think of cookies. You may even remember baking cookies using Toll House chocolate chips, the smell as they baked, and finally, savoring every last bite. You may even associate the brand with moments of bonding with family as you baked cookies together.</p> \n<p>In this case, the Toll House brand experience has moved beyond just the consumption of chocolate chips. It’s an emotional connection built over time with consumers and how their products integrate into the lives of the people who buy them.</p> \n<p>While brand experience is similar to user experience, it encompasses a broader perception of your brand at large. Where user experience speaks to the takeaways — positive or negative — of a user when they interact with your website or social media profiles, brand experience refers to the impression of your brand as a whole. Not surprisingly, positive user experiences inform better brand experiences (and vice versa) but the two are distinct concepts.</p> \n<p>It’s also important to understand that brand experience is subjective. While it’s possible to create experiences that produce reactions along a generalized spectrum, individual users will have different reactions to your efforts. In practice, this means that no matter how carefully you curate brand experience efforts, there will always be customers who come away with a negative reaction. As a result, the goal isn’t to create a universal experience but rather to create one that resonates positively with the largest number of target customers.</p> \n<h2>Breaking Down Brand Experience Design</h2> \n<p>Just <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/sap/2021/04/26/brand-experience-what-does-it-mean-and-how-can-it-be-your-differentiator/\">39%</a> of business decision-makers say their brand effectively resonates with prospective buyers. This is a problem: If customers don’t connect your brand with positive thoughts, feelings, and reactions, they’re less likely to remember your products and services when it comes time to make a purchase.</p> \n<p>Worth noting? Neutrality isn’t enough. While negative impressions of your brand can drive customers away from your site, neutral impressions are just as problematic — even if consumers see your brand listed in search engine results or advertised online, the absence of a positive brand impression means they won’t seek you out over companies that offer better connective messaging.</p> \n<p>So what does effective brand experience design look like? Four components are critical:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Brand%20Experience.jpg?width=650&amp;name=Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Brand%20Experience.jpg\" alt=\"Brand Experience vs. Customer Experience\" width=\"650\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 650px;\"></p> \n<h3>Perception</h3> \n<p>Perception forms a key part of the experience. This includes audio, visual, and tactical interactions that allow customers to connect a specific sense to advertising campaigns. In much the same way that particular smells can bring back memories of childhood experiences, brands that successfully merge senses with marketing can create connections that drive sales.</p> \n<h3>Participation</h3> \n<p>It’s also more likely that customers will walk away with a positive brand experience if they’re able to participate in some way rather than simply watch. This might include the ability to submit suggestions online or interact in real-time online question forums, or it could feature the use of physical installations that allow consumers to touch your product or provide direct feedback.</p> \n<h3>Personalization</h3> \n<p>Generic marketing campaigns can produce steady returns, but personalization can help encourage connection across different customer segments. By leveraging both user-provided data (with their consent) along with social media interactions and other engagement data, it’s possible to create more personalized efforts that help create connections between consumer needs and current product offerings.</p> \n<h3>Prioritization</h3> \n<p>Brand experience can’t be all things to all people. Attempts to capture every consumer in every circumstance actually undermine experience-driven efforts — as a result, it’s worth selecting specific brand metrics such as positive social mentions or repeat purchases to prioritize.</p> \n<h2>Creating a Brand Experience Strategy</h2> \n<p>So how do you build an effective brand experience strategy?</p> \n<h3>1. Assess whether or not you’re meeting customer expectations.</h3> \n<p>First up is identifying areas where your current experience isn’t meeting customer expectations. Social media interactions and customer service calls can help pinpoint potential problems — if consistent concerns around brand interaction or reaction arise, this can help frame the foundation of brand experience strategy.</p> \n<h3>2. Identify areas for improvement.</h3> \n<p>Next is targeting an area for improvement. While there may be more than one aspect of brand experience that could use a refresh or redesign, attempting to do everything at once can spread strategy efforts too thin and deliver less-than-ideal results. For example, you might choose to increase positive social mentions across specific channels such as Facebook or Instagram. While the eventual goal could be a larger social impact from initial contact to eventual conversion, easily-accessible social platforms provide an ideal starting point.</p> \n<h3>3. Measure your results.</h3> \n<p>Effective measurement follows to ensure efforts are bearing fruit. In the case of our social media example above, this means tracking user views, reactions, and responses to social media posts along with the sentiment — positive, negative, or neutral — that goes along with them. This is also the time to explore and innovate by testing multiple strategies to see which one sticks. From video campaigns to personalized storytelling to marketing efforts all designed to elicit specific emotions, it’s worth finding that resonates with your customer base and then fine-tuning your efforts to deliver ideal outcomes.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>It’s one thing to talk about brand experience building, but it’s another to see it in action. Here’s a look at five brand experiences efforts that offer effective in-practice examples.</p> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://www.apple.com/\">Apple</a></h3> \n<a class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\"></a>\n<a style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.5%; margin: 0px;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"position: relative; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: auto; border: none; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 650px; max-height: 367px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n  <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.46%; margin: 0;\">\n   <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/pJIKPzZTJXM?feature=oembed\" width=\"650\" height=\"367\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n  </div> \n </div> </a> \n<p>One of the reasons Apple has such a devoted customer base is because of the brand experience they’ve created. From ads to Apple stores to the packaging of their products — all touch points work together to create a cohesive brand experience that highlights innovation, style, and functionality.</p> \n<p>Their products are cool, sleek, and user-friendly, all attributes highly coveted by Apple’s fans. Even their product announcements have become anticipated events. Apple is a pro at conquering the four \"Ps\" of brand experience (perception, participation, personalization, and prioritization) and incorporating them in all messaging. This helps Apple stay top of mind for consumers whether they’re in the market to buy or not. It’s not a smart phone, it’s an iPhone. It’s not a laptop, it’s a MacBook.</p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://youtu.be/FHtvDA0W34I\">Red Bull</a></h3> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"position: relative; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: auto; border: none; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 650px; max-height: 365px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.15%; margin: 0;\">\n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/FHtvDA0W34I\" width=\"650\" height=\"365\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n </div> \n</div> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<p>In 2012, the company went all-in on its tagline “Red Bull gives you wings by sending skydiver Alex Baumgartner 24 miles above the Earth’s surface to pull off the highest skydive ever recorded and become the first person to break the sound barrier during freefall.</p> \n<p>While his record was broken two years later by an executive from Google, it doesn’t change the fact that Red Bull did something no one had ever done before and created a unique brand experience that aligned with its core marketing message.</p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://youtu.be/RrftWVessAw\">Cadbury India</a></h3> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"position: relative; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: auto; border: none; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 650px; max-height: 365px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.15%; margin: 0;\">\n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/RrftWVessAw\" width=\"650\" height=\"365\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n </div> \n</div> \n<p>Cadbury India opted for consumer suggestions in creating their new chocolate bar flavor. Customers were encouraged to visit the company’s dedicated chocolate bar platform that let them select ingredients and create a recipe. Cadbury then tried all suggested recipes and selected the best of those submitted.</p> \n<p>By prioritizing interaction over simple reaction, Cadbury facilitated consumer connection and encouraged customers to view chocolate bar making as a collaborative effort rather than a corporate endeavor, in turn creating a community-based brand experience.</p> \n<h3>4. <a href=\"https://www.nike.com/\">Nike</a></h3> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"position: relative; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: auto; border: none; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 650px; max-height: 365px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.15%; margin: 0;\">\n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/fUldMpGbBdA\" width=\"650\" height=\"365\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n </div> \n</div> \n<p>Similarly to Cadbury, Nike found that giving customers more control over their products was a win. <a href=\"https://www.nike.com/nike-by-you\">Nike By You</a> allows customers to customize their favorite Nike kicks online using various color and style combinations.</p> \n<p>Their flagship store in NYC’s SoHo boasts a sneaker bar where customers can customize their shoes in person with dip-dyeing, patches, and accessories. This emphasis on customization and personalization allows Nike to fully integrate into their customers' lives, creating a brand experience that lasts long after they’ve made a purchase.</p> \n<h3>5. <a href=\"https://youtu.be/eaB8XkpHd64\">Lean Cuisine</a></h3> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"position: relative; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: auto; border: none; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 650px; max-height: 365px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.15%; margin: 0;\">\n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/eaB8XkpHd64\" width=\"650\" height=\"365\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n </div> \n</div> \n<p>While healthy eating has taken off in recent years, messaging around this effort is often the opposite. With a focus on weight loss instead of overall health, many brands find themselves reinforcing harmful stereotypes that equate weight loss with personal worth.</p> \n<p>Lean Cuisine’s #WeighThis campaign looked to change the narrative by placing “scales” around New York’s Grand Central Station that encouraged women to “weigh in”.</p> \n<p>The catch? These scales were actually boards that let women write down how they would prefer to be measured — such as by their own persistence, accomplishments or efforts.</p> \n<p>Even better? Lean Cuisine marketers were smart enough to stay out of the way. There were no samples on offer, no surveys to fill out; women simply saw the scales and interacted with them, in turn boosting Lean Cuisine’s overall brand experience.</p> \n<h3>6. <a href=\"https://youtu.be/wpM499XhMJQ\">Dove</a></h3> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"position: relative; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: auto; border: none; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 650px; max-height: 488px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 75.08%; margin: 0;\">\n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/wpM499XhMJQ\" width=\"650\" height=\"488\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n </div> \n</div> \n<p>Dove’s Campaign for Real Beauty took a similar approach to Lean Cuisine but opted for the use of viral video that highlighted beauty of all types — beauty that goes beyond photoshoots and photoshop. The campaign earned praise for both its authenticity and efforts to help boost self-esteem among young girls.</p> \n<p>By choosing emotional experience over a simple sales effort, Dove was able to better connect with its target customer base and boost overall customer loyalty.</p> \n<h3>7. <a href=\"https://www.zillow.com/\">Zillow</a></h3> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"position: relative; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: auto; border: none; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 650px; max-height: 365px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.15%; margin: 0;\">\n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/fWOY9-X5mSg\" width=\"650\" height=\"365\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n </div> \n</div> \n<p>Zillow’s “To Move is to Grow” campaign tapped into 2021’s pandemic house hunting frenzy. As people started remote work, folks realized that they didn’t need to live in crowded cities, and browsing the home search site quickly became a common pastime, which <a href=\"https://youtu.be/yEfsaXDX0UQ\">Saturday Night Live</a> hilariously highlighted in one of its skits that year.</p> \n<p>Tugging at our heartstrings, Zillow tackled the emotional rollercoaster of moving. Using an aesthetic reminiscent of <a href=\"https://www.warnerbros.com/movies/where-wild-things-are\"><em>Where the Wild Things Are</em></a>, the first commercial showcases a child unsure about what her moving adventure will bring. The second one hones in on a seller’s perspective. Susan, the main character, is faced with a host of doppelgangers that try to influence her decision.</p> \n<p>With many across the globe feeling like their lives were in flux, Zillow was able to create a brand experience that showed empathy with their customers as they navigated their new normal during a pandemic. It also positioned the brand as a reliable guide to assist with their transition, whether buying or selling.</p> \n<h3>8.<a href=\"https://youtu.be/OSYhPIAIU9o\"> WestJet</a></h3> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"position: relative; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: auto; border: none; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 650px; max-height: 367px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.46%; margin: 0;\">\n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/OSYhPIAIU9o\" width=\"650\" height=\"367\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n </div> \n</div> \n<p>Canadian commercial airline WestJet has been running its “Christmas Miracle” campaign since 2013. Its 2021 version sees the company asking people what they miss the most during the holidays — not surprisingly, many mention absent family members. WestJet staff then provide plane tickets to help loved ones reconnect, and the end of the video features a tearful reunion in progress.</p> \n<p>Overall, it’s a feel-good experience designed to bring out emotions already close to the surface for many customers and in turn, boost the overall brand experience.</p> \n<h2>Building a Better Brand Experience</h2> \n<p>The right brand experience makes all the difference when it comes to cultivating long-term customer relationships. By understanding where current efforts don’t deliver, prioritizing areas for improvement, and tracking engagement metrics over time, it’s possible to build a brand experience that boosts customer connection and encourages long-term loyalty.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in February 2016 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=ddbf2eb7-04e8-44b2-9e05-b21264e09b65&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"brand consistency\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/ddbf2eb7-04e8-44b2-9e05-b21264e09b65.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fbrand-experience&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 10 Mar 2022 12:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/814dd420-0d49-40e0-b59c-f01066e186c1.png","linkMd5":"25b8724829410ff484ff4f980aa01943","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn32@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-48-558_eac7fa40866dc905.webp","destWidth":382,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":4555,"destBytes":6088,"author":"Doug Bonderud","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/814dd420-0d49-40e0-b59c-f01066e186c1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn32@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-48-558_eac7fa40866dc905.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Brand%20Experience.jpg?width=650&name=Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Brand%20Experience.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn5@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-55-071_e3b7fe945edb1991.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/ddbf2eb7-04e8-44b2-9e05-b21264e09b65.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn81@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-50-164_f4156d3bc1379fd0.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fbrand-experience&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn35@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-56-808_7523cd1b4a8ce620.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246408187},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"29 Free Resume Templates for Microsoft Word (& How to Make Your Own)","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/resume-templates-word","description":"<p>No matter what industry you work in (or your experience level in that industry), a plain, black-and-white resume written in Times New Roman font just doesn't quite cut it anymore.</p>  \n<p>But just because resumes have gotten more creative doesn’t mean you need special design software to make your application stand out. On the contrary, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-write-a-resume\">writing your resume</a> in good old Microsoft Word is still the perfect way to develop your personal brand, while also communicating your experience and career goals.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=4ec95757-585e-40cf-9189-6b3885074e98&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"→ Download Now: 12 Resume Templates [Free Download]\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/4ec95757-585e-40cf-9189-6b3885074e98.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p>Read on to find out how to make your resume in word, then download one of these amazing resume templates that open directly in Microsoft Word.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-resume-templates?hubs_post-cta=image\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Resume%20Template%201.jpg?width=1500&amp;name=Resume%20Template%201.jpg\" alt=\"free editable resume pdf template\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></a><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-resume-templates?hubs_post-cta=images\"></a></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-resume-templates\"><em>Download 12 free, editable resume templates.</em></a></p> \n<h3>1. Open Microsoft Word on your computer.</h3> \n<p>If you have Microsoft Word installed on your computer, open the program and let it load for a moment. There will be a couple of helpful options waiting for you on the first screen, specifically for resume creation.</p> \n<h3>2. Select either \"Basic Resume\" or \"Bold Resume\" from the template menu.</h3> \n<p>Once you've launched MS Word, a window of templates will appear. Scroll down until you see the template options designed for resumes — there will be at least two of them. Double-click the one that suits your style and personal brand, but don't be too particular about design just yet ... you can customize these templates quite a bit.</p> \n<h3>3. Fill in your name and contact information at the top.</h3> \n<p>When your resume template opens, you'll see placeholder text for each line of your resume, starting with your first and last name at the top. Delete this header text and enter your name, as well as any contact information by which you want the recruiter to contact you.</p> \n<h3>4. Draft a brief summary of your experience and goals.</h3> \n<p>Use the first line below your name and contact info to describe who you are, what you do, and what you're looking for in your career.</p> \n<h3>5. Enter your school and latest education.</h3> \n<p>List any relevant degrees or certificates you received through schooling. You can safely exclude secondary education if you've graduated from an accredited college.</p> \n<h3>6. Describe each job you've held using the lines prompted on the template.</h3> \n<p>Your professional experience is frequently the most important section of your resume, so feel free to rank this section <em>above</em> your skills and education, depending on how many jobs you previously held.</p> \n<h3>7. List all relevant skills.</h3> \n<p>If you have experience in certain software, exercises, problem-solving, or management techniques, use them to populate your skills. Your resume's \"Skills\" section helps reveal what all of your previous jobs or related experiences have in common, based on what they taught you and what you provided them.</p> \n<h3>8. Describe any relevant accolades and accomplishments.</h3> \n<p>Finish out your resume with any personal accomplishments or accolades you think a hiring manager in your industry would appreciate. Although this section shouldn't include a <em>Most Improved</em> recognition from little league, for example, it should definitely include your <em>Marketer of the Month</em> award from your last position.</p> \n<p>Next, let’s cover <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-format-resume\">how to format your brand-new resume</a> in Word.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h2>How To Format a Resume in Word</h2> \n<p>When formatting a resume in Word, it’s important to know the right style. We’ll go over it piece by piece.</p> \n<h3>Set the Right Margins and Font Size</h3> \n<p>Your resume should contain one-inch margins on all sides. Most documents will automatically have one-inch margins, but it’s best to double-check or create them yourself. Here’s how to create one-inch margins for your resume:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Go to “Layout.”</li> \n <li>Click “Margins.”</li> \n <li>Click the “Normal” setting, where it states 1” on the top, bottom, left, and right sides of the document.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Lastly, make sure your font size is 12-pt. This font size is standard for most resumes. However, if you have a particularly long CV, you could potentially get away with an 11-pt font size to fit it all on one page.</p> \n<h3>Create Headers</h3> \n<p>You should separate each section (i.e., education, work experience) with a header.</p> \n<p>Create a header in Word by selecting “Styles”. You can use “Header 1” for your first and last name at the top of the page. “Header 2” is great for the “Education” section, “Work Experience” section, and “Skills” section. Use “Header 3” for employer names and job titles, and use normal text to fill in the details of your accomplishments, skills, and educational background.</p> \n<h3>Create Dividers</h3> \n<p>If you want to visually divide your resume into different parts, you can create dividers to split up the information and make your resume more scannable. Here’s how to add dividers:</p> \n<p>Go to “Insert”, select “Illustrations,” and then click “Shapes”. You can select “Lines” to draw a line in Word. Another shortcut to create dividers is pressing the “=”, “_”, or and “*” three times and hitting enter. These give a variation of dividers that can add dimension to your resume.</p> \n<h3>Create Bullet Points</h3> \n<p>The truth is, no hiring manager will read a paragraph of information, so we recommend using bullets instead to list your accomplishments and responsibilities underneath your job titles. When you open “Paragraph,” you’ll see a variation of bullet points you can use. Choose the one you like best.</p> \n<p>Sometimes, you might not have time to create and format a resume from scratch. Plus, if you’re already employed full-time, it’s hard to find the time to apply to a new job opportunity, let alone update your resume to reflect your qualifications.</p> \n<p>Luckily, there are numerous publishers out there who've created incredible resume templates for quick editing and formatting in Word.</p> \n<p>You can also find resume templates directly in Word, which we’ll go over next.</p> \n<p>To keep you from hunting the internet for resume templates that are both free and compatible with MS Word, we’ve listed some options below for you to customize with your own information right now.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Some of them come with variations so you can pick your favorite design. A few of them cater specifically to marketers.</p> \n<h2>Free Resume Template Downloads for Word</h2> \n<h3>1. You can also add in notes of your accomplishments, relevant skills, and qualifications for the job.</p> \n<h3>20. CV Resume Template</h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/cv-resume-template.png?width=415&amp;name=cv-resume-template.png\" width=\"415\" style=\"width: 415px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" alt=\"resume templates for word: Reverse two-column resume template\"></p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://www.freesumes.com/unconventional-cv-template-giveaway-avant-garde/\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p>The curriculum vitae-style resume below flips the typical two-column resume so the basic applicant information is listed across the right side, rather than the left.</p> \n<p>Feel free to change the color of this sidebar in Microsoft Word if dark-red isn't your thing — the template can pull off any color you wish.</p> \n<h4>Recommended For: Graduate Candidates</h4> \n<p>If you are a graduate student entering the workforce, having a CV-style resume will demonstrate the depth of your knowledge first and showcase how your continued education will contribute to your future work environment.</p> \n<h3>21. Goldenrod Resume Template</h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/goldenrod%20resume%20template-1.jpg?width=650&amp;name=goldenrod%20resume%20template-1.jpg\" alt=\"resume templates for word: Goldenrod yellow resume template \" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://www.freesumes.com/goldenrod-yellow-a-free-clean-word-resume-template/\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p>This template, also offered on Freesumes, dares to use yellow as the dominant color — but doesn’t sacrifice professionalism in the process.</p> \n<p>The document anchors the education section to a thick, bright banner across the bottom, but you can likely change this to a skills section with some simple editing in Microsoft Word.</p> \n<h4>Recommended For: Architects</h4> \n<p>This clean-cut design represents a candidate who is all about precision. This template would serve candidates who have experience in architecture or construction.</p> \n<h3>22. Resume Template With Personal Endorsements</h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/resume%20template%20with%20personal%20endorsements-2.png?width=415&amp;name=resume%20template%20with%20personal%20endorsements-2.png\" width=\"415\" style=\"width: 415px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" alt=\"resume templates for word: Photographer's resume template\"></p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://www.hloom.com/get/personal+endorsements/\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p>This resume template has quite a flashy header — no photography pun intended — but it’s not just for photographers. What makes this resume unique is the space for references on the lower right-hand side.</p> \n<p>Does your field need others to vouch for your experience? This resume gives you room for three solid recommendations.</p> \n<h4>Recommended For: Brand Marketers or Personal Influencers</h4> \n<p>If you work in branding or have a large social media following, you can demonstrate your ability to create a cohesive message with this resume template. Feel free to change the color scheme to suit your brand.</p> \n<h3>23. Creative Resume Template</h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/creative%20resume%20template-1.png?width=1500&amp;name=creative%20resume%20template-1.png\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" alt=\"resume templates for word: creative resume template \"></p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://templates.office.com/en-us/Creative-resume-designed-by-MOO-TM16392718\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p>This one was designed by the stationery experts at MOO and is offered for download by Microsoft. Simple but vibrant, this template hugs the text with an artistic header and footer — great for recent graduates who need to fill empty space on the page.</p> \n<h4>Recommended For: Photographers and Other Creatives</h4> \n<p>If you are a photographer who does freelance work, this is a great template to showcase your experience. This will give your hiring manager or client an excellent first impression because it showcases your creative ability without sacrificing the important elements — your accomplishments.</p> \n<h3>24. Modern Resume Template</h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202019-10-03%20at%202.05.44%20PM.jpg?width=415&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202019-10-03%20at%202.05.44%20PM.jpg\" alt=\"resume templates for word: Modern Resume Template\" width=\"415\" style=\"width: 415px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://www.livecareer.com/build-resume/section/cntc?templateflow=contact&amp;skin=MLT6&amp;theme=%2339c3b1\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p>This resume embraces simplicity with a slight touch of color to make things a bit more interesting. It also nicely sections off Skills and Education notes from the Work History list.</p> \n<p>With LiveCareer.com, you can generate a template with your basic information and then download it to add small details.</p> \n<h4>Recommended For: Young Professionals</h4> \n<p>This resume gives a modern twist on the resume. It’s perfect for those looking for a fresher look than the traditional resume.</p> \n<h3>25. Functional Resume Template</h3> \n<h3><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/functional-resume-template.jpg?width=415&amp;name=functional-resume-template.jpg\" alt=\"resume templates for word: functional resume template\" width=\"415\" style=\"width: 415px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></h3> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://novoresume.com/editor/new-resume-preview/1?pageAuthDesired=/editor/new-resume/1\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p>This NovoResume.com template is colorful and includes a place for your headshot which could make you look both interesting and confident to an employer.</p> \n<h4>Recommended For: Media Professionals</h4> \n<p>A colorful format like this one might be great for a media or advertising professional who wants to keep their job application visually memorable to prospective employers.</p> \n<h3>26. Elegant Resume Template</h3> \n<h3><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202019-10-03%20at%202.23.03%20PM.png?width=415&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202019-10-03%20at%202.23.03%20PM.png\" alt=\"resume templates for word: elegant resume template\" width=\"415\" style=\"width: 415px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></h3> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://jofibo.com/resume-templates/\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p>If you're looking for simplicity and efficiency rather than something colorful, consider this Elegant Resume Template from Jofibo.</p> \n<p>With Jofibo, you can select this or other similar templates on the website, enter your information, and then download it quickly and easily.</p> \n<h4>Recommended For: Marketing Candidates</h4> \n<p>If you are a mid-level marketing candidate, use this fun template to showcase all of your expertise and accomplishments. It’s an eye-catching template that displays your creativity and ability to engage.</p> \n<h3>27. Blue Corporate HR Resume Template</h3> \n<h3><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/canva-blue-corporate-hr-professional-resume-MADftnj-Tj4%20(1).jpg?width=415&amp;name=canva-blue-corporate-hr-professional-resume-MADftnj-Tj4%20(1).jpg\" alt=\"resume templates for word: corporate hr professional resume\" width=\"415\" style=\"width: 415px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></h3> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://www.canva.com/templates/MADftnj-Tj4-blue-corporate-hr-professional-resume/\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p>Canva, an easy-to-use design template website, offers a few great resume templates. One of them is this simple resume with a touch of color in the background.</p> \n<p>Because of the color and image, it's pretty memorable. But, for those who prefer a more conservative resume look, this template is fairly simple.</p> \n<h4>Recommended For: Corporate Candidates</h4> \n<p>This template is great for senior executives and accomplished candidates moving into a high-rank position. This layout allows you to fit plenty of accomplishments, and the conservative look organizes the fullness of your career neatly.</p> \n<h3>28. Concept Resume</h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202019-10-03%20at%202.36.46%20PM.png?width=450&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202019-10-03%20at%202.36.46%20PM.png\" alt=\"resume templates for word: Concept Resume Template\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://resumelab.com/resume-templates\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p>This resume is perfect for displaying a clear timeline of your career history. It’s ideal for a seasoned professional who may have a lot of experience and wants to display it on one to two pages.</p> \n<p>The template also allows you to highlight your competency level in various areas, giving the recruiter an easy way to spot your expertise.</p> \n<h4>Recommended For: Candidates in the Tech Industry</h4> \n<p>This resume is great for people in the technical space because it adds a touch of color and feels more compact, which will allow you to get right to the point about your key skills, certifications, and work experiences.</p> \n<h3>29. Cream and Green Resume Template</h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://marketplace.canva.com/MADk-BomAYs/1/0/thumbnail_large/canva-cream-and-green-flat-design-account-executive-business-commercial-resume-MADk-BomAYs.jpg\" alt=\"resume templates for word: Cream and Green Resume Template\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download or edit the resume template <a href=\"https://www.canva.com/templates/MADk-BomAYs-cream-and-green-flat-design-account-executive-business-commercial-resume/\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p>This resume is also downloadable and editable on Canva. It was created for account executives but could also be great for graphic designers or people working in visual fields due to its unique, but still professional, color scheme.</p> \n<h4>Recommended For: Graphic Designers and Other Creatives</h4> \n<p>This colorful template gives designers and creatives the opportunity to showcase their talents on their resume. Utilize the colors as a basic layout, but feel free to use the resume’s design to showcase the way you would work on a future project. This would be a great reference point when you land an interview.</p> \n<h2>How to Save Your Resume</h2> \n<p>Remember, once you’ve finished personalizing your resume, you’re not ready to submit an application yet. To ensure your resume’s format stays the same for everyone who receives it, save the document as a PDF. Best case scenario? Even the hiring manager won’t believe your resume came from Word.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's Note: This post was originally published in 2018 but was updated in May 2020 for comprehensiveness.</em></p> 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"The 7 Best Leadpages Alternatives in 2022","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-leadpages-alternatives","description":"<p>It doesn't matter how awesome your e-book is if no one can download it.</p> \n<p>And you might have the perfect agenda for your webinar, but if your customers can’t sign up, it'll all be for nothing.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=5ff38c7a-c12b-48c8-bb6f-4f066754c979&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Learn More About HubSpot's Free Landing Page Builder\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/5ff38c7a-c12b-48c8-bb6f-4f066754c979.png\" align=\"middle\"></a>That's why you need an effective <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/landing-page-design\"><span>landing page</span></a>. They're simple pages — often with just a few lines of text and a form — to drive conversions and turn visitors into leads.</p> \n<p>When done correctly, a landing page can help you generate leads and pass off those qualified leads to your sales team.</p> \n<p>Here, we'll break down seven landing page builders and outline their costs, benefits, and drawbacks.</p> \n<h2>What is Leadpages?</h2> \n<p>One of the most popular tools for creating landing pages is Leadpages.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.leadpages.com/\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><span>Leadpages</span></a> offers a variety of tools that can help you create compelling landing pages — including pop-ups, a drag-and-drop page editor with a seemingly endless list of pre-made templates, and more.</p> \n<p>But Leadpages doesn't have a free version to help you get started, and doesn't offer many marketing tools beyond landing pages.</p> \n<p>If you're looking for an alternative to Leadpages, there are a number of different tools that you can explore.</p> \n<p>Let's take a look at the seven best Leadpages alternatives.</p> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/landing-pages\">HubSpot's Landing Page Builder</a></h3> \n<p>HubSpot's landing page builder helps you build beautiful landing pages that fit seamlessly into your marketing campaigns.</p> \n<p>The drag-and-drop page editor is easy to use, and comes with a variety of templates for a number of different content offer types.</p> \n<p>It includes all of the modules you'd expect, like a rich text module and a forms module, but it also has a video module and a meetings module, so your prospects can book meetings with your sales team directly on your landing pages.</p> \n<div>\n <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/landing-pages?hubs_post-cta=image\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%207%20Best%20Leadpages%20Alternatives%20in%202020-3.png\" alt=\"\"></a>\n</div> \n<p><strong>Price:</strong><span style=\"font-weight: normal;\"> Free</span></p> \n<p><strong>Pros:</strong> HubSpot's landing page builder is available for free and comes with the <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/crm?hubs_post=blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-leadpages-alternatives&amp;hubs_post-cta=HubSpot%20CRM\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><span>HubSpot CRM</span></a>.</p> \n<p>With the CRM, you can track every interaction your prospects have with your brand, allowing you to create marketing campaigns that focus on the end-to-end customer experience. And with <a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><span>HubSpot Academy</span></a>, you'll be able to learn how to effectively run a marketing campaign and easily apply those learnings to the next campaign you run.</p> \n<p>As you grow your business, HubSpot's landing page builder grows with you. You'll be able to run machine-learning powered tests on your landing pages to ensure you're constantly optimizing your pages for conversions, and revenue attribution reporting shows you exactly which offers are impacting your bottom line.</p> \n<p><strong>Cons:</strong> If you’re looking for more advanced features to help scale your marketing operations, you may need to upgrade to HubSpot's <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/pricing/marketing?hubs_content=www.hubspot.com%2Fproducts%2Fmarketing%2Flanding-pages&amp;hubs_content-cta=Starter%2C+Professional%2C+and+Enterprise+editions&amp;hubs_post=blog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing%252Fbest-leadpages-alternatives&amp;hubs_post-cta=HubSpot%2527s%2520Landing%2520Page%2520Builder\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><span>Starter, Professional, and Enterprise </span></a>plans of Marketing Hub.</p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://unbounce.com/\">Unbounce</a></h3> \n<p>Unbounce is one of the most popular landing page builders on the market today.</p> \n<p>They provide landing pages and pop-ups geared at turning traffic into revenue for your business. Unbounce comes with over 100 templates that you can easily customize in their drag-and-drop editor. All their templates also work with WordPress.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/unbounce.webp\" alt=\"unbounce\" width=\"1280\" style=\"width: 1280px;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://unbounce.com/landing-page-templates/\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p><strong><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">Price:</span></strong><span style=\"color: #33475b;\"> $90/month</span></p> \n<p><strong><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">Pros:</span></strong><span style=\"color: #33475b;\"> With Unbounce, you never </span><span style=\"color: #303030;\">start from a blank page. Powered by AI, its Smart Builder pulls data from over 1.5 billion conversions — helping you to predict which layouts and headlines will work best for your target audience.</span></p> \n<p><strong><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">Cons:</span></strong><span style=\"color: #33475b;\"> Although powerful, Unbounce charges you based on the number of conversions you receive on your pages. For growing companies, this can add up quickly as you generate more leads from your content offers.</span></p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://instapage.com/\">Instapage</a></h3> \n<p>Like the other landing page builders on this list, Instapage offers an easy-to-use content editor, and a number of templates to create your pages.</p> \n<p>Instapage also includes a feature called AdMap. With AdMap, you'll be able to visualize how your ads match your landing pages, and report on the effectiveness of your ad campaigns personalization.</p> \n<p>Their landing page solution also lets you leave comments on different elements of a landing page and @mention team members of yours, making it easy to collaborate on your marketing campaigns.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/instapage.png?width=1665&amp;name=instapage.png\" alt=\"instapage\" width=\"1665\" style=\"width: 1665px;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://instapage.com/\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p><strong>Price:</strong> $199/month</p> \n<p><strong>Pros:</strong> Instapages is one of the few landing page builders with built-in collaboration. We also like its<span style=\"color: #45536b;\"> 500+ layouts and near-instant page loads — with or without AMP.</span></p> \n<p><strong>Cons:</strong> Instapages limits the number of pages you can create, how many users you have, and the number of unique visitors to your pages.</p> \n<h3>4. <a href=\"https://mailchimp.com/\">Mailchimp</a></h3> \n<p>Mailchimp now does so much more than email.</p> \n<p>They've built out a full suite of marketing tools that helps small businesses get up and running with their digital marketing efforts. Their landing page builder works alongside their ads, email, and social media tools.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/instapages.png?width=1024&amp;name=instapages.png\" alt=\"instapages\" width=\"1024\" style=\"width: 1024px;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.growthmarketingpro.com/mailchimp-landing-page-builder-software-review-and-pricing/\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p><strong>Price:</strong> Free — to a point. Paid plans start at $11/month</p> \n<p><strong>Pros:</strong> Their drag-and-drop editor is easy to use and lets you create beautiful on-brand landing pages in minutes.</p> \n<p><strong>Cons:</strong> You may need to upgrade to their paid tier to start collaborating with your teammates, get access to more templates, or start optimizing your campaigns.</p> \n<h3>5. <a href=\"https://www.clickfunnels.com/\">Clickfunnels</a></h3> \n<p>Clickfunnels is a landing page builder and marketing automation tool focused on the sales audience.</p> \n<p>Clickfunnels believes that your content should produce results just like your best sales reps would, and it's a solution aimed at moving prospects through a sales funnel into becoming customers.</p> \n<p>Clickfunnels has a number of templates to choose from based on intent — such as up-sell or webinar event pages. To edit these templates, you can use their drag-and-drop page editor to create a page that works for you and your business.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/clickfunnels.jpeg?width=750&amp;name=clickfunnels.jpeg\" alt=\"clickfunnels\" width=\"750\" style=\"width: 750px;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.clickfunnels.com\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p><strong>Price:</strong> $97/month</p> \n<p><strong>Pros:</strong> They have pre-built \"funnels\" that you can use to visualize your customer's journey with your brand — including follow-up funnels that will help you cultivate relationships with users who've converted on your content.</p> \n<p><strong>Cons:</strong> An important limitation to Clickfunnels is its lack of email marketing capabilities. Of course, you can integrate Clickfunnels with an email marketing tool, but this requires an additional fee on top of the $97/month starter plan.</p> \n<h3>6. <a href=\"https://www.sendinblue.com/\">Sendinblue</a></h3> \n<p>Sendinblue is a simple marketing automation tool that features a number of different tools that SMBs need.</p> \n<p>From email marketing, SMS, Facebook Messenger, and a CRM, you get a suite of tools that can help you communicate effectively with your customers.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/sendinblue-1.png?width=1024&amp;name=sendinblue-1.png\" alt=\"sendinblue-1\" width=\"1024\" style=\"width: 1024px;\">\n</div> \n<div style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://www.sendinblue.com/\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a>\n</div> \n<p><strong>Price:</strong> $65/month</p> \n<p><strong>Pros:</strong> Their suite of tools includes an intuitive and straightforward landing page builder with pre-built templates you can choose from.</p> \n<p><strong>Cons:</strong> Although intuitive, their landing page builder is not included in their free product offering. However, other free offerings like their email marketing and SMS features are a great way to see if Sendinblue is right for you.</p> \n<h3>7. <a href=\"https://www.getresponse.com\">GetResponse</a></h3> \n<p>Like other landing page builders on this list, GetResponse comes with a variety of tools that can help you build amazing marketing campaigns.</p> \n<p>With email marketing and pre-built sales funnels, you can quickly begin marketing to the leads that you generate on your landing pages. You can create your own design or choose from over 200 templates.</p> \n<p>They also include a mobile-first editor in case you want to enhance your mobile-visitors experience.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%207%20Best%20Leadpages%20Alternatives%20in%202020-1.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.getresponse.com/features/landing-page-creator?_ga=2.159176638.545940589.1599780698-1319341611.1599780698\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p><strong>Price:</strong> Create one landing page for free, then $12/month</p> \n<p><strong>Pros:</strong> What sets GetResponse apart are its features they provide to help you design your pages. For instance, they have built-in integrations with Shutterstock and Giphy to help you add compelling visuals to your landing pages.</p> \n<p>Additionally, its drag-and-drop builder is incredibly flexible, allowing you to place content blocks wherever you want on the landing page (rather than designated placeholders).&nbsp;</p> \n<p><strong>Cons: </strong><span style=\"font-weight: normal;\">GetResponse is primarily an email marketing tool, not a landing page builder. So if you’re looking to get advanced with your landing pages, it's a good idea to test it out first.&nbsp;</span></p> \n<h2><strong>Choosing the Best LeadPages Alternative</strong></h2> \n<p>Ultimately, deciding what landing page builder you go with will depend on your business' needs.</p> \n<p>For instance, if you're looking for a point solution, tools like Unbounce or Instapage will be great for you — alternatively, if you're looking for a platform that you can use across all your marketing efforts, other tools like Mailchimp or GetResponse will be better suited for your needs.</p> \n<p>And, for growing teams looking to align their marketing efforts around the customer experience, HubSpot's landing page builder is a powerful choice for you. You can get started for free, and track your customers' journey with your brand through the HubSpot CRM.</p> \n<p>Plus, as you grow, you not only avoid having to rip out other tools, but you gain access to more advanced solutions that will help you unlock even more insights into your customers' experience.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=eef5f40f-7762-44f4-a238-46f3c6105c43&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"New Call-to-action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/eef5f40f-7762-44f4-a238-46f3c6105c43.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fbest-leadpages-alternatives&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 08 Mar 2022 12:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/5ff38c7a-c12b-48c8-bb6f-4f066754c979.png","linkMd5":"fad73d938dfbdbfc51c243a018623045","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn80@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-48-465_692592cc39f8a803.webp","destWidth":499,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":5581,"destBytes":7886,"author":"agirard@hubspot.com (Alex Girard)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/5ff38c7a-c12b-48c8-bb6f-4f066754c979.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn80@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-48-465_692592cc39f8a803.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%207%20Best%20Leadpages%20Alternatives%20in%202020-3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn13@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-51-497_dd0dffebc9a2e36d.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/unbounce.webp":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn96@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-54-406_1649d683e2a4b2d4.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/instapage.png?width=1665&name=instapage.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn23@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-49-873_de72df06cb9e9fa1.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/instapages.png?width=1024&name=instapages.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn49@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-54-099_0b3774d7ac2562f9.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/clickfunnels.jpeg?width=750&name=clickfunnels.jpeg":null,"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/sendinblue-1.png?width=1024&name=sendinblue-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn33@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-26-51-111_b9aee44d70a8fe93.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%207%20Best%20Leadpages%20Alternatives%20in%202020-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn21@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-49-440_1a42e144af15b5d7.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/eef5f40f-7762-44f4-a238-46f3c6105c43.png":null,"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fbest-leadpages-alternatives&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn19@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-49-928_6905958b8f62450e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246408204},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"What is Context Marketing? Why It Matters in 2022 [+Examples]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/33894/what-s-the-deal-with-this-whole-context-marketing-thing.aspx","description":"<p>While it's fair to say most marketers are on-board with the importance of <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/content-marketing\">content marketing</a>, there's still an aspect of marketing that doesn't get as much love: context marketing.</p>  \n<p>Whether you know what context marketing means or not, I'm willing to bet you want to deliver the right campaigns to the right customers at the right time. That’s what context marketing is all about.</p> \n<p>Here, we're going to introduce the concept of context marketing and dive into strategies you can use to implement it into your overall marketing strategy.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=a145a75e-59f6-4b51-a482-4f3ea486e740&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Free Resource: Content Marketing Planning Template\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/a145a75e-59f6-4b51-a482-4f3ea486e740.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p></p> \n<p>My favorite context marketing definition is delivering the right content, to the right people, at the right time.</p> \n<p>Let me explain what I mean by context a little more, though. When you have context around something, you have a larger, more telling picture — you know, those little details that lend more clarity to things that would otherwise be pretty general, unspecific, and, well, uninteresting.</p> \n<p>The best marketers leverage context about their audience, leads, and customers in their content marketing. They create <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/audience-profile\">audience profiles</a> and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/buyer-persona-research\">buyer personas</a> and use that information to create more effective marketing and advertising campaigns.</p> \n<p>Now that we have a basic understanding of context marketing, you might be wondering what the difference is between content marketing and context marketing. Let’s take a look below.</p> \n<p>A marketer using context would know more about a lead than her first name. They might also know what industry she works in, what kind of content she likes best, through which channel she prefers to consume content, whether she's currently using another solution to meet her needs, and whether her company has budget at this time of year.</p> \n<p>As a marketer, if you were asked to \"market\" to someone, and all you were given was a first name and the type of company your lead works at, wouldn't your first question be ... what else do we know about her? Probably, if you want to do your job way better.</p> \n<p>That's the idea behind context marketing: Using what you know about your contacts to provide supremely relevant, targeted, and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/data-personalize-marketing-li\">personalized marketing</a>.</p> \n<h2>Why is context marketing important?</h2> \n<p>Context marketing is important for many reasons, but there are two top ones that make its importance even more salient. Let’s go over them below.</p> \n<h3>Context marketing converts better.</h3> \n<p>When you're creating marketing that's targeted at people's point of need, it stands to reason that marketing will perform much better for you, because you aren't delivering marketing content that's misaligned with their interests or stage in the <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/what-is-the-buyers-journey\">buyer’s journey</a>.</p> \n<p>Think about it: If you know that a B2B lead is getting a new budget in January and it's December, you're able to send her insanely targeted content that addresses her needs — like, say, an offer for a custom demo of your product with a rep that specializes in the finance industry. That's content that she's pretty likely to convert on, especially if she's downloaded a buying guide and visited your product pages.</p> \n<p><strong>Hot tip</strong>: Keeping track of your prospect’s activity using <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/marketing-automation\">marketing automation software</a> will make context marketing easier. You’ll know which products your prospect is most interested in and how many times they’ve visited your website.</p> \n<h3>Context marketing increases retention.</h3> \n<p>When you have context around your relationship with a contact, you're able to provide more personalized and relevant marketing content that's targeted to their needs.</p> \n<p>This is great for two reasons: Personalized and relevant marketing is the foundation for <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/content-creation\">creating content</a> people love and engage with. What's more, personalized and relevant marketing is typically not the kind of marketing that annoys people into clicking \"unsubscribe\". If they feel like you’re out to solve their problems specifically, customers are much more likely to stay with you.</p> \n<p>Why not use the context around your relationships with your contacts to create marketing that they love and convert on? Let’s take a look at how you can get started.</p> \n<h2>How to Start Context Marketing</h2> \n<p>Alright, how does this \"context marketing\" theory manifest itself? What would it look like for you, as a marketer? With the help of <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products?hubs_post=blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/33894/what-s-the-deal-with-this-whole-context-marketing-thing.aspx&amp;hubs_post-cta=integrated%20marketing%20software\">marketing automation software</a>, here are some examples of where you'd actually use the principle of \"context\" in your marketing.</p> \n<h3>1. Create specific offers for specific posts and pages.</h3> \n<p>One easy way you can start context marketing? Create offers that extend the value of your website. Bonus points if these offers answer a specific pain point or problem that a customer is trying to solve for when visiting that page.</p> \n<p>Most blog posts in HubSpot’s library feature an offer that’s directly related to the topic of the article. For instance, in our <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/marketing-plan-template-generator?hubs_post-cta=blognavcard-marketing\">blog post about creating a marketing plan</a>, you can download a marketing plan template — which is something that someone wanting to create a marketing plan might need.</p> \n<h3><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/context-marketing-example-offer.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=context-marketing-example-offer.jpeg\" alt=\"context marketing example: specific offer on HubSpot blog post\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></h3> \n<p>Come up with content offers that will benefit your readers and website visitors depending on the page they’re visiting. For instance, if you sell hiking shoes and you’re writing a blog post about going on a solo hiking trip, you might feature an offer for downloading a solo hiking checklist.</p> \n<h3>2. Add smart calls-to-action (CTAs) to your website.</h3> \n<p>You can take personalized offers to the next level by featuring smart <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/calls-to-action?hubs_post=blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/33894/what-s-the-deal-with-this-whole-context-marketing-thing.aspx&amp;hubs_post-cta=dynamic%20CTAs\">calls-to-action</a>. Let’s say you have a variety of offers you want to use to convert traffic into leads, leads into qualified leads, and qualified leads into customers.</p> \n<p>To <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-increase-conversion-rate\">increase your lead conversion rates</a>, you probably don't want leads visiting a case study webpage (typically an action you'd perform further along in your buyer's journey), and finding a CTA leading them to a blog post (which is meant for people earlier in the buyer's journey).</p> \n<p>However, not everyone who visits a case study page on your website is necessarily ready to talk to a salesperson. You don't want to turn them away, either, by offering a CTA that's too pushy.</p> \n<p>Fortunately, with smart CTAs, you can actually surface a CTA that automatically aligns with the visitor's stage in the sales cycle ... or any other host of criteria you want to set. Think industry, business type, location, and past activity/behaviors.</p> \n<p>For instance, if you have already downloaded an offer from HubSpot, you might see this CTA on certain social-media-related posts:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/context-marketing-example-smart-cta.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=context-marketing-example-smart-cta.jpeg\" alt=\"context marketing example: smart cta\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>But if you haven’t downloaded an offer before, you’ll see the default CTA:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/context-marketing-example-default-cta.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=context-marketing-example-default-cta.jpeg\" alt=\"context marketing example: default cta\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>This type of smart content can help you capture your audience’s information at all stages of their buyer’s journey.</p> \n<p><strong>Hot tip</strong>: HubSpot’s marketing automation software lets you <a href=\"https://knowledge.hubspot.com/ctas/create-smart-calls-to-action-cta\">easily create a smart calls-to-action</a> with little technical knowledge.</p> \n<h3>3. Create smart forms that shorten the conversion cycle.</h3> \n<p>Smart forms know if someone has already filled out the form fields you're asking for. If you use smart forms, for instance, your site visitors won't see \"First Name\" and \"Last Name\" every time they fill out a form — instead, they'll answer those questions once, and then never again.</p> \n<p>This will help you glean new information about your leads each time they fill out a form, instead of just more of the same stuff. It also helps you create a more seamless, personalized user experience that leverages prior interactions with your website as context.</p> \n<p>Here’s one example from HubSpot Academy. This is what I see when I’m logged into the HubSpot CRM:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/context-marketing-example-smart-form.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=context-marketing-example-smart-form.jpeg\" alt=\"context marketing example: smart form\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>The form knows I’m a current HubSpot customer and doesn’t require me to create a new account. I only have to click one button: “Start the Course.”</p> \n<p>But this is what I see when I’m not logged in:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/context-marketing-example-default-form.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=context-marketing-example-default-form.jpeg\" alt=\"context marketing example: default form\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Ultimately, smart forms will help you gather even more context about your visitors, leads, and customers, and help increase conversion rates over time.</p> \n<p><strong>Hot tip</strong>: You can easily <a href=\"https://knowledge.hubspot.com/cos-general/create-smart-forms?hubs_post=blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/33894/what-s-the-deal-with-this-whole-context-marketing-thing.aspx&amp;hubs_post-cta=smart%20forms\">create smart forms</a> inside HubSpot’s marketing automation software.</p> \n<h3>4. Leverage dynamic email content and workflows.</h3> \n<p>Your forms and offers aren't the only things that need to be smart. Your email database — especially if you want to maintain your space in people's coveted inboxes — <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/email-list-segmentation\">needs to be segmented</a> into highly targeted lists, as well.</p> \n<p>I happen to be subscribed to Grammarly emails on both my work and personal emails. Because I only use the Grammarly Chrome extension at work, I receive emails like this:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/context-marketing-example-segmented-email-example.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=context-marketing-example-segmented-email-example.jpeg\" alt=\"context marketing example: grammarly segmented email\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\">In my personal account, however, I use Grammarly’s web app regularly and review thousands of words for a personal project. Here’s the email I get:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/context-marketing-example-segmented-email-grammarly.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=context-marketing-example-segmented-email-grammarly.jpeg\" alt=\"context marketing example: grammarly second segmented email\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\">Throughout the email, Grammarly prompts you to upgrade to the premium version and take advantage of its other tools. Because I don’t use the Chrome extension in my personal email account, it includes a call-to-action to install the extension. It’s delightful to receive an email that uses my account activity as context.</p> \n<p>Beyond email segmentation, your email lists need to be smart enough to know when to pull in a contact, and certain information you have in your database about that contact, into your email marketing campaigns.</p> \n<p>Remember, a great context marketer delivers the right content, to the right person, at the right time. So to send emails that are contextually relevant, you need to use their activity and background to deliver personalized content that delights them and prompts them to convert.</p> \n<h2>Context Marketing Examples</h2> \n<p>While context marketing may sound complicated, it’s actually quite simple in practice. In fact, as a customer, you may have seen or enjoyed context marketing yourself. Let’s take a look at some examples.</p> \n<h3>1. Google’s Product Ads Carousel</h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/context-marketing-example-google.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=context-marketing-example-google.jpeg\" alt=\"context marketing example: google product carousel ads\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Have you ever looked up a product on Google and see a carousel at the top (as opposed to just the plain search results)? The products you see are typically ads for the exact same thing you searched for.</p> \n<p>This is a prime contextual marketing example. Google uses your behavior and search query to deliver ads that are contextually relevant. Imagine if, when searching for instant coffee, Google delivers ads for french presses instead. While you might be interested in French presses and even searched for them before, you’re looking for instant coffee right now.</p> \n<p>That’s why it’s important to answer for your customer’s specific pain points and queries, and to do so at the right time. And you don’t have to be a highly sophisticated search engine to do so. Remember those offers we spoke about in the previous sections? That can function in the same way as Google’s product carousels.</p> \n<h3>2. Asana’s New Feature Pop-Up</h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/context-marketing-example-asana.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=context-marketing-example-asana.jpeg\" alt=\"context marketing example: asana feature popup\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>There’s no more powerful place to carry out contextual marketing than right within your own product, website, or store. Asana’s example shows that you can upsell customers easily by marketing a new feature and prompting them to try it for free.</p> \n<p>This is an excellent example of contextual marketing because you wouldn’t be interested in trying this new feature unless you were a current Asana user. For instance, if Asana had placed this pop-up on their homepage, they likely wouldn’t have much success with it. But because it pops up after you log in, you’re more likely to say, “Sure, I’ll try it.”</p> \n<p>You can achieve something similar by instituting a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/website/website-personalization-examples-dynamic\">website personalization campaign</a>. When people visit your product page, for instance, they might see a popup to schedule a meeting with a salesperson. But when they’re on the blog, they might see a popup to subscribe. These simple changes can help you capture more leads and use the context from their activity to deliver an offer they won’t resist.</p> \n<h3>3. LinkedIn Company Page Sidebar Ad</h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/context-marketing-example-linkedin.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=context-marketing-example-linkedin.jpeg\" alt=\"context marketing example: linkedin sidebar ad on company page\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>When you visit a company page on LinkedIn, it provides a little sidebar ad that prompts you to find roles at that company that match your skills.</p> \n<p>LinkedIn does this because it knows that you might be open to opportunities even if you don’t list it on your profile. And if you’re looking at a company page, you might be interested in working at that firm. LinkedIn uses this context to deliver a relevant ad that you can’t help but click on.</p> \n<p>Another reason this is such a great example is that it also lists a job title that relates to yours. So if you’re a financial advisor and are looking at JP Morgan Chase’s company page, LinkedIn will automatically advertise financial advisor roles at the firm.</p> \n<h2>Context Marketing is the Next Evolution of Content Marketing</h2> \n<p>Without context, you risk reaching the wrong people at the wrong time. Begin using context in all of your marketing and advertising campaigns, and you’ll see an exponential increase in conversions, helping you exceed your lead acquisition goals and increase revenue at your company.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in March 2013 and has been updated for comprehensiveness. &nbsp;</em></p> \n<p></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=870b6a31-0a25-444f-b61e-ff427ef5d5e9&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"New Call-to-action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/870b6a31-0a25-444f-b61e-ff427ef5d5e9.png\"></a></p>  \n<img
