\">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 10 Mar 2022 12:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/d474d43c-b0ae-465d-90f8-48fec9e904f5.png","linkMd5":"1fa4372ea8d53da199af6cb8fe3ebf46","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn71@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-48-843_90298033476541d5.webp","destWidth":613,"destHeight":60,"sourceBytes":4852,"destBytes":8832,"author":"adecker@hubspot.com (Allie Decker)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/d474d43c-b0ae-465d-90f8-48fec9e904f5.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn71@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-48-843_90298033476541d5.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/marketing-campaigns-1.png?width=1500&name=marketing-campaigns-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn86@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-50-533_a94b7d28170c5078.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/marketing-campaign-example.jpg?width=600&name=marketing-campaign-example.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn57@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-52-668_2c6c99f523c9b091.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/marketing%20campaign%20example%20by%20meta.jpg?width=500&name=marketing%20campaign%20example%20by%20meta.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn15@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-53-581_df194af7baf063f9.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/marketing%20campaign%20from%20popeyes.jpg?width=500&name=marketing%20campaign%20from%20popeyes.jpg":null,"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/marketing%20campaign%20example%20from%20cheerios.jpg?width=500&name=marketing%20campaign%20example%20from%20cheerios.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn91@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-51-270_55d4b8c5120711bf.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/marketing%20campaign%20example%20from%20apple.jpg?width=500&name=marketing%20campaign%20example%20from%20apple.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn98@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-56-189_484773070a9e798e.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/2ad19eed-62c3-4238-925d-032a3b221464.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn1@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-49-845_8eca5753dc1ba6cb.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fmarketing-campaigns&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn25@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-55-901_a583b9f98ad6e9bf.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246408221},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"Does Your Company Need An Employee Referral Program? [Examples + Best Practices]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/employee-referral-program","description":"<p>Finding qualified candidates to fill your open positions can be challenging. Job posting sites claim to make the process easy by connecting you with hundreds if not thousands of potential employees. But having such a large pool of candidates can be overwhelming.</p>  \n<p>Just thinking about the sheer volume of work involved in reviewing applications, narrowing them down to good fits, and then vetting those potential candidates is enough to make anyone’s head explode.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=3f403048-fd8e-426f-bddd-4fce020ae24b&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Download Now: Free Company Culture Code Template&nbsp;\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/3f403048-fd8e-426f-bddd-4fce020ae24b.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p>You work with or run a solid organization with wonderful employees. How do you make sure that you don’t get a bevy of potential candidates, but rather the <em>right</em> candidate?</p> \n<p>Look at this like finding the perfect place to take your significant other on a special occasion. Sure, you could do a Google search for random restaurants in your neighborhood. You could even check a review site for recommendations.</p> \n<p>However, you don’t know any of those people, so how much weight does their opinion really carry? Instead of taking a risk on a very special evening, why not reach out to the people you trust? Asking friends and family for a recommendation is a much safer avenue to finding the perfect date night experience.</p> \n<p>What if we applied this type of thinking to your search for the perfect employee? Rather than leave it up to a random internet search, ask the people you already know, like, and trust… your employees.</p> \n<h2>What is an employee referral program?</h2> \n<p>An employee referral program is a structured system by which you ask existing employees to recommend people they know for open positions within your organization. Employees often receive some sort of incentive for their assistance.</p> \n<p>An employee referral program leverages the power of your employees’ networks and can save you time, money, and a huge headache when it comes to hiring the best talent for your business.</p> \n<h2>Benefits of an Employee Referral Program</h2> \n<p>There are many benefits to utilizing an employee referral program as part of your hiring strategy. These include:</p> \n<h3>1. High Quality Hires</h3> \n<p>Good employees know what skills are necessary to excel in a position and understand the workplace culture. When they recommend someone for the job, there’s a good chance they have the qualifications necessary to successfully perform in the role.</p> \n<h3>2. Decreased Turnover Rates</h3> \n<p>With employee turnover rates <a href=\"https://www.zippia.com/advice/employee-turnover-statistics/\"><span>on the rise</span></a>, you’ll want to keep it front of mind when you’re making hiring decisions. According to <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/employee-referral-statistics-you-need-know-2020-mike-stafiej/?articleId=6622562177335336961\"><span>ERIN</span></a>, 45% of referred employees stay with a company longer compared to 22% from job boards and 33% from career sites.</p> \n<h3>3. Less Time and Lower Cost Per Hire</h3> \n<p>According to <a href=\"https://business.linkedin.com/content/dam/me/business/en-us/talent-solutions/resources/pdfs/new_employee_referral_programs_FINAL.pdf\"><span>LinkedIn</span></a>, employees hired through referrals take an average of 29 days to hire and onboard, whereas job boards can take 39 days and a career site can take upwards of 55 days. The less time it takes to hire and onboard means less revenue lost, fewer employees stressed because they are handling multiple jobs, and more productivity from your new hire.</p> \n<p>Using a headhunter? According to <a href=\"https://www.jobvite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Jobvite-RecruiterNation-Report-Final.pdf\"><span>Jobvite</span></a>, you can expect to pay between 15% and 25% of the gross annual salary of the candidate. If you’re hiring an employee at $100k per year, that’s $15k to $25k in headhunting fees. The cost to reward an employee for an amazing referral? Around $2,000.</p> \n<h3>4. Increase Employee Satisfaction and Loyalty</h3> \n<p>Doesn’t it feel nice when you have a hand in the decision-making process? Employees that refer candidates feel like they’ve contributed to the company, making them more engaged and more likely to stay.</p> \n<h2>Employee Referral Program Ideas</h2> \n<p>Now that you see the benefit to you as the employer or hiring manager, how do you create an employee referral program that encourages your existing employees to introduce you to their quality contacts? There are a number of ways to do this and best practices that you can adopt to get the most out of your program.</p> \n<h3>Make it Clear What You’re Looking For</h3> \n<p>In a mid-sized to a large company, one department may have no idea what another one is working on. In order for employees to make connections, they need to know what your expectations are for the new position. When you reach out to employees looking for suggestions, provide them with all the details you can. This should include:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/marketing-job-descriptions\"><span>Job descriptions</span></a></li> \n <li>Desired experience</li> \n <li>Necessary skills</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>Make it Easy for Employees to Refer</h3> \n<p>Consider the referral experience from your employees’ point of view. Is there a simple form for them to submit when they recommend someone, or do they have to jump through a variety of complicated hoops to pass along their referrals? Some companies even host recruitment happy hours where existing employees can invite friends who might be a good fit.</p> \n<p>The easier you make it for your employees to refer their contacts, the more quality candidates will be presented to you.</p> \n<h3>Keep Your Employees Updated on Referral Status</h3> \n<p>It’s frustrating to make a suggestion or an introduction and not know if it’s been acted upon. When your employee recommends a colleague, keep them updated as to the steps of the hiring process. Some times to check-in include:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>When you receive an application</li> \n <li>When you make contact</li> \n <li>When an interview is scheduled</li> \n <li>When a position has been offered to their contact</li> \n <li>When the position has been given to someone else (after the candidate has been contacted)</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>Provide a Juicy Incentive</h3> \n<p>Surprisingly, this may not always be a monetary reward. While money is always appreciated, you can offer a combination of \"cash\" and experiences, time off, gifts, etc. For some, these may be even more desired than a financial incentive. One great option is to give your employees the choice. That way, you know they’ll be motivated to help. A few employee referral incentive ideas to get your creative juices flowing:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Cash bonuses</li> \n <li>Gift certificates to their favorite restaurants and local establishments</li> \n <li>Weekend getaways or week-long excursions for frequent referrers</li> \n <li>VIP parking</li> \n <li>Show tickets</li> \n <li>Physical gifts (it’s important to let them choose so they don’t end up with something they can’t use)</li> \n <li>Perks like a gym membership or massage</li> \n</ul> \n<p>The sky's the limit when it comes to thanking your employees for their referrals. You can also consider using a platform like <a href=\"https://www.xoxoday.com/\">XoxoDay</a> to make distributing employee referral perks as easy and streamlined as possible.</p> \n<h3>Show Appreciation for \"Frequent Referrers\"</h3> \n<p>If you’ve got employees that consistently send you quality employee candidates, acknowledge them publicly. This shows your amazing team members that they are appreciated and motivates other employees to step up their referral game.</p> \n<h2>Employee Referral Program Examples</h2> \n<p>Looking for real-world examples of these programs in action? We’ve compiled a few employee referral program samples to introduce you to some of the possibilities.</p> \n<ol> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.inmobi.com/\"><span>Inmobi</span></a>, a mobile advertising company offers referring employees the choice of a bike or a trip to Bali. They park the vehicles in front of the company headquarters to motivate employees to participate.</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.accenture.com/us-en\"><span>Accenture</span></a>, a consulting and IT company encourages philanthropy and community involvement by letting their employees donate a part of their referral bonus to a charity of their choice.</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://distillery.com/\"><span>Distillery</span></a>, an American software development company gifts their employees new tech gadgets for every referral they make.</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.atlassian.com/\"><span>Atlassian</span></a> software company encourages employees to \"Refer-a-Mate\" and offers them $2,000 in cash bonuses.</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/homepage.html\"><span>Intel</span></a> tech company takes financial incentives one step further by doubling their employee referral reward for women, minorities, and veterans that are referred to the company.</li> \n</ol> \n<p>If you’d like to tap into a pool of qualified, trustworthy, easy-to-hire (and onboard) candidates, an employee referral program can help. Instituting this type of hiring process in your organization can save you money, time, headaches, and the pain of having to repeatedly hire for the same position when your first employee doesn’t work out well. In addition, you’ll improve your workplace culture and enhance your brand.</p> \n<p>An employee referral program is the best thing you can do to improve the quality of your incoming employees. Choose your incentives wisely and then watch the quality candidates roll on in.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=4bbcf7f8-3c11-4d5b-b284-c5f6a9d419c9&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"company culture template\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/4bbcf7f8-3c11-4d5b-b284-c5f6a9d419c9.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Femployee-referral-program&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 09 Mar 2022 12:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/3f403048-fd8e-426f-bddd-4fce020ae24b.png","linkMd5":"ad7181ffe31559a408a75af9a3fd7bc0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn56@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-26-48-438_af47b0cd123e84fb.webp","destWidth":489,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":5237,"destBytes":7504,"author":"Sheryl Green","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/3f403048-fd8e-426f-bddd-4fce020ae24b.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn56@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-26-48-438_af47b0cd123e84fb.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/4bbcf7f8-3c11-4d5b-b284-c5f6a9d419c9.png":null,"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Femployee-referral-program&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn16@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-26-53-945_aa77a0f97e109ceb.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246408207},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"31 Instagram Features, Hacks, & Tips Everyone Should Know About","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-features-tricks","description":"<p>Did you know you could schedule your Instagram posts in advance? Or optimize your bio to appear in the Explore tab?</p> \n<p>There are countless lesser-known Instagram features, settings, hacks, and search options to help take your <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/instagram-marketing\">Instagram game to the next level</a>. And we've compiled them all, here.</p> \n<p>Whether you're a recruiter looking to showcase your company's culture, a marketer in the e-commerce industry, or an individual who's just looking to use Instagram in the best ways possible, there are Instagram tips and features here for you.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=8feb9a1f-5ef5-429b-892f-167a5e67b12b&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"*Bonus Content* Click here to unlock 20 powerful strategies &amp; hacks for  increasing Instagram engagement.\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/8feb9a1f-5ef5-429b-892f-167a5e67b12b.png\" /></a></p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; margin: 0px auto;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.07%; margin: 0;\"> \n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe hs-fullwidth-embed\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/Lwt5FcKjl84\" width=\"560\" height=\"314\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n </div> \n</div> \n<p><em><strong>Note:</strong> Before getting started, make sure you're operating on the latest version of Instagram. At the time of publishing this guide, the latest version is <strong>15.1.1 on iOS and</strong><strong> on Android</strong>. Please also note that although this article might demonstrate each tip below using an iPhone or Android device, all items on this list are available for both operating systems and can be enjoyed using the same step-by-step instructions.</em></p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Table of Contents:&nbsp;</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-features-tricks#instagram-account-features\">Instagram Account Features</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-features-tricks#instagram-design-features\">Instagram Design Features</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-features-tricks#Instagram-optimization-features\">Instagram Optimization Features</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-features-tricks#instagram-stories-features\">Instagram Stories Features</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-features-tricks#user-preferences-feature\">Instagram User Preferences Features</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-features-tricks#instagram-user-search-features\">Instagram User Search Features</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">31 Hidden Instagram Hacks, Tips, and Features</h2> \n<a></a> \n<h3>Instagram Account Features</h3> \n<h4>1. Add and manage multiple accounts from the same device.</h4> \n<p>Have a separate account for your dog? Don't be embarrassed; stand by your puppy profile. In fact, whether it's a pet account or a business account, you can add and manage this one right alongside your personal account.</p> \n<p>Here's how:</p> \n<ol> \n <li>From your profile, tap the gear icon. To find this icon on an Android device, you'll first need to tap the three horizontal lines to the top right of your screen.</li> \n <li>Scroll to the very bottom and tap \"Add Account.\"</li> \n <li>Add your other account by username and password, and you're all set.</li> \n</ol> \n<p>To toggle between both profiles, hold down your profile picture in the navigation bar to view all connected accounts. You can also switch to a different account through the Settings page mentioned earlier. See what this screen looks like in the next Instagram feature, below.</p> \n<h4>2. See all the posts you've liked.</h4> \n<p>Ever wanted to see the posts you've Liked, all in one place? All you have to do is go to your own profile and click the \"Settings\" button in the top right — a gear icon on iPhone/iPad, and three dots on Android — then, click \"Account\", and finally \"Posts You've Liked.\"</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8584.jpg?width=450&amp;name=IMG_8584.jpg\" alt=\"someone's instagram settings to click account to find out posts you've liked\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8585.jpg?width=450&amp;name=IMG_8585.jpg\" alt=\"someone's instagram settings to click account to find out posts you've liked\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" /></img></p> \n<p>To un-Like any of the posts you've Liked, simply go to the post and deselect the \"heart\" icon below it. Don't worry — the user won't be notified that you've un-Liked the post.</p> \n<h4>3. Hide, delete, or disable comments on your posts.</h4> \n<p>Twitter may carry a more \"anything goes\" culture of commentary, but your Instagram is your domain — and it's much easier to control who says what on your content. This is especially important if you manage a business account.</p> \n<h5>To Filter Comments by Keyword:</h5> \n<p>In the Instagram mobile app, navigate to \"Options\" and select \"Comments.\" From here, you can toggle on \"Hide Inappropriate Comments\" and even enter specific keywords you'd like the app to police within each comment.</p> \n<h5>To Delete Comments:</h5> \n<p>Tap the speech bubble icon below the comment you'd like to delete, and swipe lightly to the left over this text. Select the garbage can icon that appears to delete this post. You can also do this to your own comments.</p> \n<h5>To Disable Comments Entirely:</h5> \n<p>To clarify, you can't turn off comments across your entire profile; you can only disable them for individual posts.</p> \n<p>To do so, start posting an image on which you'd like nobody to comment. When you reach the page to add a caption, tags, and location, tap \"Advanced Settings\" at the very bottom. This will open a screen where you can easily switch on an option labeled \"Turn Off Commenting.\"</p> \n<h4>4. Clear your Instagram search history.</h4> \n<p>We swear — this blog post isn't all about how to convince people you're not an Instagram creeper. But many of us can relate to the desire to clear our online search history everywhere, including on this particular social channel. Luckily, you can.</p> \n<p>To clear your Instagram search history, go to your own profile and click the \"Settings\" button (a gear icon on iPhone/iPad and three dots on Android). Scroll down and click \"Security\":</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8584%20copy.jpg?width=450&amp;name=IMG_8584%20copy.jpg\" alt=\"showing in settings how to clear instagram search history\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" /></p> \n<p>Then, select \"Clear Search History\" at bottom of the screen, and then confirm by clicking the blue link, \"Clear Search History\".</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8600.jpg?width=450&amp;name=IMG_8600.jpg\" alt=\"showing in settings how to clear instagram search history\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" /></p> \n<h4>5. Add another Instagram account to your bio.</h4> \n<p>Perhaps your company has more than one Instagram account for different aspects of your brand. For instance, HubSpot has a verified HubSpot account, a HubSpot Life account, a HubSpot Academy account, and a HubSpot Partners account.</p> \n<p>To draw awareness back to its main company page, then, HubSpot links to the @HubSpot account in its other account bios, like in @HubSpotLife's account:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/add%20another%20account%20to%20instagram%20bio.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=add%20another%20account%20to%20instagram%20bio.jpeg\" alt=\"add another account to instagram bio\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> \n<p>Fortunately, you have the option to include another Instagram account in your Instagram bio. To do so, simply type the \"@\" sign into your Bio, and then select the account you'd like to tag. Then, click \"Done\".</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/add-insta-account-to-bio.png?width=450&amp;name=add-insta-account-to-bio.png\" alt=\"add-insta-account-to-bio\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" /></p> \n<a></a> \n<h3>Instagram Design Features&nbsp;</h3> \n<h4>6. Add special fonts to your bio.</h4> \n<p>Here's an Instagram bio hack that can truly make your profile stand out. You can already add emojis to the bio beneath your profile photo, but your keyboard limits your creativity right there.</p> \n<p>Using a couple of basic third-party websites, you can copy over some more special fonts not often found in the Instagram community. Here's how.</p> \n<h5>To Add a Special Font to Your Bio via Mobile:</h5> \n<p>Add a new font to your Instagram bio via your mobile device using a website like <a href=\"https://lingojam.com/FontsForInstagram\">LingoJam</a>. Open the site on your phone, type your desired bio text in the lefthand text box, and you'll see the same bio text in different typefaces appear on the right.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/instagram-bio-hack-new-fonts-1.png\" alt=\"how to add special font to bio with a tool like lingojam\" /></p> \n<p>Carry your chosen font over to your Instagram bio by tapping it and selecting \"Copy.\" Then, open your Instagram app, navigate to your profile, select \"Edit Profile,\" tap the \"Bio\" section and paste your chosen font into the empty field.</p> \n<h5>To Add a Special Font to Your Bio on Desktop:</h5> \n<p>If you're editing your Instagram profile on your laptop or desktop, <a href=\"http://www.fontspace.com/category/instagram\">Font Space</a> has a library of fonts you can download and copy into your bio in seconds. To do so, Find a font you like and select \"Download\" beneath the font's sample image, as shown below.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/download-font-for-instagram.png\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" alt=\"cursive font of someone's name\" /></p> \n<p>Downloading this font will open a folder on your desktop where you can pull a \".ttf\" file that carries the various versions of this font. The file will look something like the screenshot below.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/cassandra-font-for-instagram-bio.png\" alt=\"copying special font to paste it into instagram\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" /></p> \n<p>Once you have this font copied to your computer's clipboard, open your internet browser and log onto Instagram.com. Select \"Edit Profile\" and paste your downloaded font into your bio field. You can then edit the sample text that came with your font to write your new bio as you see fit.</p> \n<h4>7. Add special characters to your bio.</h4> \n<p>Not only can you customize your bio with a special font, but you can also add atypical characters that distinguish you or your brand — but that you wouldn't find on your smartphone's normal keyboard. These include<span>&nbsp;</span><span>§,&nbsp;</span><span>†, or even&nbsp;™ if your Instagram name features a trademarked product name.</span></p> \n<h5>To Add Special Characters From Mobile</h5> \n<p>Using your mobile device, install a free mobile app like<span>&nbsp;</span><a href=\"https://apps.apple.com/us/app/character-pad/id418874651\">Character Pad</a>, which catalogs nearly every character and symbol you might need but won't find in the 26-letter English alphabet.</p> \n<p>Open the app and find the character you want to add to your Instagram bio. In Character Pad, you'll simply double-tap the picture of your chosen symbol to paste it into a text box, as shown below. Then, copy this character to your phone's clipboard. (For our purposes, I double-tapped the half moon icon.)</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/special%20characters.png?width=450&amp;name=special%20characters.png\" alt=\"special characters\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\">Once you have your symbol copied to your clipboard, open Instagram, navigate to your bio, and tap \"Edit Profile.\"<br><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/edit%20profile-1.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=edit%20profile-1.jpeg\" alt=\"edit profile-1\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\">Hold down your finger on the field of your bio you want to insert your special character until \"Paste\" appears as an option, as shown below. Tap \"Paste\" and then \"Done\" you'll be all set.</img></br></img></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/welcome%20to%20my%20page.png?width=1125&amp;name=welcome%20to%20my%20page.png\" alt=\"welcome to my page\" width=\"1125\" style=\"width: 1125px;\" /></p> \n<h5>To Add Special Characters From a PC</h5> \n<p>You can also insert special characters and symbols through Instagram's web client on a desktop or laptop computer. The easiest way is to use Microsoft Word's \"Symbol\" insertion icon, as shown below.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/ms-word-insert-symbol.jpg?width=400&amp;name=ms-word-insert-symbol.jpg\" alt=\"ms-word-insert-symbol\" width=\"400\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> \n<p>Select your desired symbol or character and copy it to your computer's clipboard. Then, navigate to Instagram.com and follow the steps above to paste your character into a particular part of your bio.</p> \n<p>You might be tempted to simply Google search the special character you want, and at times it might work just as well as the steps above. But keep in mind not all special characters you copy from the internet are \"clean\" when you paste them into Instagram — some of them might become corrupted or not show up correctly.</p> \n<h4>8. Reorder filters to set your favorite filters at the front.</h4> \n<p>If you use Instagram a lot, chances are, you have a few favorite go-to filters, and others you never touch. To make editing photos easier, you can reorder the filters in your editing window.</p> \n<p>To reorder filters, add a new post and begin editing it. When you get to the filters page, hold down on a filter you'd like to move, and then drag it to your preferred location.&nbsp;</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/reorder%20instagram%20filters.png?width=450&amp;name=reorder%20instagram%20filters.png\" alt=\"reorder instagram filters\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> \n<h4>9. Use Instagram as a photo editor (without having to post anything).</h4> \n<p>Perhaps you love Instagram's filters and editing capabilities, but aren't quite ready to post the photo to your account — right now, or ever. To use Instagram as a photo editor without posting anything, all you need to do is publish a picture while your phone is on airplane mode.</p> \n<p>First, be sure you have \"Save Original Photo\" turned on in your Instagram settings.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8604.png?width=1125&amp;name=IMG_8604.png\" alt=\"IMG_8604\" width=\"1125\" style=\"width: 1125px;\" /></p> \n<p>Then, turn on airplane mode — see instructions in #5.</p> \n<p>Next, follow the normal steps to post a photo to Instagram: Upload the photo, edit it, and press \"Share.\" An error message will appear saying the upload failed, but you'll be able to find the edited image in your phone's photo gallery.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/use%20ig%20as%20photo%20editor.png?width=450&amp;name=use%20ig%20as%20photo%20editor.png\" alt=\"use ig as photo editor\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> \n<h4>10. Insert line breaks into your bio and captions.</h4> \n<p>When you write a caption in Instagram, you'll see the keyboard doesn't give you an option to press \"Enter\" or \"Return.\" The same is true for your bio. So how do all those people put line breaks in there?</p> \n<img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/No%20return%20key.png?width=450&amp;name=No%20return%20key.png\" alt=\"No return key.png\" title=\"No return key.png\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"> <p>It turns out that all you have to do is press the \"123\" key in the bottom lefthand corner of the keyboard, and the \"Return\" key will appear on the bottom right.</p> <img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Return%20key.png?width=450&amp;name=Return%20key.png\" alt=\"Return key.png\" title=\"Return key.png\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"> <p>I know this tip sounds simple, but <em>a lot</em> of people miss it — myself included, until a colleague clued me in. We've seen some elaborate solutions out there for hacking through this problem, like <a href=\"http://www.lifeinlimbo.org/2014/08/27/instagram-tips-how-to-add-line-breaks-and-spaces-to-your-captions-and-bio/\">writing the caption copy in another app</a>, then copying and pasting it into Instagram. Thankfully, it's much simpler than that.</p> \n  <div class=\"video-container-responsive\"> \n   <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n    <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\"> \n     <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/498VDB076eY\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n    </div> \n   </div> \n  </div> <a></a> <h3>Instagram Optimization Features</h3> <h4>11. Optimize your Instagram bio to appear in the Explore tab.</h4> <p>Your friends, family, and coworkers might be your first group of Instagram followers, but growing your audience takes more than the people who already know you. One key way to do this is to get your profile to appear in Instagram's Explore page.</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/explore%20tab.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=explore%20tab.jpeg\" alt=\"explore tab\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\">The Explore page, accessible using the magnifying glass icon shown above, is a browsing page that sorts the entire Instagram community by topic and keyword. These include \"Fitness,\" \"Style,\" \"Science,\" and more.</img></p> <p>Hashtagging your posts with these words can expose your content to the people browsing these topics, but you can also use them in your Instagram name and bio to promote your profile.</p> <p>If Jane Doe is a marketing consultant, for example, she might want to make her Instagram name \"Jane Doe Marketing,\" rather than simply \"Jane Doe.\" Then, in her bio, she can include all of her specialties, such as \"SEO,\" \"blogging,\" \"email marketing,\" etc.</p> <h4>12. Drive traffic to an external website.</h4> <p>One of the biggest frustrations people have with marketing on Instagram is that clickable URLs aren't allowed anywhere except the single \"website\" box in your bio. If you put a URL in a photo caption it'll appear as plain text, meaning users would have to painstakingly copy the URL, open a web browser, and paste or type it in there.</p> <p>One sneaky way to get people to visit your Instagram profile, which is where that one clickable URL is allowed, is to use your photo captions to encourage people to visit your profile for a link. Then, update that URL frequently to point to your latest blog content, YouTube video, product, or offer.</p> <p>Check out the example from food magazine <em>Bon Appétit</em> below. This photo's caption provides a text call-to-action to visit the user's profile so you can click the link related to the post.</p> \n  <blockquote class=\"instagram-media\" style=\"background: #FFF; border: 0; border-radius: 3px; box-shadow: 0 0 1px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.5),0 1px 10px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.15); margin: 1px; max-width: 658px; padding: 0; width: calc(100% - 2px);\"> \n   <div style=\"padding: 8px;\"> \n    <div style=\"background: #F8F8F8; line-height: 0; margin-top: 40px; padding: 50.0% 0; text-align: center; width: 100%;\">\n      &nbsp; \n    </div> \n    <p style=\"margin: 8px 0 0 0; padding: 0 4px;\"><a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/BT99Vgvh_Km/\" style=\"color: #000; font-family: Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; line-height: 17px; text-decoration: none; word-wrap: break-word;\">Comfort food gone green 🌱. Brandon Jew, chef at @misterjius, put a spring spin on his mom's congee for @healthy_ish. Head to the link in our profile for the recipe. 📷: @laurashoots</a></p> \n    <p style=\"color: #c9c8cd; font-family: Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 14px; line-height: 17px; margin-bottom: 0; margin-top: 8px; overflow: hidden; padding: 8px 0 7px; text-align: center; text-overflow: ellipsis; white-space: nowrap;\">A post shared by bonappetitmag (@bonappetitmag) on May 11, 2017 at 3:02pm PDT</p> \n   </div> \n  </blockquote> <p style=\"text-align: center;\"> </p> <p>Then, in <em>Bon Appétit</em>'s profile, you'll see the link itself. Update this link frequently to point to your latest content or offer.</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/add%20link%20to%20bio.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=add%20link%20to%20bio.jpeg\" alt=\"add link to bio\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\">Plus, if you have a verified Instagram account, you can also add links to your Story. Read more about this feature <a href=\"https://help.instagram.com/691455604353423\">here</a>.</img></p> <h4>13. Sell products from Instagram using Shoppable Posts.</h4> <p>You might already know you can tag people in your Instagram posts as (or after) you post new content. Now, you can tag <em>products</em> — and direct your viewers to a product page to buy what they saw.</p> <h5>To Add an Instagram Business Account</h5> <p>You'll need an Instagram Business account to publish shoppable posts. You can get one by selecting \"Edit Profile\" on your Instagram profile and tapping \"Try Instagram Business Tools,\" as shown below.</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/professional-account-1.jpg?width=450&amp;name=professional-account-1.jpg\" alt=\"switch to professional account button on instagram\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" /></p> <h5>To Tag a Post With Products</h5> <p>Once you've launched an Instagram Business account, you'll need to enable product tags to use them on a post that depicts a product. Navigate to your settings using the gear icon from your profile page, and select \"Products.\" Tap \"Continue\" and follow the prompts to connect a \"<a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/instagram/shopping/guide\">product catalog</a>\" to your business profile.</p> <p>With product tags enabled on your Instagram Business account, you can now upload new posts and tag your photo with products you find from your product catalog. Here's what a shoppable post can look like:</p> <p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/instagram-shoppable-post.jpg?width=350&amp;name=instagram-shoppable-post.jpg\" alt=\"instagram-shoppable-post\" width=\"350\" style=\"width: 350px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"><span style=\"font-size: 13px;\">Image via <a href=\"https://help.instagram.com/191462054687226\">Instagram</a></span></img></p> <h4>14. Create an auto-complete quick reply for standard responses.</h4> <p>Responding to user comments and questions is incredibly timely, but fortunately, there's a hack to streamline the process and make it more efficient. (Note: This only works on Instagram Business accounts.)</p> <p>You can simply create a one-to-two word phrase that can act as your shortcut to a longer standard response you might send often. To do this, click \"Business\" in your Settings, and then \"Quick Replies\" — or, click the three-dot chat bubble icon on bottom of screen, and then click \"New Quick Reply\".</p> <p>Add a shortcut you can enter for the response. For instance, you might type \"returnpolicy\" as the shortcut for a longer response, i.e.: \"Hey there. We're sorry you don't love your purchase. Fortunately, we permit 30-day returns, no questions asked. Please send us your order confirmation number to get the process started.\"</p> <p>Once you've added a shortcut, you can either type the shortcut \"returnpolicy\" into the comment box when you want it to auto-generate, or you can tap the three-dot chat Quick Replies bubble icon at the bottom of your screen to choose from a response you've created. (<a href=\"https://business.instagram.com/blog/how-to-communicate-effectively-with-customers\">Read more about Quick Replies here</a>.)</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/0bbb2a75b44c18506923b75ffceb2a1a.gif\" alt=\"0bbb2a75b44c18506923b75ffceb2a1a\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" /></p> <p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://business.instagram.com/blog/how-to-communicate-effectively-with-customers\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a></p> <h4>15. Pin your Instagram post to Pinterest.</h4> <p>Instagram doesn't have a natural integration with many social networks (except Facebook, its parent company) for <a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/courses/instagram-marketing?utm_source=marketing_blog&amp;utm_medium=blog&amp;utm_campaign=instagram_marketing_relaunch\">publishing Instagram posts</a> to other social accounts.</p> <p>But with respect to Pinterest, image-loving platforms stick together. Here's a backdoor way to Pin your latest Instagram Story to Pinterest:</p> <p>On the Instagram mobile app, tap a post to view it in full, then tap the three dots to the top-right of the image. Select \"Copy Share URL\" to attach the picture's link to your clipboard.</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8618.jpg?width=450&amp;name=IMG_8618.jpg\" alt=\"copy an instagram post's link\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" /></p> <p>Open the <a href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.pinterest&amp;hl=en_US\">Pinterest mobile app</a> — or download it; you'll need it for this step — and navigate to your profile page. If you have the latest version of Pinterest downloaded, it might ask you as soon as you open the app if you'd like to produce the image from your clipboard.</p> <p>If not, select the \"+\" icon to the top right to add a new pin, and you'll see a menu of options where you can add your \"Copied Link\" to a new Pin or board on your profile.</p> <a></a> <h3>Instagram Stories Features</h3> <h4>16. Create a collection of saved posts.</h4> <p>In addition to being able to view all of the posts you've liked, Instagram also has an option to save or bookmark certain posts in collections that you create.</p> <p>Start by going to your profile, and tapping the \"Settings\" icon at the top-right of your screen, and then select \"Saved\":</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8585%20copy.jpg?width=450&amp;name=IMG_8585%20copy.jpg\" alt=\"someone's instagram settings to find saved posts\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" /></p> <p>Next, press the \"+\" button and name your new Collection. <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8588-1.jpg?width=450&amp;name=IMG_8588-1.jpg\" alt=\"someone's instagram settings to find saved posts\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" /></p> <p>Click \"Next\", and select images from your \"Saved\" section.</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8589.png?width=450&amp;name=IMG_8589.png\" alt=\"someone's instagram settings to find saved posts\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" /></p> <p>To save photos for future collections, tap the bookmark icon below the post you want to add, as shown below:</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/save%20for%20future%20collections.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=save%20for%20future%20collections.jpeg\" alt=\"save for future collections\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\">Then, go back to your saved photos by following the previous steps.</img></p> <p>You'll see the photos you've saved — to add them to your Collection, select the Collection you want to add to, and tap \"Add to Collection.\" From there, you can add any of your saved photos.</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/add%20to%20new%20instagram%20collection.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=add%20to%20new%20instagram%20collection.jpeg\" alt=\"add to new instagram collection\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> <h4>17. Create Stories Highlights to show Stories for longer than a day.</h4> <p>Like in Snapchat, posts to your story only stick around for your followers to see for 24 hours. But sometimes, you have a story that deserves more daylight to be told.</p> <p>That's where Stories Highlights comes in, a feature by Instagram that allows you to save stories together in the same space on your profile page. If you ever wondered what that \"New\" button with the \"+\" icon was below your profile image, this explains it.</p> <p>To make a Stories Highlight, tap this New option and select any number of past stories in your album:</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/create%20stories%20highlights.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=create%20stories%20highlights.jpeg\" alt=\"create stories highlights\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> <span style=\"font-size: 13px; letter-spacing: 0.01em; text-align: center;\">Image via </span> <a href=\"https://business.instagram.com/blog/stories-highlights-and-archive/\" style=\"font-size: 13px; letter-spacing: 0.01em; text-align: center;\">Instagram</a> <p>Then, give it a cover photo and a name to display as its own Instagram Story on your profile page. You can remove Stories Highlights at any time by tapping and holding down this story.</p> <h4>18. Reorder Instagram Stories highlights.</h4> <p>The Highlights on your Instagram feed act as your brand's portfolio — you can use Highlights to demonstrate your company's values, showcase new products or services, or categorize various topics you post about frequently.</p> <p>For instance, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/thenorthface/?hl=en\">The North Face</a> uses its Highlights section to highlight various initiatives that are important to the brand, including a section labelled \"VOTE\", \"Global Climbing Day 2020\" and \"Summer Basecamp\":</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/change%20order%20instagram%20highlights.png?width=450&amp;name=change%20order%20instagram%20highlights.png\" alt=\"change order instagram highlights\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\">Since a user can only see the first four highlights when they first come across your feed, you'll want to ensure your first highlights are the ones you're most proud of. To do this, simply follow this trick:</img></p> <p>1. Hold down the highlight you'd like moved to the front of this list and click \"Edit Highlight\" when the slide-up appears.</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8571%20copy.jpg?width=450&amp;name=IMG_8571%20copy.jpg\" alt=\"editing a highlight on instagram\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" /></p> <p>2. Next, find an image or video you'd like to add to the highlight. (Don't worry — you'll be able to delete this within 30 seconds, so you don't need to choose one that will stay on the highlight.)</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/edit%20highlight.png?width=450&amp;name=edit%20highlight.png\" alt=\"edit highlight\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\">3. Click \"Done\" in the top right corner.</img></p> <p>4. Now, your Highlight will be first in the list. To remove the image or video you just added, follow the above instructions and simply un-check the image you added. Your highlight will remain at the beginning of the Highlight reel.</p> <h4>19. Change your Instagram Highlights Icon without publishing it to your feed.</h4> <p>The image you choose for each Highlight should accurately depict what type of content users can expect to see if they tap the Highlight, so you'll want to choose a compelling, engaging image.</p> <p>However, if you have a design, logo, or image you'd like to use that isn't in your Instagram feed, it's still possible to make it the Highlight Icon.</p> <p>To do this, click \"Edit Highlight\" (same as the step above):</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8571%20copy-1.jpg?width=450&amp;name=IMG_8571%20copy-1.jpg\" alt=\"clicking on edit highlight button on instagram\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">Next, click \"Edit Cover\". Scroll through your camera roll to find an image you like.</img></p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/edit%20highlight%20cover%20photo.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=edit%20highlight%20cover%20photo.jpeg\" alt=\"edit highlight cover photo\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/new%20photo%20for%20highlight.png?width=450&amp;name=new%20photo%20for%20highlight.png\" alt=\"new photo for highlight\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\">Once you choose an image from your camera roll, click \"Done\". Your Highlight cover image is now an image you've never posted on your Instagram account:</img></p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/new%20image%20for%20highlights.png?width=450&amp;name=new%20image%20for%20highlights.png\" alt=\"new image for highlights\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> <h4>20. Schedule posts in advance.</h4> <p>Instagram being a mobile app, you're probably in a routine of taking photos and posting them to your Instagram Story on the fly. But, you can also pre-post them from your computer for a set day and time in the future.</p> <p>This feature is available with a social media scheduling tool, <a href=\"https://knowledge.hubspot.com/articles/kcs_article/social/how-to-use-instagram-publishing-in-hubspot\">as well as HubSpot</a> if you have an Instagram business account. If you have this business profile, switch to it via the Instagram mobile app and follow the prompts to connect it to Facebook.</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/professional-account.jpg?width=450&amp;name=professional-account.jpg\" alt=\"how to switch to instagram professional account\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" /></p> <p>Depending on the social scheduling tool you use, you might not include this step. Once you've toggled to the right account, however, you'll launch your scheduling tool, navigate to your current connected profiles, and see Instagram as an available integration.</p> <h4>21. Use 'Type Mode' to enhance your Instagram Stories.</h4> <p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-stories\">Instagram Stories</a> is a feature of Instagram that allows you to post ephemeral photos that show up separately from your profile and only last 24 hours. It's a great function for helping like-minded users discover your profile on Instagram's homepage.</p> <p>But since its beginning, Stories have become quite creative, and it takes more than a pretty filter to stand out to your audience. Enter \"Type Mode,\" an option similar to Snapchat that gives you the power to caption Stories that need extra context to resonate with someone. Here's how to use it:</p> <p>1. Open Instagram Stories by swiping right from your Instagram feed. This will launch your smartphone camera. Then, take a photo or video and press the \"Aa\" icon to the top-right of your screen, as shown below:</p> <h4><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8593.jpg?width=450&amp;name=IMG_8593.jpg\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" alt=\"the text button on an instagram story to add text\" /></h4> <p>This \"Aa\" icon will open Type Mode, where you have five fonts to choose from: <strong>Modern</strong>, <strong>Neon</strong>, <strong>Typewriter</strong>, <strong>Strong</strong>, and <strong>Classic</strong>. Here's what a sample Story looks like with Modern font:</p> <h4><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8594-1.jpg?width=450&amp;name=IMG_8594-1.jpg\" alt=\"adding text to instagram story\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" /></h4> <h4>22. Post content from other users to your Instagram Story.</h4> <p>Although Instagram Stories are a great way to give your content exposure on your followers' homepages, you might not always have something Story-worthy. In those times, you can share an inspiring post from someone else through your Instagram Stories. Here's how:</p> <p>1. Find a post you want to share in your Instagram Stories and tap the paper airplane icon, as shown below.</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/post%20content%20from%20other%20users.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=post%20content%20from%20other%20users.jpeg\" alt=\"post content from other users\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> <p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\">Instagram Account: <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/freddysusa/?hl=en\">@Freddysusa</a></p> <p>This icon will open a screen allowing you to send this post to specific followers, or add to your Story. Tap the latter option, as shown below.</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8597-1.jpg?width=450&amp;name=IMG_8597-1.jpg\" alt=\"adding someone's post to my instagram story\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" /></p> <p>Tapping this option will automatically turn the post into an Instagram Story, which you can edit and design to your liking the same way you would any other Instagram Story.</p> <a></a> <h3>Instagram User Preferences Features</h3> <h4>23. Get notifications when your favorite people post.</h4> <p>Never want to miss an Instagram post from your favorite influencers again? You can choose to get a notification every time a specific user posts a new photo. All you have to do is turn on notifications for each user individually.</p> <p>To turn on these notifications, visit a user's profile, click the three dots in the upper right-hand corner of the post, click \"Notifications\" from the menu, and finally toggle on notifications for either posts or stories from the menu that appears.</p> <p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Get%20notifications%20when%20your%20favorite%20people%20post.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=Get%20notifications%20when%20your%20favorite%20people%20post.jpeg\" alt=\"Get notifications when your favorite people post\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8578.jpg?width=450&amp;name=IMG_8578.jpg\" alt=\"someone's instagram account to get notifications when influencers post\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8579.jpg?width=450&amp;name=IMG_8579.jpg\" alt=\"someone's instagram account to get notifications when influencers post\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"><span style=\"font-size: 11px;\">Instagram Account: </span><a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/thesisterstudioig/?hl=en\" style=\"font-size: 11px;\">Jen Reed @thesisterstudioig</a></img></img></img></p> <p>Want to turn post notifications off? Just follow the same steps. It's important to note that you must enable notifications from the Instagram app in your phone's settings — here's how.</p> \n  <ul> \n   <li><strong>To allow notifications on iPhone/iPad:</strong> Go to \"Settings,\" then \"Notifications.\" Choose \"Instagram\" and then turn on the setting to \"Allow Notifications.\"</li> \n   <li><strong>To allow notifications on Android:</strong> Go to \"Settings,\" then choose \"Apps,\" then \"Instagram.\" Select the option to show notifications.</li> \n  </ul> <h4>24. Hide Photos You've Been Tagged In</h4> <p>When someone tags you in a photo or video on Instagram, it's automatically added to your profile under \"Photos of You,\" unless you opt to add tagged photos manually (see the next tip).</p> <p>To see the posts you've been tagged in, go to your own profile and click the person icon below your bio.</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/see%20photos%20youve%20been%20tagged%20in.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=see%20photos%20youve%20been%20tagged%20in.jpeg\" alt=\"see photos youve been tagged in\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\">Next, click on an individual post (any in the group of tagged photos) and click \"Edit\" in the top right. Then, click \"Manually Approve Tags\":</img></p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8607.jpg?width=450&amp;name=IMG_8607.jpg\" alt=\"click manually approve tags to hide photos you're tagged in\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" /></p> <p>Then, to hide the posts you've been tagged in from other users, select the posts you'd like to remove from your profile, and when you're done, tap \"Hide Photos\" at the bottom of your screen. When prompted, tap \"Hide From Profile.\"</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/hide%20from%20profile.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=hide%20from%20profile.jpeg\" alt=\"hide from profile\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> <p>This won't remove the posts themselves from Instagram, but it will remove them from your profile, so you and others can't access them.</p> <h4>25. Adjust your settings to approve tagged photos before they show up in your profile.</h4> <p>As we mentioned in the previous step, when someone tags a photo or video of you on Instagram, it's usually added to your profile automatically. But, you can change your Instagram settings to enable manually selecting which photos you're tagged in that show up on your profile.</p> <p>To add tags manually, follow the same steps above to get to the photos in which you've been tagged, and click \"Edit\" at the top right of your screen. Tap \"Tagging Options,\" and select \"Add Manually.\"</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/approve%20tagged%20photos%20ahead%20of%20time.png?width=450&amp;name=approve%20tagged%20photos%20ahead%20of%20time.png\" alt=\"approve tagged photos ahead of time\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> <p>You'll still be notified when someone tags you in a photo. Once that happens, to manually add a tagged photo to your profile, tap the photo you were tagged in, then tap your username and select \"Show on My Profile.\" And if you'd rather it not be visible, choose \"Hide from My Profile\" instead.</p> <h4>26. Hide ads you don't find relevant.</h4> <p>Instagram tries to show you ads that are interesting and relevant to you. You might see ads based on people you follow and things you Like on Instagram, or the third-party websites and apps you visit.</p> <p>If you see sponsored posts you don't find relevant, though, you can let Instagram know and slowly teach its algorithm what you like and don't like to see.</p> <p>To hide ads on Instagram, tap on the three dots to the right of a post labeled \"Sponsored,\" and choose \"Hide This.\"</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8619.jpg?width=450&amp;name=IMG_8619.jpg\" alt=\"hiding a starbucks ad on instagram\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" /></p> <p>From there, it'll ask you to share why you don't want to see the ad anymore.</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8620.jpg?width=1125&amp;name=IMG_8620.jpg\" alt=\"IMG_8620\" width=\"1125\" style=\"width: 1125px;\" /></p> <p>You can also opt out of seeing ads based on sites and apps off of Instagram and Facebook from your device's settings. Note that even if you choose to opt out of seeing these types of ads, you'll still see ads based on your Instagram and Facebook activity.</p> \n  <ul> \n   <li><strong>To limit ad tracking on an iPhone/iPad:</strong> Go to \"Settings\" and choose \"Privacy,\" then \"Advertising.\" From there, choose the option to \"Limit Ad Tracking\"</li> \n  </ul> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-09-14%20at%202.30.43%20PM.png?width=400&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-09-14%20at%202.30.43%20PM.png\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2020-09-14 at 2.30.43 PM\" width=\"400\" style=\"width: 400px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" /></p> \n  <ul> \n   <li><strong>To turn off interest-based ads on Android: </strong>Go to \"Google Settings,\" then \"Ads.\" From there, choose the option to \"Turn off interest-based ads.\"</li> \n  </ul> <img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/opt-out-interest-based-ads-android.png?width=300&amp;name=opt-out-interest-based-ads-android.png\" alt=\"opt-out-interest-based-ads-android.png\" title=\"opt-out-interest-based-ads-android.png\" width=\"300\" style=\"width: 300px;\"> <h4>27. Send photos privately to your friends.</h4> <p>Posting photos with all of your followers or with the public isn't the only way to share content on Instagram. You can also share them with individual or multiple users, kind of like a Facebook message or group text message.</p> <p>You can either send a new photo to friends, or send a photo that you or someone else has already posted.</p> <p>To send a new photo privately, upload a photo and begin editing it, as you would when editing a new post. When you get to the \"Share\" page, tap the top where it automatically says \"New Post,\" but when prompted, select \"Direct Message.\" From there, you can pick and choose whom you'd like to send the photo to.</p> <p>You can access your direct messages at any time by clicking the mailbox icon at the top right of your homepage.</p> <p>To send an existing photo privately, start by opening the post you want to share — it can be your own or someone else's, as long as the latter has a public account. Next, click the paper-airplane-like icon below the post, then select who you want to receive it when the \"Send to\" box appears.</p> <a></a> <h4>User Search Features</h4> <h4>28. Search Instagram users without an account.</h4> <p>As much as Instagram would like to see you ultimately create an account for yourself or your business, you can peruse the beautiful brands, people, and dogs that are waiting for you without an account to see if it's worth signing up.</p> <p>There are two ways to search for people on Instagram without logging in:</p> <h5>Entering a Username at the End of the Instagram URL</h5> <p>The first way to search users without an account is by using an Instagram username you already know, and adding it to the end of \"www.instagram.com/.\"</p> <p>For example, if you were to start with our Instagram username — which is simply \"HubSpot\" — you can enter the following into your browser's address bar: <a href=\"http://www.instagram.com/hubspot\">www.instagram.com/hubspot</a>. This will bring you to our Instagram profile <em>as well as </em>the elusive search bar at the top of the page:</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/search%20users%20without%20an%20account.png?width=2310&amp;name=search%20users%20without%20an%20account.png\" alt=\"search users without an account\" width=\"2310\" style=\"width: 2310px;\" /></p> <p>Once you've reached this page, you can use the search bar to the left of the \"Sign Up\" button to browse users who are already active on the platform.</p> <h5>Googling Them in an Instagram Site Search</h5> <p>A slightly \"hackier\" way of looking up users without an Instagram account of your own is to simply search their name in a Google site search. This means telling Google to only look up search terms on a website of your choice (in this case, Instagram).</p> <p>To site search a user, open a Google search and type the following: \"<strong>site:instagram.com [name of user]</strong>.\"</p> <p>By keeping all the text prior to the brackets in your search bar, you can shuffle through names of people and businesses and Google will produce results that live <em>only</em> on Instagram. Here's what a site search looks like for HubSpot, below. As you can see, Google produces our main profile, our culture-focused HubSpot Life profile, Instagram posts that include the #hubspot hashtag, and our HubSpot Academy Page.</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/google-site-search-hubspot-instagram.png\" alt=\"Google site search for HubSpot, allowing you to search Instagram users without an account\" /></p> <p><em></em></p> <h4>29. Upload and browse video content on IGTV.</h4> <p>IGTV is one of the biggest new features by Instagram to date. This acronym, as you might assume, stands for \"Instagram TV,\" and it's basically an Explore page just for users' video content. The main benefits of IGTV? You can upload videos more than 60 seconds long, and you can create your own channel with, perhaps, a video series that can be broadcast across other video platforms like YouTube.</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/browse%20igtv.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=browse%20igtv.jpeg\" alt=\"browse igtv\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> <p>Navigate to IGTV by going to your Explore page and selecting \"IGTV\" at the top, as shown above. A page will appear featuring topics and videos by some of the most prolific IGTV video creators on the platform today.</p> <p>As you view more videos, the topics you see on the IGTV homepage will begin to adapt to your interests and serve you more content around those interests. And, naturally, the same goes for your target audience.</p> <p>Create an IGTV channel by tapping the \"+\" icon to the top right of your screen, as shown below:</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/create%20an%20igtv%20channel.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=create%20an%20igtv%20channel.jpeg\" alt=\"create an igtv channel\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> <p>With an IGTV channel created, you can then upload videos directly from your smartphone's camera roll to your channel.</p> <h4>30. Look through pictures without accidentally liking them.</h4> <p>It's pretty easy to learn how to like something on Instagram — so easy, in fact, that people do it accidentally: It's just a quick double tap of the photo once you've entered its full view.</p> <p>The thing is, it's so easy to do quickly by mistake.</p> <p>So, here's a quick Instagram cheat for you: To look through someone's photos without \"double-tap paranoia,\" scroll through Instagram feeds with your phone set to airplane mode. Without internet access, you won't be able to Like a photo, even if you accidentally double-tap it.</p> <p>The pictures won't load in the first place if you start on airplane mode, though. You'll have to go to the feed first to load the posts, then turn on airplane mode, then start scrolling.</p> <p>When you reach the end of the first rows of posts and want to load more, simply turn airplane mode off, let more load, and then turn it on again. Cumbersome? Maybe a little, but it could be worth the paranoia mitigation.</p> \n   <ul> \n    <li><strong>To turn on airplane mode on an iPhone/iPad:</strong> Swipe up from the bottom of the screen and click the airplane icon. Or, go to \"Settings\" and then \"Wi-Fi,\" and switch \"Airplane Mode\" on.</li> \n    <li><strong>To turn on airplane mode on an Android device:</strong> Swipe down from the top of the screen. Then, swipe from right to left until you see \"Settings,\" and then touch it. Touch \"Airplane Mode\" to turn it on.</li> \n   </ul> <h4>31. Browse posts from certain locations.</h4> <p>One fun thing you can do on Instagram is browse photos and videos from a specific location, or taken near your current location. I like to do that when I'm planning a trip somewhere, or want to check out a new restaurant and scroll through the pictures taken there.</p> <p>Here's how to do both of these things.</p> <h5>To Browse Posts From at a Specific Location:</h5> <p>You can either search for a specific place, or you can click into a geotag on an existing photo.</p> <p><strong>To search for a specific place:</strong> Tap the magnifying glass icon at the bottom of your home screen, which will bring you to the general search page. When you click into the search bar at the top, four tabs will appear. Choose \"Places,\" and type in the name of a place. When you press \"Search,\" it'll show you all the top and recent posts that were geotagged with that location.</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/search%20for%20location%20on%20ig.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=search%20for%20location%20on%20ig.jpeg\" alt=\"search for location on ig\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> <p><strong><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/specific%20location%20on%20ig.png?width=450&amp;name=specific%20location%20on%20ig.png\" alt=\"specific location on ig\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></strong><strong>To look at posts with a certain geotag:</strong> Go to the photo that's geotagged with that location, and click the geotag. It'll show you all the top and recent posts that were geotagged with that location.</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/geotag%20fenway%20park.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=geotag%20fenway%20park.jpeg\" alt=\"geotag fenway park\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/geotag%20on%20ig.png?width=450&amp;name=geotag%20on%20ig.png\" alt=\"geotag on ig\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> <h5>Browse Posts Near Your Current Location:</h5> <p>Follow the same instructions above to get to \"Places.\" Tap the search bar, and select \"Near Current Location.\"</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/browse%20instagram%20near%20current%20location.png?width=450&amp;name=browse%20instagram%20near%20current%20location.png\" alt=\"browse instagram near current location\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> <p>Choose which geotag you'd like to browse from the options that appear. Let's say I chose to browse posts with the Museum of Science geotag. When I click \"Museum of Science, Boston\" on the menu, I'll see the top and recent posts that were geotagged at that location.</p> <h3>How to Get Verified on Instagram</h3> <p>A verified badge (the blue check beside a celebrity or brand account name) tells users that you're, in Instagram's words, \"the authentic presence of a notable public figure, celebrity, global brand or entity it represents\".</p> <p>For instance, there are plenty of \"Reese Witherspoon\" fan pages on Instagram, but there's only one <em>real </em>Reese Witherspoon account, as verified by the blue badge:</p> <p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/verify%20account%20reese%20witherspoon.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=verify%20account%20reese%20witherspoon.jpeg\" alt=\"verify account reese witherspoon\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> <p>To request a verified badge, you must be a public figure, celebrity, or brand and <a href=\"https://help.instagram.com/312685272613322?helpref=related\">meet certain requirements</a>. If you've determined you fit Instagram's criteria for verification, follow these steps to request a badge:</p> \n   <ol type=\"1\"> \n    <li>Go to your profile (the person icon in bottom left corner).</li> \n    <li>Tap the three lines in the top right corner.</li> \n    <li>Click \"Settings\" &gt; \"Account\" &gt; \"Request Verification\"</li> \n    <li>Fill out the form, including username, Full Name, Known As, Category, and government-issued phoot ID.</li> \n    <li>When you've filled out all form fields, click \"Send\".</li> \n   </ol> <p>It's important to note, you won't necessarily receive a verified badge if you request one. Learn more about what happens <a href=\"https://help.instagram.com/461238577687001\">after you request a verified badge</a>.</p> <h2><strong>Instagram Features &amp; Hacks</strong></h2> <p>I might be biased, but Instagram is one of the most fun (and visually appealing) social apps around. And now, with these tricks, you can use it to an even fuller extent.</p> <p>Plus, many of these features can help to enhance your brand's presence on Instagram. Now, you know how to use the app more efficiently, to make sure you're only tagged in photos you want to appear on your profile, and have even more ways to engage with the people by whom you'd like to be discovered.</p> <p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=4412d29d-6275-43cf-9c55-936f4fc50114&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"Instagram Hacks\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/4412d29d-6275-43cf-9c55-936f4fc50114.png\" /></a></p> <p></p> <img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Finstagram-features-tricks&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" -fs/hubfs/professional-account-1.jpg?width=450&name=professional-account-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn26@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-50-267_6a5298491a99d589.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/instagram-shoppable-post.jpg?width=350&name=instagram-shoppable-post.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn84@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-26-56-959_d4b9a803b6787fee.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/0bbb2a75b44c18506923b75ffceb2a1a.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn85@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-58-131_0026a100ad1c992b.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8618.jpg?width=450&name=IMG_8618.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn80@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-50-002_0dc20088abb9aed5.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8585%20copy.jpg?width=450&name=IMG_8585%20copy.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn95@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-52-056_9f2110bfbdc9e3be.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8588-1.jpg?width=450&name=IMG_8588-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn28@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-50-108_1060ca79fae059ae.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8589.png?width=450&name=IMG_8589.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn24@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-53-245_882acb35fea67b1b.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/save%20for%20future%20collections.jpeg?width=450&name=save%20for%20future%20collections.jpeg":null,"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/add%20to%20new%20instagram%20collection.jpeg?width=450&name=add%20to%20new%20instagram%20collection.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn36@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-51-475_7abbc3071d92b6e0.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/create%20stories%20highlights.jpeg?width=450&name=create%20stories%20highlights.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn40@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-51-407_ade7a951c66896fa.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/change%20order%20instagram%20highlights.png?width=450&name=change%20order%20instagram%20highlights.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn32@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-51-866_ac978125b17693f2.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8571%20copy.jpg?width=450&name=IMG_8571%20copy.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn20@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-53-667_59cfc7b90355dda0.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/edit%20highlight.png?width=450&name=edit%20highlight.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn64@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-56-574_ad5b2c2e6b8d4f5e.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8571%20copy-1.jpg?width=450&name=IMG_8571%20copy-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn34@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-56-353_e92e8a0b681f38d8.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/edit%20highlight%20cover%20photo.jpeg?width=450&name=edit%20highlight%20cover%20photo.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn9@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-54-719_d488d28cb3ec8ce3.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/new%20photo%20for%20highlight.png?width=450&name=new%20photo%20for%20highlight.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn74@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-55-441_cce9aa0dcf708d82.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/new%20image%20for%20highlights.png?width=450&name=new%20image%20for%20highlights.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn89@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-52-428_696c7b570438ba23.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/professional-account.jpg?width=450&name=professional-account.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn8@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-55-432_02e623dc379bb23a.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8593.jpg?width=450&name=IMG_8593.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn57@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-57-218_fa54b99481edb920.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/IMG_8594-1.jpg?width=450&name=IMG_8594-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn100@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-52-430_e7329cb6d0acb568.webp","https://b
