://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn42@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-53-029_73532a511645a1ba.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/opt-out-interest-based-ads-android.png?width=300&name=opt-out-interest-based-ads-android.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn52@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-51-111_31d77267a09cef07.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/search%20users%20without%20an%20account.png?width=2310&name=search%20users%20without%20an%20account.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn98@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-49-369_8f9376aeff41e9a5.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/google-site-search-hubspot-instagram.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn75@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-54-023_5d9a27095d604877.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/browse%20igtv.jpeg?width=450&name=browse%20igtv.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn1@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-54-463_d4bfa21bf092dd00.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/create%20an%20igtv%20channel.jpeg?width=450&name=create%20an%20igtv%20channel.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn71@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-52-829_76b741fe1fce0533.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/search%20for%20location%20on%20ig.jpeg?width=450&name=search%20for%20location%20on%20ig.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn83@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-26-52-787_9856be4b895e7551.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/specific%20location%20on%20ig.png?width=450&name=specific%20location%20on%20ig.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn87@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-54-301_10e91b093cbdfb55.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/geotag%20fenway%20park.jpeg?width=450&name=geotag%20fenway%20park.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn68@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-26-52-938_dcb15cbab9a09395.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/geotag%20on%20ig.png?width=450&name=geotag%20on%20ig.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn5@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-26-51-026_eaf9ea56ffe6136c.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/browse%20instagram%20near%20current%20location.png?width=450&name=browse%20instagram%20near%20current%20location.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn27@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-52-813_e32a5a4788095fdc.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/verify%20account%20reese%20witherspoon.jpeg?width=450&name=verify%20account%20reese%20witherspoon.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn40@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-26-56-253_931a4aeda3fce800.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/4412d29d-6275-43cf-9c55-936f4fc50114.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn59@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-26-54-976_24d298ccd21346c4.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Finstagram-features-tricks&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn54@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-49-471_f51532e82b0b432c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246408218},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"How to Run an Effective Vetting Process for Candidates in 2022","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/vetting-process","description":"<p>Imagine you're a hiring manager and put up an ad for a role. After a lengthy process, you hire someone you think is a great fit.</p> \n<p>Except, reality sets in a few weeks later when you realize they were a bad hire and you have the start all over again. A robust vetting process would help you avoid this costly mistake.</p> \n<p>However, it's not enough to come up with a process, you have to make sure it's inclusive, fair, and efficient. Let's show you how.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=c42148d7-13dd-4c38-b907-cff1602ee62f&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"→ Click here to download our free guide to hiring and training a team of  all-stars [Free Ebook].\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/c42148d7-13dd-4c38-b907-cff1602ee62f.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p></p> \n<p>Hiring the wrong employee can cost companies hundreds of thousands of dollars. Back in 2016, The U.S. Department of Labor estimated this cost was close to 30% of the former employee's first-year earnings.</p> \n<p>Today, that figure could be even higher.</p> \n<p>Undoubtedly, recruiting and hiring candidates is an expensive and time-consuming process. This is on top of figuring out which candidates are <em>most</em> qualified to succeed at your company for the long haul.</p> \n<p>A vetting process should include a few critical elements. Let's cover how to run an effective vetting process that's efficient and free of bias as possible.</p> \n<h2>How long does the vetting process take?</h2> \n<p>The vetting process can take anywhere from a few days to a few weeks depending on what your process looks like, the seniority level for the role, and the industry.</p> \n<p>For instance, a role at the Federal Bureau of Investigation likely has a much longer vetting process than one at a SaaS company. The FBI likely conducts in-depth background checks beyond a candidate's criminal background whereas a SaaS company may focus the bulk of its vetting process on technical proficiency.</p> \n<p>Over time, your company will start compiling data on how long the process takes based on the factors mentioned above and build its strategy based on that.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h3>1. Write an accurate job description.</h3> \n<p>Your vetting process will be easier start-to-finish if you take the time to write an accurate and compelling job description.</p> \n<p>I spoke to <a href=\"https://ie.linkedin.com/in/clairebmccarthy\">Claire McCarthy</a>, team lead in sales recruiting, who told me the job description can help both you and the candidate ensure a mutually beneficial fit from the start.</p> \n<p>\"We have pretty comprehensive job descriptions and we want candidates to take the time to read them and ensure the role is a good match for their background and skillset, as well as their long-term goals,\" she said.</p> \n<p>McCarthy adds that it's valuable to focus on attributes when creating your job description.</p> \n<p>\"For instance, for a sales role, we might list 'customer-first mentality' as a requirement,\" she said.</p> \n<p>In addition, craft your description to attract a wide pool of diverse applicants, since diverse teams perform better, and come up with more innovative ideas.</p> \n<p>This is important because a<a href=\"https://hbr.org/2014/08/why-women-dont-apply-for-jobs-unless-theyre-100-qualified\"> </a><a href=\"https://hbr.org/2014/08/why-women-dont-apply-for-jobs-unless-theyre-100-qualified\">Hewlett Packard internal report found</a> that women historically won't apply for a job unless they meet all the qualifications, while most men will apply if they meet only 60% of them.</p> \n<p>However, it doesn't only affect candidates from a gender perspective. Racism, ableism, and ageism can also impact the hiring process – and it all starts with your job description.</p> \n<p>To do so, you can rely on tools like <a href=\"https://textio.com/\">Textio</a>, which help you identify and remove implicit and explicit biased language from your job description.</p> \n<p>The goal is to use inclusive language that welcomes and attracts a diverse range of talent.</p> \n<p>Take a look at the <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/marketing-job-descriptions\">marketing job descriptions</a> you should recruit and hire to have an all-star team.</p> \n<h3>2. Leverage software to review candidates' application materials.</h3> \n<p>A vetting process should allow you to filter out candidates who don't have the skills necessary to succeed in the role. To do this, start by vetting the applicant's <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-write-a-resume\">resume</a>, cover letter, and other application materials they've submitted for review.</p> \n<p>Additionally, a vetting process can support your diversity and inclusion initiative by ensuring your HR team remains fair and unbiased when evaluating potential candidates.</p> \n<p>For instance, you might implement a blind search system in which resumes are scanned by software, such as <a href=\"https://www.greenhouse.io/\">Greenhouse</a>.</p> \n<p>By ensuring your resumes are automatically sorted based on skill, you're circumventing some of the unintentional biases that might lead your HR employees to make unfair judgments.</p> \n<h3>3. Use video interviews prior to phone calls.</h3> \n<p>There are certain questions you can ask to decipher whether or not a candidate has the correct skills for the role.</p> \n<p>You don't want your recruiters spending valuable time on phone calls when you can just as easily collect that information another way.</p> \n<p>At HubSpot, our hiring process includes video interviews, in which candidates must answer a series of questions and submit their recorded responses. The caveat here is that they must answer each question within a minute and they won't know what the questions are ahead of time.</p> \n<p>\"We do this for high volume roles, and use the video interview as a qualifier for whether or not the candidate moves forward with a phone interview,\" said McCarthy.</p> \n<p>Consider using video interviews to limit the amount of phone calls your HR team needs to make each day.</p> \n<h3>4. Evaluate candidates' qualifications using additional assessment tools.</h3> \n<p>To evaluate whether your candidate will succeed in the role, consider offering initial assessments.</p> \n<p>As a HubSpot writer, I was asked to write a blog post from scratch using one of HubSpot's prompt topics before being invited for an interview. This makes sense – why waste your time, and your candidate's time, if they don't have the skills you're looking for?</p> \n<p>From the candidate's perspective, it allows them to get a taste of what the role requires and show off why they're right for it.</p> \n<p>You might consider offering role plays for customer-facing positions, case studies for functional roles, or coding assessments for engineering positions.</p> \n<h3>5. Trust the process.</h3> \n<p>The point of having a process is to ensure consistency and promote fairness.</p> \n<p>This means across all tools and software you utilize just as much as the steps you follow.</p> \n<p>Ultimately, a vetting process is only effective if it's consistent and replicable.</p> \n<p>\"A vetting process is about establishing a process at the beginning and sticking to it,\" said McCarthy. \"Additionally, it's important to use a vetting process to operationalize how we review candidates and decide which ones are most qualified to move forward to next steps.\"</p> \n<p>Using these five tactics will mitigate the time and money your HR team spends on recruitment in 2022 while ensuring you hire the best applicants – a win all around.</p> \n<em>Editor's Note: This post was originally published in January 2019 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.&nbsp;</em>\n<br> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=20fe7a4f-8bfb-4924-9046-ef5a2f3f3c33&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"New Call-to-action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/20fe7a4f-8bfb-4924-9046-ef5a2f3f3c33.png\"></a> </p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fvetting-process&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 23 Feb 2022 12:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/c42148d7-13dd-4c38-b907-cff1602ee62f.png","linkMd5":"30588118e842c8415a4177c0c867f8ca","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn19@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-48-385_83b23746ffd9fffb.webp","destWidth":840,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":8139,"destBytes":13774,"author":"Caroline Forsey","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/c42148d7-13dd-4c38-b907-cff1602ee62f.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn19@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-48-385_83b23746ffd9fffb.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/20fe7a4f-8bfb-4924-9046-ef5a2f3f3c33.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn60@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-26-51-051_e4e09f6d3d81a2f6.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fvetting-process&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn44@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-26-50-654_cc5c7e20b7a48857.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246408224},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:26:48","title":"What Is Brand Perception? How to Measure It and 4 Examples","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/what-is-brand-perception","description":"<p>If you take a second to think about your shopping habits, you'll probably realize that a majority of the products you buy are influenced by brand perception. You're not the only one — <a href=\"https://learn.g2.com/branding-statistics\"><span>77% of B2C consumers</span></a> make purchasing decisions based solely on the brand name.</p>  \n<p>Brand perception, or the thoughts and feelings associated with a company, impacts why people wear a certain brand of clothing or pick one pasta sauce over another at the grocery store. Once consumers adopt an attitude about a brand, it's tough to change. That's why brands work hard to create positive associations in people's minds, rather than negative or neutral perceptions.</p> \n<p>When you know how people perceive your brand, it's easier to shape its reputation, help consumers understand what sets it apart, and develop brand equity. You do this by measuring brand perception and tracking customer sentiment over time.</p> \n<p>But before diving into the metrics, it's important to understand what creates brand perception and how it informs company and consumer decision-making.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=814dd420-0d49-40e0-b59c-f01066e186c1&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Download Now: Free Brand Building Guide\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/814dd420-0d49-40e0-b59c-f01066e186c1.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<h2>What is brand perception?</h2> \n<p>Brand perception is the sum of a consumer's feelings, experiences, and thoughts about a product or service. It's what people believe a brand represents, rather than what a brand says it represents.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/brand%20perception-v1.jpg?width=1794&amp;name=brand%20perception-v1.jpg\" alt=\"How to Understand the Value of Brand perception\" width=\"1794\" style=\"width: 1794px;\"></p> \n<p>Although brand perception is a mental association, it plays an essential role in creating emotional connections with consumers. People consider their attitude toward brands when choosing between competing products. They read reviews, chat with customer support, compare options with friends, or sign up for a free trial. All of these touchpoints affect brand perception and impact a company's success.</p> \n<p>If consumers think highly of a brand, they become more loyal to it. Consider how this dynamic plays out in everyday life. People get in meme wars over <a href=\"https://www.google.com/search?q=apple+vs+android+meme&amp;client=firefox-b-1-d&amp;source=lnms&amp;tbm=isch&amp;sa=X&amp;ved=2ahUKEwiT_ryuu_r0AhVKaM0KHf2QAxcQ_AUoAXoECAEQAw&amp;biw=1423&amp;bih=741&amp;dpr=2#imgrc=QFWJsh5kwFIW0M\"><span>Apple versus Android</span></a> products. A person who wears Nike shoes usually won't be caught in Adidas kicks. And you probably won't find Coca-Cola and Pepsi in the same fridge.</p> \n<p>Companies that understand brand perception use this information to develop <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/brand-equity\"><span>brand equity</span></a>. While brand perception can be narrowed down to what one customer thinks about your brand, brand equity is the combination of people's perceptions, experiences, and opinions that creates your reputation. A company with high brand equity attracts loyal customers who pick your product or service when given the choice between competitors.</p> \n<p>When a customer is <a href=\"https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2019/11/customer-loyalty-survey.html\"><span>loyal to a brand</span></a>, 86% will recommend it to friends or family and 66% are likely to write a positive review. Those actions drive company growth and improve brand perception, which only helps your business.</p> \n<p>Although it may seem that brand perception is out of your hands, you can take steps to measure it and improve people's attitudes.</p> \n<h2>How to Measure Brand Perception</h2> \n<p>Data can help you understand how consumers, employees, stakeholders, and competitors perceive your brand. Since brand perception is a combination of reviews, reputation, experience, functionality, advertising, social engagement, and customer use, you should gather metrics from multiple sources.</p> \n<p>Here's how to measure brand perception:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Conduct brand perception surveys</strong> to learn what people think of your business and how it stacks up against competitors. Ask questions that touch on emotional, cognitive, and action-oriented factors, such as these examples from <a href=\"https://www.qualtrics.com/uk/experience-management/brand/perception-surveys/\"><span>Qualtrics</span></a>: \n  <ul> \n   <li>When you think of [the brand], what comes to mind first?</li> \n   <li>Which of the following words describe [the brand]?</li> \n   <li>What kind of feelings do you experience when you think of [the brand]?</li> \n   <li>How would you describe your level of emotional attachment to [the brand]?</li> \n   <li>How would you describe [the brand] to a friend?</li> \n   <li>How would you describe your last experience with [the brand]?</li> \n   <li>On a scale of 1-10, how likely are you to recommend [the brand] to a friend or colleague?</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li><strong>Track online mentions</strong> using <a href=\"https://info.campussonar.com/social-listening-basics\">social listening</a> tools or Google alerts. You want to monitor social media comments, online reviews, relevant hashtags, forums (i.e. Reddit and Quora), and news mentions. As the brand grows, so will this dataset. I recommend creating a system to handle negative mentions as soon as possible and stay on top of talk about your brand, products, and marketing campaigns.</li> \n <li><strong>Do a brand audit</strong> to evaluate how your brand perception compares to competitors'. This should include research on primary and secondary target audiences, a competitive analysis of your products or services, a thorough evaluation of your communications strategy, and a deep dive into your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/brand-positioning-strategy\"><span>brand positioning</span></a>. (I recommend referencing this brand audit guide from <a href=\"https://visme.co/blog/brand-audit/\"><span>Visme</span></a>).</li> \n <li><strong>Collect data from customers</strong> at each point of the <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/what-is-the-buyers-journey\"><span>buyer's journey</span></a>. This can include how buyers research information, evaluate products, compare between competitors, interact with customer support, make a purchase decision, onboard, and interact with the brand post-purchase.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Once you have enough data to measure brand perception, you can evaluate if consumer sentiment aligns with your brand identity. If so, stay the course. If not, you can learn how to improve <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/service/improve-customer-perception\"><span>consumer brand perception</span></a>.</p> \n<h2>Brand Perception Examples</h2> \n<p>From PR campaigns to packaging, brand perception is influenced by every touchpoint people have with a company. The following brand perception examples show how businesses can shape consumer sentiments so the inner identity matches the outer image.</p> \n<h3>1. Snickers</h3> \n<p>Candy lovers can choose between dozens of chocolate-covered bars, so what makes someone grab a Snickers instead of a Kit Kat? Yes, it may be taste or preference, but the brand has designed clever campaigns to make people believe that eating Snickers will transform you from hangry and unfocused to sharp and satisfied.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/DZdvFTgmeo0\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<h3>2. Orangetheory</h3> \n<p>You may have driven past one of these orange-hued workout studios on your daily commute or taken an online class during the pandemic. And while fitness crazes come and go, Orangetheory has carved out a brand perception that's kept the company going strong since 2010. The community-oriented classes make it the right fit for people looking to connect and compete with neighbors while working up a sweat. It's more casual than Crossfit but kicks up the intensity compared to group classes at national gyms, like Planet Fitness and LA Fitness.<img src=\"https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/ME__19BmV3Gala0b9NqcYZWJKV0IlAbLZL9yAnJuGUhHivg3UmUYK1DhiqTHmySWmdOhbnQ4STomwJRFff8Pxigjmpi6HvcWyAR3WY7kYZnpUMAswU3pCECqqMobzxwCeP76S2gA\" width=\"455\" height=\"546\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" alt=\"Orange Theory Fitness Brand Perception\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://tombras.com/campaign/orangetheory-fitness\">Image Source</a></p> \n<h3>3. Zoom</h3> \n<p>An innovative and beloved video platform at the start of the pandemic, Zoom quickly became the cause of remote workers' burnout. People loved how it kept them connected to teams, families, and friends.</p> \n<p>But the constant connection led to \"Zoom fatigue,\" an informal diagnosis that's been covered by Healthline, <a href=\"https://news.stanford.edu/2021/02/23/four-causes-zoom-fatigue-solutions/\"><span>Stanford</span></a>, the New York Times, and more. While companies still rely on Zoom for virtual meetings, the brand has had to adjust from its original \"Video conferencing that doesn't suck\" vibe to \"How the world connects\" as <a href=\"https://adage.com/article/marketing-news-strategy/zoom-launches-ad-campaign-aiming-keep-growing-beyond-pandemic/2364921\"><span>consumers shifted their perceptions</span></a>.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Zoom-Meetings.jpg?width=624&amp;name=Zoom-Meetings.jpg\" alt=\"Zoom fatigue meme: 1st day of Zoom meetings vs. 14th day of Zoom meetings\" width=\"624\" style=\"width: 624px;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://www.remote.tools/memes/zoom-memes\"><span>Image Source</span></a></p> \n<h3>4. Patagonia</h3> \n<p>The outdoor gear brand became famous for its innovative clothing and focus on responsible manufacturing, but a change in consumer perception caused the company to double down on its sustainability-driven identity.</p> \n<p>In the early 2010s, people began referring to the company as Patagucci — a satirical name that poked fun at the brand's high prices and its adoption among high-income workers. To sway consumers from placing Patagonia in the fast-fashion category, the company has launched a number of sustainability-focused initiatives, like its Worn Wear line of recycled clothing.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/cMgfVenLRSI\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Knowing what people think of your brand is an important part of developing a successful business. It gives you the information you need to shape your brand identity, create impactful marketing campaigns, and make changes when consumer perception shifts.</p> \n<p>Now that you know how to measure brand perception, you can use it as a tool to make strategic brand decisions and drive your company forward.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=ddbf2eb7-04e8-44b2-9e05-b21264e09b65&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"brand consistency\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/ddbf2eb7-04e8-44b2-9e05-b21264e09b65.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img
